book.description: 24-JER-asv.sfm The American Standard Version of the Holy Bible (1901) Tuesday, September 12, 2006

contents.verseText: The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, of the priests that were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin:
contents: The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, of the priests that were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin:

contents.verseText: to whom the word of Jehovah came in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign.
contents: to whom the word of Jehovah came in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his
reign.

contents.verseText: It came also in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, unto the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, unto the carrying away of Jerusalem captive in the fifth month.
contents: It came also in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, unto the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah, the
son of Josiah, king of Judah, unto the carrying away of Jerusalem captive in the fifth month.

contents.verseText: Now the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
contents: Now the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,

contents.verseText: Before I formed thee in the belly I knew thee, and before thou camest forth out of the womb I sanctified thee; I have appointed thee a prophet unto the nations.
contents: Before I formed thee in the belly I knew thee, and before thou camest forth out of the womb I sanctified thee; I have
appointed thee a prophet unto the nations.

contents.verseText: Then said I, Ah, Lord Jehovah! behold, I know not how to speak; for I am a child.
contents: Then said I, Ah, Lord Jehovah! behold, I know not how to speak; for I am a child.

contents.verseText: But Jehovah said unto me, Say not, I am a child; for to whomsoever I shall send thee thou shalt go, and whatsoever I shall command thee thou shalt speak.
contents: But Jehovah said unto me, Say not, I am a child; for to whomsoever I shall send thee thou shalt go, and whatsoever I shall
command thee thou shalt speak.

contents.verseText: Be not afraid because of them; for I am with thee to deliver thee, saith Jehovah.
contents: Be not afraid because of them; for I am with thee to deliver thee, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Then Jehovah put forth his hand, and touched my mouth; and Jehovah said unto me, Behold, I have put my words in thy mouth:
contents: Then Jehovah put forth his hand, and touched my mouth; and Jehovah said unto me, Behold, I have put my words in thy mouth:

contents.verseText: see, I have this day set thee over the nations and over the kingdoms, to pluck up and to break down and to destroy and to overthrow, to build and to plant.
contents: see, I have this day set thee over the nations and over the kingdoms, to pluck up and to break down and to destroy and to
overthrow, to build and to plant.

contents.verseText: Moreover the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying, Jeremiah, what seest thou? And I said, I see a rod of an almond-tree.
contents: Moreover the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying, Jeremiah, what seest thou? And I said, I see a rod of an almond-tree.

contents.verseText: Then said Jehovah unto me, Thou hast well seen: for I watch over my word to perform it.
contents: Then said Jehovah unto me, Thou hast well seen: for I watch over my word to perform it.

contents.verseText: And the word of Jehovah came unto me the second time, saying, What seest thou? And I said, I see a boiling caldron; and the face thereof is from the north.
contents: And the word of Jehovah came unto me the second time, saying, What seest thou? And I said, I see a boiling caldron; and
the face thereof is from the north.

contents.verseText: Then Jehovah said unto me, Out of the north evil shall break forth upon all the inhabitants of the land.
contents: Then Jehovah said unto me, Out of the north evil shall break forth upon all the inhabitants of the land.

contents.verseText: For, lo, I will call all the families of the kingdoms of the north, saith Jehovah; and they shall come, and they shall set every one his throne at the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem, and against all the walls thereof round about, and against all the cities of Judah.
contents: For, lo, I will call all the families of the kingdoms of the north, saith Jehovah; and they shall come, and they shall
set every one his throne at the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem, and against all the walls thereof round about, and against
all the cities of Judah.

contents.verseText: And I will utter my judgments against them touching all their wickedness, in that they have forsaken me, and have burned incense unto other gods, and worshipped the works of their own hands.
contents: And I will utter my judgments against them touching all their wickedness, in that they have forsaken me, and have burned
incense unto other gods, and worshipped the works of their own hands.

contents.verseText: Thou therefore gird up thy loins, and arise, and speak unto them all that I command thee: be not dismayed at them, lest I dismay thee before them.
contents: Thou therefore gird up thy loins, and arise, and speak unto them all that I command thee: be not dismayed at them, lest I
dismay thee before them.

contents.verseText: For, behold, I have made thee this day a fortified city, and an iron pillar, and brazen walls, against the whole land, against the kings of Judah, against the princes thereof, against the priests thereof, and against the people of the land.
contents: For, behold, I have made thee this day a fortified city, and an iron pillar, and brazen walls, against the whole land,
against the kings of Judah, against the princes thereof, against the priests thereof, and against the people of the land.

contents.verseText: And they shall fight against thee; but they shall not prevail against thee: for I am with thee, saith Jehovah, to deliver thee.
contents: And they shall fight against thee; but they shall not prevail against thee: for I am with thee, saith Jehovah, to deliver
thee.

contents.verseText: And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
contents: And the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,

contents.verseText: Go, and cry in the ears of Jerusalem, saying, Thus saith Jehovah, I remember for thee the kindness of thy youth, the love of thine espousals; how thou wentest after me in the wilderness, in a land that was not sown.
contents: Go, and cry in the ears of Jerusalem, saying, Thus saith Jehovah, I remember for thee the kindness of thy youth, the love
of thine espousals; how thou wentest after me in the wilderness, in a land that was not sown.

contents.verseText: Israel was holiness unto Jehovah, the first-fruits of his increase: all that devour him shall be held guilty; evil shall come upon them, saith Jehovah.
contents: Israel
holiness unto Jehovah, the first-fruits of his increase: all that devour him shall be held guilty;
evil shall come upon them, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Hear ye the word of Jehovah, O house of Jacob, and all the families of the house of Israel:
contents: Hear ye the word of Jehovah, O house of Jacob, and all the families of the house of Israel:

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah, What unrighteousness have your fathers found in me, that they are gone far from me, and have walked after vanity, and are become vain?
contents: Thus saith Jehovah, What unrighteousness have your fathers found in me, that they are gone far from me, and have walked
after vanity, and are become vain?

contents.verseText: Neither said they, Where is Jehovah that brought us up out of the land of Egypt, that led us through the wilderness, through a land of deserts and of pits, through a land of drought and of the shadow of death, through a land that none passed through, and where no man dwelt?
contents: Neither said they, Where is Jehovah that brought us up out of the land of Egypt, that led us through the wilderness,
through a land of deserts and of pits, through a land of drought and of the shadow of death, through a land that none passed
through, and where no man dwelt?

contents.verseText: And I brought you into a plentiful land, to eat the fruit thereof and the goodness thereof; but when ye entered, ye defiled my land, and made my heritage an abomination.
contents: And I brought you into a plentiful land, to eat the fruit thereof and the goodness thereof; but when ye entered, ye
defiled my land, and made my heritage an abomination.

contents.verseText: The priests said not, Where is Jehovah? and they that handle the law knew me not: the rulers also transgressed against me, and the prophets prophesied by Baal, and walked after things that do not profit.
contents: The priests said not, Where is Jehovah? and they that handle the law knew me not: the rulers also transgressed against me,
and the prophets prophesied by Baal, and walked after things that do not profit.

contents.verseText: Wherefore I will yet contend with you, saith Jehovah, and with your children’s children will I contend.
contents: Wherefore I will yet contend with you, saith Jehovah, and with your children’s children will I contend.

contents.verseText: For pass over to the isles of Kittim, and see; and send unto Kedar, and consider diligently; and see if there hath been such a thing.
contents: For pass over to the isles of Kittim, and see; and send unto Kedar, and consider diligently; and see if there hath been
such a thing.

contents.verseText: Hath a nation changed its gods, which yet are no gods? but my people have changed their glory for that which doth not profit.
contents: Hath a nation changed
gods, which yet are no gods? but my people have changed their glory for that which
doth not profit.

contents.verseText: Be astonished, O ye heavens, at this, and be horribly afraid, be ye very desolate, saith Jehovah.
contents: Be astonished, O ye heavens, at this, and be horribly afraid, be ye very desolate, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: For my people have committed two evils: they have forsaken me, the fountain of living waters, and hewed them out cisterns, broken cisterns, that can hold no water.
contents: For my people have committed two evils: they have forsaken me, the fountain of living waters, and hewed them out
cisterns, broken cisterns, that can hold no water.

contents.verseText: Is Israel a servant? is he a home-born slave? why is he become a prey?
contents: Is Israel a servant? is he a home-born
? why is he become a prey?

contents.verseText: The young lions have roared upon him, and yelled; and they have made his land waste: his cities are burned up, without inhabitant.
contents: The young lions have roared upon him, and yelled; and they have made his land waste: his cities are burned up, without
inhabitant.

contents.verseText: The children also of Memphis and Tahpanhes have broken the crown of thy head.
contents: The children also of Memphis and Tahpanhes have broken the crown of thy head.

contents.verseText: Hast thou not procured this unto thyself, in that thou hast forsaken Jehovah thy God, when he led thee by the way?
contents: Hast thou not procured this unto thyself, in that thou hast forsaken Jehovah thy God, when he led thee by the way?

contents.verseText: And now what hast thou to do in the way to Egypt, to drink the waters of the Shihor? or what hast thou to do in the way to Assyria, to drink the waters of the River?
contents: And now what hast thou to do in the way to Egypt, to drink the waters of the Shihor? or what hast thou to do in the way
to Assyria, to drink the waters of the River?

contents.verseText: Thine own wickedness shall correct thee, and thy backslidings shall reprove thee: know therefore and see that it is an evil thing and a bitter, that thou hast forsaken Jehovah thy God, and that my fear is not in thee, saith the Lord, Jehovah of hosts.
contents: Thine own wickedness shall correct thee, and thy backslidings shall reprove thee: know therefore and see that it is an
evil thing and a bitter, that thou hast forsaken Jehovah thy God, and that my fear is not in thee, saith the Lord, Jehovah of
hosts.

contents.verseText: For of old time I have broken thy yoke, and burst thy bonds; and thou saidst, I will not serve; for upon every high hill and under every green tree thou didst bow thyself, playing the harlot.
contents: For of old time I have broken thy yoke, and burst thy bonds; and thou saidst, I will not serve; for upon every high hill
and under every green tree thou didst bow thyself, playing the harlot.

contents.verseText: Yet I had planted thee a noble vine, wholly a right seed: how then art thou turned into the degenerate branches of a foreign vine unto me?
contents: Yet I had planted thee a noble vine, wholly a right seed: how then art thou turned into the degenerate branches of a
foreign vine unto me?

contents.verseText: For though thou wash thee with lye, and take thee much soap, yet thine iniquity is marked before me, saith the Lord Jehovah.
contents: For though thou wash thee with lye, and take thee much soap, yet thine iniquity is marked before me, saith the Lord
Jehovah.

contents.verseText: How canst thou say, I am not defiled, I have not gone after the Baalim? see thy way in the valley, know what thou hast done: thou art a swift dromedary traversing her ways;
contents: How canst thou say, I am not defiled, I have not gone after the Baalim? see thy way in the valley, know what thou hast
done:
a swift dromedary traversing her ways;

contents.verseText: a wild ass used to the wilderness, that snuffeth up the wind in her desire; in her occasion who can turn her away? all they that seek her will not weary themselves; in her month they shall find her.
contents: a wild ass used to the wilderness, that snuffeth up the wind in her desire; in her occasion who can turn her away? all
they that seek her will not weary themselves; in her month they shall find her.

contents.verseText: Withhold thy foot from being unshod, and thy throat from thirst. But thou saidst, It is in vain; no, for I have loved strangers, and after them will I go.
contents: Withhold thy foot from being unshod, and thy throat from thirst. But thou saidst, It is in vain; no, for I have loved
strangers, and after them will I go.

contents.verseText: As the thief is ashamed when he is found, so is the house of Israel ashamed; they, their kings, their princes, and their priests, and their prophets;
contents: As the thief is ashamed when he is found, so is the house of Israel ashamed; they, their kings, their princes, and their
priests, and their prophets;

contents.verseText: who say to a stock, Thou art my father; and to a stone, Thou hast brought me forth: for they have turned their back unto me, and not their face; but in the time of their trouble they will say, Arise, and save us.
contents: who say to a stock, Thou art my father; and to a stone, Thou hast brought me forth: for they have turned their back unto
me, and not their face; but in the time of their trouble they will say, Arise, and save us.

contents.verseText: But where are thy gods that thou hast made thee? let them arise, if they can save thee in the time of thy trouble: for according to the number of thy cities are thy gods, O Judah.
contents: But where are thy gods that thou hast made thee? let them arise, if they can save thee in the time of thy trouble: for
according to the number of thy cities are thy gods, O Judah.

contents.verseText: Wherefore will ye contend with me? ye all have transgressed against me, saith Jehovah.
contents: Wherefore will ye contend with me? ye all have transgressed against me, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: In vain have I smitten your children; they received no correction: your own sword hath devoured your prophets, like a destroying lion.
contents: In vain have I smitten your children; they received no correction: your own sword hath devoured your prophets, like a
destroying lion.

contents.verseText: O generation, see ye the word of Jehovah. Have I been a wilderness unto Israel? or a land of thick darkness? wherefore say my people, We are broken loose; we will come no more unto thee?
contents: O generation, see ye the word of Jehovah. Have I been a wilderness unto Israel? or a land of thick darkness? wherefore
say my people, We are broken loose; we will come no more unto thee?

contents.verseText: Can a virgin forget her ornaments, or a bride her attire? yet my people have forgotten me days without number.
contents: Can a virgin forget her ornaments, or a bride her attire? yet my people have forgotten me days without number.

contents.verseText: How trimmest thou thy way to seek love! therefore even the wicked women hast thou taught thy ways.
contents: How trimmest thou thy way to seek love! therefore even the wicked women hast thou taught thy ways.

contents.verseText: Also in thy skirts is found the blood of the souls of the innocent poor: thou didst not find them breaking in; but it is because of all these things.
contents: Also in thy skirts is found the blood of the souls of the innocent poor: thou didst not find them breaking in; but it is
because of all these things.

contents.verseText: Yet thou saidst, I am innocent; surely his anger is turned away from me. Behold, I will enter into judgment with thee, because thou sayest, I have not sinned.
contents: Yet thou saidst, I am innocent; surely his anger is turned away from me. Behold, I will enter into judgment with thee,
because thou sayest, I have not sinned.

contents.verseText: Why gaddest thou about so much to change thy way? thou shalt be ashamed of Egypt also, as thou wast ashamed of Assyria.
contents: Why gaddest thou about so much to change thy way? thou shalt be ashamed of Egypt also, as thou wast ashamed of Assyria.

contents.verseText: From thence also shalt thou go forth, with thy hands upon thy head: for Jehovah hath rejected those in whom thou trustest, and thou shalt not prosper with them.
contents: From thence also shalt thou go forth, with thy hands upon thy head: for Jehovah hath rejected those in whom thou
trustest, and thou shalt not prosper with them.

contents.verseText: They say, If a man put away his wife, and she go from him, and become another man’s, will he return unto her again? will not that land be greatly polluted? But thou hast played the harlot with many lovers; yet return again to me, saith Jehovah.
contents: They say, If a man put away his wife, and she go from him, and become another man’s, will he return unto her again? will
not that land be greatly polluted? But thou hast played the harlot with many lovers; yet return again to me, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Lift up thine eyes unto the bare heights, and see; where hast thou not been lain with? By the ways hast thou sat for them, as an Arabian in the wilderness; and thou hast polluted the land with thy whoredoms and with thy wickedness.
contents: Lift up thine eyes unto the bare heights, and see; where hast thou not been lain with? By the ways hast thou sat for them,
as an Arabian in the wilderness; and thou hast polluted the land with thy whoredoms and with thy wickedness.

contents.verseText: Therefore the showers have been withholden, and there hath been no latter rain; yet thou hadst a harlot’s forehead, thou refusedst to be ashamed.
contents: Therefore the showers have been withholden, and there hath been no latter rain; yet thou hadst a harlot’s forehead, thou
refusedst to be ashamed.

contents.verseText: Wilt thou not from this time cry unto me, My Father, thou art the guide of my youth?
contents: Wilt thou not from this time cry unto me, My Father, thou art the guide of my youth?

contents.verseText: Will he retain his anger for ever? will he keep it to the end? Behold, thou hast spoken and hast done evil things, and hast had thy way.
contents: Will he retain
for ever? will he keep it to the end? Behold, thou hast spoken and hast done evil
things, and hast had thy way.

contents.verseText: Moreover Jehovah said unto me in the days of Josiah the king, Hast thou seen that which backsliding Israel hath done? she is gone up upon every high mountain and under every green tree, and there hath played the harlot.
contents: Moreover Jehovah said unto me in the days of Josiah the king, Hast thou seen that which backsliding Israel hath done? she
is gone up upon every high mountain and under every green tree, and there hath played the harlot.

contents.verseText: And I said after she had done all these things, She will return unto me; but she returned not: and her treacherous sister Judah saw it.
contents: And I said after she had done all these things, She will return unto me; but she returned not: and her treacherous sister
Judah saw it.

contents.verseText: And I saw, when, for this very cause that backsliding Israel had committed adultery, I had put her away and given her a bill of divorcement, yet treacherous Judah her sister feared not; but she also went and played the harlot.
contents: And I saw, when, for this very cause that backsliding Israel had committed adultery, I had put her away and given her a
bill of divorcement, yet treacherous Judah her sister feared not; but she also went and played the harlot.

contents.verseText: And it came to pass through the lightness of her whoredom, that the land was polluted, and she committed adultery with stones and with stocks.
contents: And it came to pass through the lightness of her whoredom, that the land was polluted, and she committed adultery with
stones and with stocks.

contents.verseText: And yet for all this her treacherous sister Judah hath not returned unto me with her whole heart, but feignedly, saith Jehovah.
contents: And yet for all this her treacherous sister Judah hath not returned unto me with her whole heart, but feignedly, saith
Jehovah.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah said unto me, Backsliding Israel hath showed herself more righteous than treacherous Judah.
contents: And Jehovah said unto me, Backsliding Israel hath showed herself more righteous than treacherous Judah.

contents.verseText: Go, and proclaim these words toward the north, and say, Return, thou backsliding Israel, saith Jehovah; I will not look in anger upon you; for I am merciful, saith Jehovah, I will not keep anger for ever.
contents: Go, and proclaim these words toward the north, and say, Return, thou backsliding Israel, saith Jehovah; I will not look
in anger upon you; for I am merciful, saith Jehovah, I will not keep
for ever.

contents.verseText: Only acknowledge thine iniquity, that thou hast transgressed against Jehovah thy God, and hast scattered thy ways to the strangers under every green tree, and ye have not obeyed my voice, saith Jehovah.
contents: Only acknowledge thine iniquity, that thou hast transgressed against Jehovah thy God, and hast scattered thy ways to the
strangers under every green tree, and ye have not obeyed my voice, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Return, O backsliding children, saith Jehovah; for I am a husband unto you: and I will take you one of a city, and two of a family, and I will bring you to Zion.
contents: Return, O backsliding children, saith Jehovah; for I am a husband unto you: and I will take you one of a city, and two of
a family, and I will bring you to Zion.

contents.verseText: And I will give you shepherds according to my heart, who shall feed you with knowledge and understanding.
contents: And I will give you shepherds according to my heart, who shall feed you with knowledge and understanding.

contents.verseText: And it shall come to pass, when ye are multiplied and increased in the land, in those days, saith Jehovah, they shall say no more, The ark of the covenant of Jehovah; neither shall it come to mind; neither shall they remember it; neither shall they miss it; neither shall it be made any more.
contents: And it shall come to pass, when ye are multiplied and increased in the land, in those days, saith Jehovah, they shall say
no more, The ark of the covenant of Jehovah; neither shall it come to mind; neither shall they remember it; neither shall they
miss it; neither shall it be made any more.

contents.verseText: At that time they shall call Jerusalem the throne of Jehovah; and all the nations shall be gathered unto it, to the name of Jehovah, to Jerusalem: neither shall they walk any more after the stubbornness of their evil heart.
contents: At that time they shall call Jerusalem the throne of Jehovah; and all the nations shall be gathered unto it, to the name
of Jehovah, to Jerusalem: neither shall they walk any more after the stubbornness of their evil heart.

contents.verseText: In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I gave for an inheritance unto your fathers.
contents: In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the
north to the land that I gave for an inheritance unto your fathers.

contents.verseText: But I said, How I will put thee among the children, and give thee a pleasant land, a goodly heritage of the hosts of the nations! and I said, Ye shall call me My Father, and shall not turn away from following me.
contents: But I said, How I will put thee among the children, and give thee a pleasant land, a goodly heritage of the hosts of the
nations! and I said, Ye shall call me My Father, and shall not turn away from following me.

contents.verseText: Surely as a wife treacherously departeth from her husband, so have ye dealt treacherously with me, O house of Israel, saith Jehovah.
contents: Surely as a wife treacherously departeth from her husband, so have ye dealt treacherously with me, O house of Israel,
saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: A voice is heard upon the bare heights, the weeping and the supplications of the children of Israel; because they have perverted their way, they have forgotten Jehovah their God.
contents: A voice is heard upon the bare heights, the weeping
the supplications of the children of Israel; because
they have perverted their way, they have forgotten Jehovah their God.

contents.verseText: Return, ye backsliding children, I will heal your backslidings. Behold, we are come unto thee; for thou art Jehovah our God.
contents: Return, ye backsliding children, I will heal your backslidings.
Behold, we are come unto thee; for thou art Jehovah our God.

contents.verseText: Truly in vain is the help that is looked for from the hills, the tumult on the mountains: truly in Jehovah our God is the salvation of Israel.
contents: Truly in vain is

add: the help that is looked for

contents: from the hills, the tumult on the mountains: truly in Jehovah our
God is the salvation of Israel.

contents.verseText: But the shameful thing hath devoured the labor of our fathers from our youth, their flocks and their herds, their sons and their daughters.
contents: But the shameful thing hath devoured the labor of our fathers from our youth, their flocks and their herds, their sons
and their daughters.

contents.verseText: Let us lie down in our shame, and let our confusion cover us; for we have sinned against Jehovah our God, we and our fathers, from our youth even unto this day; and we have not obeyed the voice of Jehovah our God.
contents: Let us lie down in our shame, and let our confusion cover us; for we have sinned against Jehovah our God, we and our
fathers, from our youth even unto this day; and we have not obeyed the voice of Jehovah our God.

contents.verseText: If thou wilt return, O Israel, saith Jehovah, if thou wilt return unto me, and if thou wilt put away thine abominations out of my sight; then shalt thou not be removed;
contents: If thou wilt return, O Israel, saith Jehovah, if thou wilt return unto me, and if thou wilt put away thine abominations
out of my sight; then shalt thou not be removed;

contents.verseText: and thou shalt swear, As Jehovah liveth, in truth, in justice, and in righteousness; and the nations shall bless themselves in him, and in him shall they glory.
contents: and thou shalt swear, As Jehovah liveth, in truth, in justice, and in righteousness; and the nations shall bless
themselves in him, and in him shall they glory.

contents.verseText: For thus saith Jehovah to the men of Judah and to Jerusalem, Break up your fallow ground, and sow not among thorns.
contents: For thus saith Jehovah to the men of Judah and to Jerusalem, Break up your fallow ground, and sow not among thorns.

contents.verseText: Circumcise yourselves to Jehovah, and take away the foreskins of your heart, ye men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem; lest my wrath go forth like fire, and burn so that none can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.
contents: Circumcise yourselves to Jehovah, and take away the foreskins of your heart, ye men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem;
lest my wrath go forth like fire, and burn so that none can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.

contents.verseText: Declare ye in Judah, and publish in Jerusalem; and say, Blow ye the trumpet in the land: cry aloud and say, Assemble yourselves, and let us go into the fortified cities.
contents: Declare ye in Judah, and publish in Jerusalem; and say, Blow ye the trumpet in the land: cry aloud and say, Assemble
yourselves, and let us go into the fortified cities.

contents.verseText: Set up a standard toward Zion: flee for safety, stay not; for I will bring evil from the north, and a great destruction.
contents: Set up a standard toward Zion: flee for safety, stay not; for I will bring evil from the north, and a great destruction.

contents.verseText: A lion is gone up from his thicket, and a destroyer of nations; he is on his way, he is gone forth from his place, to make thy land desolate, that thy cities be laid waste, without inhabitant.
contents: A lion is gone up from his thicket, and a destroyer of nations; he is on his way, he is gone forth from his place, to make
thy land desolate, that thy cities be laid waste, without inhabitant.

contents.verseText: For this gird you with sackcloth, lament and wail; for the fierce anger of Jehovah is not turned back from us.
contents: For this gird you with sackcloth, lament and wail; for the fierce anger of Jehovah is not turned back from us.

contents.verseText: And it shall come to pass at that day, saith Jehovah, that the heart of the king shall perish, and the heart of the princes; and the priests shall be astonished, and the prophets shall wonder.
contents: And it shall come to pass at that day, saith Jehovah, that the heart of the king shall perish, and the heart of the
princes; and the priests shall be astonished, and the prophets shall wonder.

contents.verseText: Then said I, Ah, Lord Jehovah! surely thou hast greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall have peace; whereas the sword reacheth unto the life.
contents: Then said I, Ah, Lord Jehovah! surely thou hast greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall have peace;
whereas the sword reacheth unto the life.

contents.verseText: At that time shall it be said to this people and to Jerusalem, A hot wind from the bare heights in the wilderness toward the daughter of my people, not to winnow, nor to cleanse;
contents: At that time shall it be said to this people and to Jerusalem, A hot wind from the bare heights in the wilderness toward
the daughter of my people, not to winnow, nor to cleanse;

contents.verseText: a full wind from these shall come for me: now will I also utter judgments against them.
contents: a full wind from these shall come for me: now will I also utter judgments against them.

contents.verseText: Behold, he shall come up as clouds, and his chariots shall be as the whirlwind: his horses are swifter than eagles. Woe unto us! for we are ruined.
contents: Behold, he shall come up as clouds, and his chariots
as the whirlwind: his horses are swifter than eagles. Woe unto us! for we are ruined.

contents.verseText: O Jerusalem, wash thy heart from wickedness, that thou mayest be saved. How long shall thine evil thoughts lodge within thee?
contents: O Jerusalem, wash thy heart from wickedness, that thou mayest be saved. How long shall thine evil thoughts lodge within
thee?

contents.verseText: For a voice declareth from Dan, and publisheth evil from the hills of Ephraim.
contents: For a voice declareth from Dan, and publisheth evil from the hills of Ephraim.

contents.verseText: Make ye mention to the nations; behold, publish against Jerusalem, that watchers come from a far country, and give out their voice against the cities of Judah.
contents: Make ye mention to the nations; behold, publish against Jerusalem,
watchers come from a far country, and give out their voice against the cities of Judah.

contents.verseText: As keepers of a field are they against her round about, because she hath been rebellious against me, saith Jehovah.
contents: As keepers of a field are they against her round about, because she hath been rebellious against me, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Thy way and thy doings have procured these things unto thee; this is thy wickedness; for it is bitter, for it reacheth unto thy heart.
contents: Thy way and thy doings have procured these things unto thee; this is thy wickedness; for it is bitter, for it reacheth
unto thy heart.

contents.verseText: My anguish, my anguish! I am pained at my very heart; my heart is disquieted in me; I cannot hold my peace; because thou hast heard, O my soul, the sound of the trumpet, the alarm of war.
contents: My anguish, my anguish! I am pained at my very heart; my heart is disquieted in me; I cannot hold my peace; because thou
hast heard, O my soul, the sound of the trumpet, the alarm of war.

contents.verseText: Destruction upon destruction is cried; for the whole land is laid waste: suddenly are my tents destroyed, and my curtains in a moment.
contents: Destruction upon destruction is cried; for the whole land is laid waste: suddenly are my tents destroyed,
my curtains in a moment.

contents.verseText: How long shall I see the standard, and hear the sound of the trumpet?
contents: How long shall I see the standard, and hear the sound of the trumpet?

contents.verseText: For my people are foolish, they know me not; they are sottish children, and they have no understanding; they are wise to do evil, but to do good they have no knowledge.
contents: For my people are foolish, they know me not; they are sottish children, and they have no understanding; they are wise to
do evil, but to do good they have no knowledge.

contents.verseText: I beheld the earth, and, lo, it was waste and void; and the heavens, and they had no light.
contents: I beheld the earth, and, lo, it was waste and void; and the heavens, and they had no light.

contents.verseText: I beheld the mountains, and, lo, they trembled, and all the hills moved to and fro.
contents: I beheld the mountains, and, lo, they trembled, and all the hills moved to and fro.

contents.verseText: I beheld, and, lo, there was no man, and all the birds of the heavens were fled.
contents: I beheld, and, lo, there was no man, and all the birds of the heavens were fled.

contents.verseText: I beheld, and, lo, the fruitful field was a wilderness, and all the cities thereof were broken down at the presence of Jehovah, and before his fierce anger.
contents: I beheld, and, lo, the fruitful field was a wilderness, and all the cities thereof were broken down at the presence of
Jehovah,
before his fierce anger.

contents.verseText: For thus saith Jehovah, The whole land shall be a desolation; yet will I not make a full end.
contents: For thus saith Jehovah, The whole land shall be a desolation; yet will I not make a full end.

contents.verseText: For this shall the earth mourn, and the heavens above be black; because I have spoken it, I have purposed it, and I have not repented, neither will I turn back from it.
contents: For this shall the earth mourn, and the heavens above be black; because I have spoken it, I have purposed it, and I have
not repented, neither will I turn back from it.

contents.verseText: Every city fleeth for the noise of the horsemen and bowmen; they go into the thickets, and climb up upon the rocks: every city is forsaken, and not a man dwelleth therein.
contents: Every city fleeth for the noise of the horsemen and bowmen; they go into the thickets, and climb up upon the rocks: every
city is forsaken, and not a man dwelleth therein.

contents.verseText: And thou, when thou art made desolate, what wilt thou do? Though thou clothest thyself with scarlet, though thou deckest thee with ornaments of gold, though thou enlargest thine eyes with paint, in vain dost thou make thyself fair; thy lovers despise thee, they seek thy life.
contents: And thou, when thou art made desolate, what wilt thou do? Though thou clothest thyself with scarlet, though thou deckest
thee with ornaments of gold, though thou enlargest thine eyes with paint, in vain dost thou make thyself fair;
lovers despise thee, they seek thy life.

contents.verseText: For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail, the anguish as of her that bringeth forth her first child, the voice of the daughter of Zion, that gaspeth for breath, that spreadeth her hands, saying, Woe is me now! for my soul fainteth before the murderers.
contents: For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail, the anguish as of her that bringeth forth her first child, the voice
of the daughter of Zion, that gaspeth for breath, that spreadeth her hands,
, Woe is me now! for my soul fainteth before the murderers.

contents.verseText: Run ye to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem, and see now, and know, and seek in the broad places thereof, if ye can find a man, if there be any that doeth justly, that seeketh truth; and I will pardon her.
contents: Run ye to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem, and see now, and know, and seek in the broad places thereof, if ye can
find a man, if there be any that doeth justly, that seeketh truth; and I will pardon her.

contents.verseText: And though they say, As Jehovah liveth; surely they swear falsely.
contents: And though they say, As Jehovah liveth; surely they swear falsely.

contents.verseText: O Jehovah, do not thine eyes look upon truth? thou hast stricken them, but they were not grieved; thou hast consumed them, but they have refused to receive correction: they have made their faces harder than a rock; they have refused to return.
contents: O Jehovah, do not thine eyes look upon truth? thou hast stricken them, but they were not grieved; thou hast consumed them,
but they have refused to receive correction: they have made their faces harder than a rock; they have refused to return.

contents.verseText: Then I said, Surely these are poor; they are foolish; for they know not the way of Jehovah, nor the law of their God:
contents: Then I said, Surely these are poor; they are foolish; for they know not the way of Jehovah, nor the law of their God:

contents.verseText: I will get me unto the great men, and will speak unto them; for they know the way of Jehovah, and the law of their God. But these with one accord have broken the yoke, and burst the bonds.
contents: I will get me unto the great men, and will speak unto them; for they know the way of Jehovah, and the law of their God.
But these with one accord have broken the yoke, and burst the bonds.

contents.verseText: Wherefore a lion out of the forest shall slay them, a wolf of the evenings shall destroy them, a leopard shall watch against their cities; every one that goeth out thence shall be torn in pieces; because their transgressions are many, and their backslidings are increased.
contents: Wherefore a lion out of the forest shall slay them, a wolf of the evenings shall destroy them, a leopard shall watch
against their cities; every one that goeth out thence shall be torn in pieces; because their transgressions are many,
their backslidings are increased.

contents.verseText: How can I pardon thee? thy children have forsaken me, and sworn by them that are no gods. When I had fed them to the full, they committed adultery, and assembled themselves in troops at the harlots’ houses;
contents: How can I pardon thee? thy children have forsaken me, and sworn by them that are no gods. When I had fed them to the full,
they committed adultery, and assembled themselves in troops at the harlots’ houses;

contents.verseText: they were as fed horses roaming at large; every one neighed after his neighbor’s wife.
contents: they were as fed horses roaming at large; every one neighed after his neighbor’s wife.

contents.verseText: Shall I not visit for these things? saith Jehovah; and shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
contents: Shall I not visit for these things? saith Jehovah; and shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?

contents.verseText: Go ye up upon her walls, and destroy; but make not a full end: take away her branches; for they are not Jehovah’s.
contents: Go ye up upon her walls, and destroy; but make not a full end: take away her branches; for they are not Jehovah’s.

contents.verseText: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have dealt very treacherously against me, saith Jehovah.
contents: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have dealt very treacherously against me, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: They have denied Jehovah, and said, It is not he; neither shall evil come upon us; neither shall we see sword nor famine:
contents: They have denied Jehovah, and said, It is not he; neither shall evil come upon us; neither shall we see sword nor famine:

contents.verseText: and the prophets shall become wind, and the word is not in them: thus shall it be done unto them.
contents: and the prophets shall become wind, and the word is not in them: thus shall it be done unto them.

contents.verseText: Wherefore thus saith Jehovah, the God of hosts, Because ye speak this word, behold, I will make my words in thy mouth fire, and this people wood, and it shall devour them.
contents: Wherefore thus saith Jehovah, the God of hosts, Because ye speak this word, behold, I will make my words in thy mouth
fire, and this people wood, and it shall devour them.

contents.verseText: Lo, I will bring a nation upon you from far, O house of Israel, saith Jehovah: it is a mighty nation, it is an ancient nation, a nation whose language thou knowest not, neither understandest what they say.
contents: Lo, I will bring a nation upon you from far, O house of Israel, saith Jehovah: it is a mighty nation, it is an ancient
nation, a nation whose language thou knowest not, neither understandest what they say.

contents.verseText: Their quiver is an open sepulchre, they are all mighty men.
contents: Their quiver is an open sepulchre, they are all mighty men.

contents.verseText: And they shall eat up thy harvest, and thy bread, which thy sons and thy daughters should eat; they shall eat up thy flocks and thy herds; they shall eat up thy vines and thy fig-trees; they shall beat down thy fortified cities, wherein thou trustest, with the sword.
contents: And they shall eat up thy harvest, and thy bread,
thy sons and thy daughters should eat; they shall eat
up thy flocks and thy herds; they shall eat up thy vines and thy fig-trees; they shall beat down thy fortified cities, wherein
thou trustest, with the sword.

contents.verseText: But even in those days, saith Jehovah, I will not make a full end with you.
contents: But even in those days, saith Jehovah, I will not make a full end with you.

contents.verseText: And it shall come to pass, when ye shall say, Wherefore hath Jehovah our God done all these things unto us? then shalt thou say unto them, Like as ye have forsaken me, and served foreign gods in your land, so shall ye serve strangers in a land that is not yours.
contents: And it shall come to pass, when ye shall say, Wherefore hath Jehovah our God done all these things unto us? then shalt
thou say unto them, Like as ye have forsaken me, and served foreign gods in your land, so shall ye serve strangers in a land
that is not yours.

contents.verseText: Declare ye this in the house of Jacob, and publish it in Judah, saying,
contents: Declare ye this in the house of Jacob, and publish it in Judah, saying,

contents.verseText: Hear now this, O foolish people, and without understanding; that have eyes, and see not; that have ears, and hear not:
contents: Hear now this, O foolish people, and without understanding; that have eyes, and see not; that have ears, and hear not:

contents.verseText: Fear ye not me? saith Jehovah: will ye not tremble at my presence, who have placed the sand for the bound of the sea, by a perpetual decree, that it cannot pass it? and though the waves thereof toss themselves, yet can they not prevail; though they roar, yet can they not pass over it.
contents: Fear ye not me? saith Jehovah: will ye not tremble at my presence, who have placed the sand for the bound of the sea, by
a perpetual decree, that it cannot pass it? and though the waves thereof toss themselves, yet can they not prevail; though they
roar, yet can they not pass over it.

contents.verseText: But this people hath a revolting and a rebellious heart; they are revolted and gone.
contents: But this people hath a revolting and a rebellious heart; they are revolted and gone.

contents.verseText: Neither say they in their heart, Let us now fear Jehovah our God, that giveth rain, both the former and the latter, in its season; that preserveth unto us the appointed weeks of the harvest.
contents: Neither say they in their heart, Let us now fear Jehovah our God, that giveth rain, both the former and the latter, in
its season; that preserveth unto us the appointed weeks of the harvest.

contents.verseText: Your iniquities have turned away these things, and your sins have withholden good from you.
contents: Your iniquities have turned away these things, and your sins have withholden good from you.

contents.verseText: For among my people are found wicked men: they watch, as fowlers lie in wait; they set a trap, they catch men.
contents: For among my people are found wicked men: they watch, as fowlers lie in wait; they set a trap, they catch men.

contents.verseText: As a cage is full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit: therefore they are become great, and waxed rich.
contents: As a cage is full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit: therefore they are become great, and waxed rich.

contents.verseText: They are waxed fat, they shine: yea, they overpass in deeds of wickedness; they plead not the cause, the cause of the fatherless, that they may prosper; and the right of the needy do they not judge.
contents: They are waxed fat, they shine: yea, they overpass in deeds of wickedness; they plead not the cause, the cause of the
fatherless, that they may prosper; and the right of the needy do they not judge.

contents.verseText: Shall I not visit for these things? saith Jehovah; shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
contents: Shall I not visit for these things? saith Jehovah; shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?

contents.verseText: A wonderful and horrible thing is come to pass in the land:
contents: A wonderful and horrible thing is come to pass in the land:

contents.verseText: the prophets prophesy falsely, and the priests bear rule by their means; and my people love to have it so: and what will ye do in the end thereof?
contents: the prophets prophesy falsely, and the priests bear rule by their means; and my people love to have it so: and what will
ye do in the end thereof?

contents.verseText: Flee for safety, ye children of Benjamin, out of the midst of Jerusalem, and blow the trumpet in Tekoa, and raise up a signal on Beth-haccherem; for evil looketh forth from the north, and a great destruction.
contents: Flee for safety, ye children of Benjamin, out of the midst of Jerusalem, and blow the trumpet in Tekoa, and raise up a
signal on Beth-haccherem; for evil looketh forth from the north, and a great destruction.

contents.verseText: The comely and delicate one, the daughter of Zion, will I cut off.
contents: The comely and delicate one, the daughter of Zion, will I cut off.

contents.verseText: Shepherds with their flocks shall come unto her; they shall pitch their tents against her round about; they shall feed every one in his place.
contents: Shepherds with their flocks shall come unto her; they shall pitch their tents against her round about; they shall feed
every one in his place.

contents.verseText: Prepare ye war against her; arise, and let us go up at noon. Woe unto us! for the day declineth, for the shadows of the evening are stretched out.
contents: Prepare ye war against her; arise, and let us go up at noon. Woe unto us! for the day declineth, for the shadows of the
evening are stretched out.

contents.verseText: Arise, and let us go up by night, and let us destroy her palaces.
contents: Arise, and let us go up by night, and let us destroy her palaces.

contents.verseText: For thus hath Jehovah of hosts said, Hew ye down trees, and cast up a mound against Jerusalem: this is the city to be visited; she is wholly oppression in the midst of her.
contents: For thus hath Jehovah of hosts said, Hew ye down trees, and cast up a mound against Jerusalem: this is the city to be
visited; she is wholly oppression in the midst of her.

contents.verseText: As a well casteth forth its waters, so she casteth forth her wickedness: violence and destruction is heard in her; before me continually is sickness and wounds.
contents: As a well casteth forth its waters, so she casteth forth her wickedness: violence and destruction is heard in her; before
me continually is sickness and wounds.

contents.verseText: Be thou instructed, O Jerusalem, lest my soul be alienated from thee; lest I make thee a desolation, a land not inhabited.
contents: Be thou instructed, O Jerusalem, lest my soul be alienated from thee; lest I make thee a desolation, a land not inhabited.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, They shall thoroughly glean the remnant of Israel as a vine: turn again thy hand as a grape-gatherer into the baskets.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, They shall thoroughly glean the remnant of Israel as a vine: turn again thy hand as a
grape-gatherer into the baskets.

contents.verseText: To whom shall I speak and testify, that they may hear? behold, their ear is uncircumcised, and they cannot hearken: behold, the word of Jehovah is become unto them a reproach; they have no delight in it.
contents: To whom shall I speak and testify, that they may hear? behold, their ear is uncircumcised, and they cannot hearken:
behold, the word of Jehovah is become unto them a reproach; they have no delight in it.

contents.verseText: Therefore I am full of the wrath of Jehovah; I am weary with holding in: pour it out upon the children in the street, and upon the assembly of young men together; for even the husband with the wife shall be taken, the aged with him that is full of days.
contents: Therefore I am full of the wrath of Jehovah; I am weary with holding in: pour it out upon the children in the street, and
upon the assembly of young men together; for even the husband with the wife shall be taken, the aged with him that is full of
days.

contents.verseText: And their houses shall be turned unto others, their fields and their wives together; for I will stretch out my hand upon the inhabitants of the land, saith Jehovah.
contents: And their houses shall be turned unto others, their fields and their wives together; for I will stretch out my hand upon
the inhabitants of the land, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: For from the least of them even unto the greatest of them every one is given to covetousness; and from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.
contents: For from the least of them even unto the greatest of them every one is given to covetousness; and from the prophet even
unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.

contents.verseText: They have healed also the hurt of my people slightly, saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.
contents: They have healed also the hurt of my people slightly, saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.

contents.verseText: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore they shall fall among them that fall; at the time that I visit them they shall be cast down, saith Jehovah.
contents: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush:
therefore they shall fall among them that fall; at the time that I visit them they shall be cast down, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah, Stand ye in the ways and see, and ask for the old paths, where is the good way; and walk therein, and ye shall find rest for your souls: but they said, We will not walk therein.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah, Stand ye in the ways and see, and ask for the old paths, where is the good way; and walk therein, and
ye shall find rest for your souls: but they said, We will not walk

contents.verseText: And I set watchmen over you, saying, Hearken to the sound of the trumpet; but they said, We will not hearken.
contents: And I set watchmen over you,
, Hearken to the sound of the trumpet; but they said, We will not hearken.

contents.verseText: Therefore hear, ye nations, and know, O congregation, what is among them.
contents: Therefore hear, ye nations, and know, O congregation, what is among them.

contents.verseText: Hear, O earth: behold, I will bring evil upon this people, even the fruit of their thoughts, because they have not hearkened unto my words; and as for my law, they have rejected it.
contents: Hear, O earth: behold, I will bring evil upon this people, even the fruit of their thoughts, because they have not
hearkened unto my words; and as for my law, they have rejected it.

contents.verseText: To what purpose cometh there to me frankincense from Sheba, and the sweet cane from a far country? your burnt-offerings are not acceptable, nor your sacrifices pleasing unto me.
contents: To what purpose cometh there to me frankincense from Sheba, and the sweet cane from a far country? your burnt-offerings
are not acceptable, nor your sacrifices pleasing unto me.

contents.verseText: Therefore thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will lay stumbling-blocks before this people; and the fathers and the sons together shall stumble against them; the neighbor and his friend shall perish.
contents: Therefore thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will lay stumbling-blocks before this people; and the fathers and the sons
together shall stumble against them; the neighbor and his friend shall perish.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah, Behold, a people cometh from the north country; and a great nation shall be stirred up from the uttermost parts of the earth.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah, Behold, a people cometh from the north country; and a great nation shall be stirred up from the
uttermost parts of the earth.

contents.verseText: They lay hold on bow and spear; they are cruel, and have no mercy; their voice roareth like the sea, and they ride upon horses, every one set in array, as a man to the battle, against thee, O daughter of Zion.
contents: They lay hold on bow and spear; they are cruel, and have no mercy; their voice roareth like the sea, and they ride upon
horses, every one set in array, as a man to the battle, against thee, O daughter of Zion.

contents.verseText: We have heard the report thereof; our hands wax feeble: anguish hath taken hold of us, and pangs as of a woman in travail.
contents: We have heard the report thereof; our hands wax feeble: anguish hath taken hold of us,
pangs as of a woman in travail.

contents.verseText: Go not forth into the field, nor walk by the way; for the sword of the enemy, and terror, are on every side.
contents: Go not forth into the field, nor walk by the way; for the sword of the enemy,
terror, are on every side.

contents.verseText: O daughter of my people, gird thee with sackcloth, and wallow thyself in ashes: make thee mourning, as for an only son, most bitter lamentation; for the destroyer shall suddenly come upon us.
contents: O daughter of my people, gird thee with sackcloth, and wallow thyself in ashes: make thee mourning, as for an only son,
most bitter lamentation; for the destroyer shall suddenly come upon us.

contents.verseText: I have made thee a trier and a fortress among my people; that thou mayest know and try their way.
contents: I have made thee a trier
a fortress among my people; that thou mayest know and try their way.

contents.verseText: They are all grievous revolters, going about with slanders; they are brass and iron: they all of them deal corruptly.
contents: They are all grievous revolters, going about with slanders; they are brass and iron: they all of them deal corruptly.

contents.verseText: The bellows blow fiercely; the lead is consumed of the fire: in vain do they go on refining; for the wicked are not plucked away.
contents: The bellows blow fiercely; the lead is consumed of the fire: in vain do they go on refining; for the wicked are not
plucked away.

contents.verseText: Refuse silver shall men call them, because Jehovah hath rejected them.
contents: Refuse silver shall men call them, because Jehovah hath rejected them.

contents.verseText: The word that came to Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying,
contents: The word that came to Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying,

contents.verseText: Stand in the gate of Jehovah’s house, and proclaim there this word, and say, Hear the word of Jehovah, all ye of Judah, that enter in at these gates to worship Jehovah.
contents: Stand in the gate of Jehovah’s house, and proclaim there this word, and say, Hear the word of Jehovah, all ye of Judah,
that enter in at these gates to worship Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, Amend your ways and your doings, and I will cause you to dwell in this place.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, Amend your ways and your doings, and I will cause you to dwell in this
place.

contents.verseText: Trust ye not in lying words, saying, The temple of Jehovah, the temple of Jehovah, the temple of Jehovah, are these.
contents: Trust ye not in lying words, saying, The temple of Jehovah, the temple of Jehovah, the temple of Jehovah, are these.

contents.verseText: For if ye thoroughly amend your ways and your doings; if ye thoroughly execute justice between a man and his neighbor;
contents: For if ye thoroughly amend your ways and your doings; if ye thoroughly execute justice between a man and his neighbor;

contents.verseText: if ye oppress not the sojourner, the fatherless, and the widow, and shed not innocent blood in this place, neither walk after other gods to your own hurt:
contents: if ye oppress not the sojourner, the fatherless, and the widow, and shed not innocent blood in this place, neither walk
after other gods to your own hurt:

contents.verseText: then will I cause you to dwell in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers, from of old even for evermore.
contents: then will I cause you to dwell in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers, from of old even for evermore.

contents.verseText: Behold, ye trust in lying words, that cannot profit.
contents: Behold, ye trust in lying words, that cannot profit.

contents.verseText: Will ye steal, murder, and commit adultery, and swear falsely, and burn incense unto Baal, and walk after other gods that ye have not known,
contents: Will ye steal, murder, and commit adultery, and swear falsely, and burn incense unto Baal, and walk after other gods that
ye have not known,

contents.verseText: and come and stand before me in this house, which is called by my name, and say, We are delivered; that ye may do all these abominations?
contents: and come and stand before me in this house, which is called by my name, and say, We are delivered; that ye may do all
these abominations?

contents.verseText: Is this house, which is called by my name, become a den of robbers in your eyes? Behold, I, even I, have seen it, saith Jehovah.
contents: Is this house, which is called by my name, become a den of robbers in your eyes? Behold, I, even I, have seen it, saith
Jehovah.

contents.verseText: But go ye now unto my place which was in Shiloh, where I caused my name to dwell at the first, and see what I did to it for the wickedness of my people Israel.
contents: But go ye now unto my place which was in Shiloh, where I caused my name to dwell at the first, and see what I did to it
for the wickedness of my people Israel.

contents.verseText: And now, because ye have done all these works, saith Jehovah, and I spake unto you, rising up early and speaking, but ye heard not; and I called you, but ye answered not:
contents: And now, because ye have done all these works, saith Jehovah, and I spake unto you, rising up early and speaking, but ye
heard not; and I called you, but ye answered not:

contents.verseText: therefore will I do unto the house which is called by my name, wherein ye trust, and unto the place which I gave to you and to your fathers, as I did to Shiloh.
contents: therefore will I do unto the house which is called by my name, wherein ye trust, and unto the place which I gave to you
and to your fathers, as I did to Shiloh.

contents.verseText: And I will cast you out of my sight, as I have cast out all your brethren, even the whole seed of Ephraim.
contents: And I will cast you out of my sight, as I have cast out all your brethren, even the whole seed of Ephraim.

contents.verseText: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up cry nor prayer for them, neither make intercession to me; for I will not hear thee.
contents: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up cry nor prayer for them, neither make intercession to me; for I
will not hear thee.

contents.verseText: Seest thou not what they do in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
contents: Seest thou not what they do in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

contents.verseText: The children gather wood, and the fathers kindle the fire, and the women knead the dough, to make cakes to the queen of heaven, and to pour out drink-offerings unto other gods, that they may provoke me to anger.
contents: The children gather wood, and the fathers kindle the fire, and the women knead the dough, to make cakes to the queen of
heaven, and to pour out drink-offerings unto other gods, that they may provoke me to anger.

contents.verseText: Do they provoke me to anger? saith Jehovah; do they not provoke themselves, to the confusion of their own faces?
contents: Do they provoke me to anger? saith Jehovah;
not
themselves, to the confusion of their own faces?

contents.verseText: Therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Behold, mine anger and my wrath shall be poured out upon this place, upon man, and upon beast, and upon the trees of the field, and upon the fruit of the ground; and it shall burn, and shall not be quenched.
contents: Therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Behold, mine anger and my wrath shall be poured out upon this place, upon man, and
upon beast, and upon the trees of the field, and upon the fruit of the ground; and it shall burn, and shall not be quenched.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Add your burnt-offerings unto your sacrifices, and eat ye flesh.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Add your burnt-offerings unto your sacrifices, and eat ye flesh.

contents.verseText: For I spake not unto your fathers, nor commanded them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, concerning burnt-offerings or sacrifices:
contents: For I spake not unto your fathers, nor commanded them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, concerning
burnt-offerings or sacrifices:

contents.verseText: but this thing I commanded them, saying, Hearken unto my voice, and I will be your God, and ye shall be my people; and walk ye in all the way that I command you, that it may be well with you.
contents: but this thing I commanded them, saying, Hearken unto my voice, and I will be your God, and ye shall be my people; and
walk ye in all the way that I command you, that it may be well with you.

contents.verseText: But they hearkened not, nor inclined their ear, but walked in their own counsels and in the stubbornness of their evil heart, and went backward, and not forward.
contents: But they hearkened not, nor inclined their ear, but walked in
counsels
in the stubbornness of their evil heart, and went backward, and not forward.

contents.verseText: Since the day that your fathers came forth out of the land of Egypt unto this day, I have sent unto you all my servants the prophets, daily rising up early and sending them:
contents: Since the day that your fathers came forth out of the land of Egypt unto this day, I have sent unto you all my servants
the prophets, daily rising up early and sending them:

contents.verseText: yet they hearkened not unto me, nor inclined their ear, but made their neck stiff: they did worse than their fathers.
contents: yet they hearkened not unto me, nor inclined their ear, but made their neck stiff: they did worse than their fathers.

contents.verseText: And thou shalt speak all these words unto them; but they will not hearken to thee: thou shalt also call unto them; but they will not answer thee.
contents: And thou shalt speak all these words unto them; but they will not hearken to thee: thou shalt also call unto them; but
they will not answer thee.

contents.verseText: And thou shalt say unto them, This is the nation that hath not hearkened to the voice of Jehovah their God, nor received instruction: truth is perished, and is cut off from their mouth.
contents: And thou shalt say unto them, This is the nation that hath not hearkened to the voice of Jehovah their God, nor received
instruction: truth is perished, and is cut off from their mouth.

contents.verseText: Cut off thy hair, O Jerusalem, and cast it away, and take up a lamentation on the bare heights; for Jehovah hath rejected and forsaken the generation of his wrath.
contents: Cut off thy hair,
, and cast it away, and take up a lamentation on the bare heights; for Jehovah
hath rejected and forsaken the generation of his wrath.

contents.verseText: For the children of Judah have done that which is evil in my sight, saith Jehovah: they have set their abominations in the house which is called by my name, to defile it.
contents: For the children of Judah have done that which is evil in my sight, saith Jehovah: they have set their abominations in
the house which is called by my name, to defile it.

contents.verseText: And they have built the high places of Topheth, which is in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and their daughters in the fire; which I commanded not, neither came it into my mind.
contents: And they have built the high places of Topheth, which is in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and their
daughters in the fire; which I commanded not, neither came it into my mind.

contents.verseText: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that it shall no more be called Topheth, nor The valley of the son of Hinnom, but The valley of Slaughter: for they shall bury in Topheth, till there be no place to bury.
contents: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that it shall no more be called Topheth, nor The valley of the son of
Hinnom, but The valley of Slaughter: for they shall bury in Topheth, till there be no place

contents.verseText: And the dead bodies of this people shall be food for the birds of the heavens, and for the beasts of the earth; and none shall frighten them away.
contents: And the dead bodies of this people shall be food for the birds of the heavens, and for the beasts of the earth; and none
shall frighten them away.

contents.verseText: Then will I cause to cease from the cities of Judah, and from the streets of Jerusalem, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride; for the land shall become a waste.
contents: Then will I cause to cease from the cities of Judah, and from the streets of Jerusalem, the voice of mirth and the voice
of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride; for the land shall become a waste.

contents.verseText: At that time, saith Jehovah, they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of his princes, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves;
contents: At that time, saith Jehovah, they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of his princes, and the
bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves;

contents.verseText: and they shall spread them before the sun, and the moon, and all the host of heaven, which they have loved, and which they have served, and after which they have walked, and which they have sought, and which they have worshipped: they shall not be gathered, nor be buried, they shall be for dung upon the face of the earth.
contents: and they shall spread them before the sun, and the moon, and all the host of heaven, which they have loved, and which they
have served, and after which they have walked, and which they have sought, and which they have worshipped: they shall not be
gathered, nor be buried, they shall be for dung upon the face of the earth.

contents.verseText: And death shall be chosen rather than life by all the residue that remain of this evil family, that remain in all the places whither I have driven them, saith Jehovah of hosts.
contents: And death shall be chosen rather than life by all the residue that remain of this evil family, that remain in all the
places whither I have driven them, saith Jehovah of hosts.

contents.verseText: Moreover thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah: Shall men fall, and not rise up again? Shall one turn away, and not return?
contents: Moreover thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah: Shall men fall, and not rise up again? Shall one turn away, and not
return?

contents.verseText: Why then is this people of Jerusalem slidden back by a perpetual backsliding? they hold fast deceit, they refuse to return.
contents: Why then is this people of Jerusalem slidden back by a perpetual backsliding? they hold fast deceit, they refuse to
return.

contents.verseText: I hearkened and heard, but they spake not aright: no man repenteth him of his wickedness, saying, What have I done? every one turneth to his course, as a horse that rusheth headlong in the battle.
contents: I hearkened and heard, but they spake not aright: no man repenteth him of his wickedness, saying, What have I done? every
one turneth to his course, as a horse that rusheth headlong in the battle.

contents.verseText: Yea, the stork in the heavens knoweth her appointed times; and the turtle-dove and the swallow and the crane observe the time of their coming; but my people know not the law of Jehovah.
contents: Yea, the stork in the heavens knoweth her appointed times; and the turtle-dove and the swallow and the crane observe the
time of their coming; but my people know not the law of Jehovah.

contents.verseText: How do ye say, We are wise, and the law of Jehovah is with us? But, behold, the false pen of the scribes hath wrought falsely.
contents: How do ye say, We are wise, and the law of Jehovah is with us? But, behold, the false pen of the scribes hath wrought
falsely.

contents.verseText: The wise men are put to shame, they are dismayed and taken: lo, they have rejected the word of Jehovah; and what manner of wisdom is in them?
contents: The wise men are put to shame, they are dismayed and taken: lo, they have rejected the word of Jehovah; and what manner of
wisdom is in them?

contents.verseText: Therefore will I give their wives unto others, and their fields to them that shall possess them: for every one from the least even unto the greatest is given to covetousness; from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.
contents: Therefore will I give their wives unto others, and their fields to them that shall possess them: for every one from the
least even unto the greatest is given to covetousness; from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.

contents.verseText: And they have healed the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly, saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.
contents: And they have healed the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly, saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.

contents.verseText: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore shall they fall among them that fall; in the time of their visitation they shall be cast down, saith Jehovah.
contents: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush:
therefore shall they fall among them that fall; in the time of their visitation they shall be cast down, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: I will utterly consume them, saith Jehovah: there shall be no grapes on the vine, nor figs on the fig-tree, and the leaf shall fade; and the things that I have given them shall pass away from them.
contents: I will utterly consume them, saith Jehovah: there shall be no grapes on the vine, nor figs on the fig-tree, and the leaf
shall fade; and
I have given them shall pass away from them.

contents.verseText: Why do we sit still? assemble yourselves, and let us enter into the fortified cities, and let us be silent there; for Jehovah our God hath put us to silence, and given us water of gall to drink, because we have sinned against Jehovah.
contents: Why do we sit still? assemble yourselves, and let us enter into the fortified cities, and let us be silent there; for
Jehovah our God hath put us to silence, and given us water of gall to drink, because we have sinned against Jehovah.

contents.verseText: We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of healing, and, behold, dismay!
contents: We looked for peace, but no good came;
for a time of healing, and, behold, dismay!

contents.verseText: The snorting of his horses is heard from Dan: at the sound of the neighing of his strong ones the whole land trembleth; for they are come, and have devoured the land and all that is in it; the city and those that dwell therein.
contents: The snorting of his horses is heard from Dan: at the sound of the neighing of his strong ones the whole land trembleth;
for they are come, and have devoured the land and all that is in it; the city and those that dwell therein.

contents.verseText: For, behold, I will send serpents, adders, among you, which will not be charmed; and they shall bite you, saith Jehovah.
contents: For, behold, I will send serpents, adders, among you, which will not be charmed; and they shall bite you, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Oh that I could comfort myself against sorrow! my heart is faint within me.
contents: Oh that I could comfort myself against sorrow! my heart is faint within me.

contents.verseText: Behold, the voice of the cry of the daughter of my people from a land that is very far off: is not Jehovah in Zion? is not her King in her? Why have they provoked me to anger with their graven images, and with foreign vanities?
contents: Behold, the voice of the cry of the daughter of my people from a land that is very far off: is not Jehovah in Zion? is
not her King in her? Why have they provoked me to anger with their graven images, and with foreign vanities?

contents.verseText: The harvest is past, the summer is ended, and we are not saved.
contents: The harvest is past, the summer is ended, and we are not saved.

contents.verseText: For the hurt of the daughter of my people am I hurt: I mourn; dismay hath taken hold on me.
contents: For the hurt of the daughter of my people am I hurt: I mourn; dismay hath taken hold on me.

contents.verseText: Is there no balm in Gilead? is there no physician there? why then is not the health of the daughter of my people recovered?
contents: Is there no balm in Gilead? is there no physician there? why then is not the health of the daughter of my people
recovered?

contents.verseText: Oh that my head were waters, and mine eyes a fountain of tears, that I might weep day and night for the slain of the daughter of my people!
contents: Oh that my head were waters, and mine eyes a fountain of tears, that I might weep day and night for the slain of the
daughter of my people!

contents.verseText: Oh that I had in the wilderness a lodging-place of wayfaring men; that I might leave my people, and go from them! for they are all adulterers, an assembly of treacherous men.
contents: Oh that I had in the wilderness a lodging-place of wayfaring men; that I might leave my people, and go from them! for they
are all adulterers, an assembly of treacherous men.

contents.verseText: And they bend their tongue, as it were their bow, for falsehood; and they are grown strong in the land, but not for truth: for they proceed from evil to evil, and they know not me, saith Jehovah.
contents: And they bend their tongue,
their bow, for falsehood; and they are grown strong in the land, but not
for truth: for they proceed from evil to evil, and they know not me, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Take ye heed every one of his neighbor, and trust ye not in any brother; for every brother will utterly supplant, and every neighbor will go about with slanders.
contents: Take ye heed every one of his neighbor, and trust ye not in any brother; for every brother will utterly supplant, and
every neighbor will go about with slanders.

contents.verseText: And they will deceive every one his neighbor, and will not speak the truth: they have taught their tongue to speak lies; they weary themselves to commit iniquity.
contents: And they will deceive every one his neighbor, and will not speak the truth: they have taught their tongue to speak lies;
they weary themselves to commit iniquity.

contents.verseText: Thy habitation is in the midst of deceit; through deceit they refuse to know me, saith Jehovah.
contents: Thy habitation is in the midst of deceit; through deceit they refuse to know me, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, Behold, I will melt them, and try them; for how else should I do, because of the daughter of my people?
contents: Therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, Behold, I will melt them, and try them; for how
should I do, because of the daughter of my people?

contents.verseText: Their tongue is a deadly arrow; it speaketh deceit: one speaketh peaceably to his neighbor with his mouth, but in his heart he layeth wait for him.
contents: Their tongue is a deadly arrow; it speaketh deceit: one speaketh peaceably to his neighbor with his mouth, but in his
heart he layeth wait for him.

contents.verseText: Shall I not visit them for these things? saith Jehovah; shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
contents: Shall I not visit them for these things? saith Jehovah; shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
