contents.verseText: For the mountains will I take up a weeping and wailing, and for the pastures of the wilderness a lamentation, because they are burned up, so that none passeth through; neither can men hear the voice of the cattle; both the birds of the heavens and the beasts are fled, they are gone.
contents: For the mountains will I take up a weeping and wailing, and for the pastures of the wilderness a lamentation, because
they are burned up, so that none passeth through; neither can men hear the voice of the cattle; both the birds of the heavens
and the beasts are fled, they are gone.

contents.verseText: And I will make Jerusalem heaps, a dwelling-place of jackals; and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.
contents: And I will make Jerusalem heaps, a dwelling-place of jackals; and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without
inhabitant.

contents.verseText: Who is the wise man, that may understand this? and who is he to whom the mouth of Jehovah hath spoken, that he may declare it? wherefore is the land perished and burned up like a wilderness, so that none passeth through?
contents: Who is the wise man, that may understand this? and
he to whom the mouth of Jehovah hath spoken, that he may declare it? wherefore is the land perished and burned up like a wilderness, so that none passeth through?

contents.verseText: And Jehovah saith, Because they have forsaken my law which I set before them, and have not obeyed my voice, neither walked therein,
contents: And Jehovah saith, Because they have forsaken my law which I set before them, and have not obeyed my voice, neither
walked therein,

contents.verseText: but have walked after the stubbornness of their own heart, and after the Baalim, which their fathers taught them;
contents: but have walked after the stubbornness of their own heart, and after the Baalim, which their fathers taught them;

contents.verseText: therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, Behold, I will feed them, even this people, with wormwood, and give them water of gall to drink.
contents: therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, Behold, I will feed them, even this people, with wormwood, and
give them water of gall to drink.

contents.verseText: I will scatter them also among the nations, whom neither they nor their fathers have known; and I will send the sword after them, till I have consumed them.
contents: I will scatter them also among the nations, whom neither they nor their fathers have known; and I will send the sword
after them, till I have consumed them.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, Consider ye, and call for the mourning women, that they may come; and send for the skilful women, that they may come:
contents: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, Consider ye, and call for the mourning women, that they may come; and send for the skilful
women, that they may come:

contents.verseText: and let them make haste, and take up a wailing for us, that our eyes may run down with tears, and our eyelids gush out with waters.
contents: and let them make haste, and take up a wailing for us, that our eyes may run down with tears, and our eyelids gush out
with waters.

contents.verseText: For a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion, How are we ruined! we are greatly confounded, because we have forsaken the land, because they have cast down our dwellings.
contents: For a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion, How are we ruined! we are greatly confounded, because we have forsaken the
land, because they have cast down our dwellings.

contents.verseText: Yet hear the word of Jehovah, O ye women, and let your ear receive the word of his mouth; and teach your daughters wailing, and every one her neighbor lamentation.
contents: Yet hear the word of Jehovah, O ye women, and let your ear receive the word of his mouth; and teach your daughters
wailing, and every one her neighbor lamentation.

contents.verseText: For death is come up into our windows, it is entered into our palaces; to cut off the children from without, and the young men from the streets.
contents: For death is come up into our windows, it is entered into our palaces; to cut off the children from without,
the young men from the streets.

contents.verseText: Speak, Thus saith Jehovah, The dead bodies of men shall fall as dung upon the open field, and as the handful after the harvestman; and none shall gather them.
contents: Speak, Thus saith Jehovah, The dead bodies of men shall fall as dung upon the open field, and as the handful after the
harvestman; and none shall gather

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah, Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the mighty man glory in his might, let not the rich man glory in his riches;
contents: Thus saith Jehovah, Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the mighty man glory in his might, let not the
rich man glory in his riches;

contents.verseText: but let him that glorieth glory in this, that he hath understanding, and knoweth me, that I am Jehovah who exerciseth lovingkindness, justice, and righteousness, in the earth: for in these things I delight, saith Jehovah.
contents: but let him that glorieth glory in this, that he hath understanding, and knoweth me, that I am Jehovah who exerciseth
lovingkindness, justice, and righteousness, in the earth: for in these things I delight, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will punish all them that are circumcised in their uncircumcision:
contents: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will punish all them that are circumcised in
uncircumcision:

contents.verseText: Egypt, and Judah, and Edom, and the children of Ammon, and Moab, and all that have the corners of their hair cut off, that dwell in the wilderness; for all the nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in heart.
contents: Egypt, and Judah, and Edom, and the children of Ammon, and Moab, and all that have the corners
cut off, that dwell in the wilderness; for all the nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of
Israel are uncircumcised in heart.

contents.verseText: Hear ye the word which Jehovah speaketh unto you, O house of Israel:
contents: Hear ye the word which Jehovah speaketh unto you, O house of Israel:

contents.verseText: thus saith Jehovah, Learn not the way of the nations, and be not dismayed at the signs of heaven; for the nations are dismayed at them.
contents: thus saith Jehovah, Learn not the way of the nations, and be not dismayed at the signs of heaven; for the nations are
dismayed at them.

contents.verseText: For the customs of the peoples are vanity; for one cutteth a tree out of the forest, the work of the hands of the workman with the axe.
contents: For the customs of the peoples are vanity; for one cutteth a tree out of the forest, the work of the hands of the workman
with the axe.

contents.verseText: They deck it with silver and with gold; they fasten it with nails and with hammers, that it move not.
contents: They deck it with silver and with gold; they fasten it with nails and with hammers, that it move not.

contents.verseText: They are like a palm-tree, of turned work, and speak not: they must needs be borne, because they cannot go. Be not afraid of them; for they cannot do evil, neither is it in them to do good.
contents: They are like a palm-tree, of turned work, and speak not: they must needs be borne, because they cannot go. Be not afraid
of them; for they cannot do evil, neither is it in them to do good.

contents.verseText: There is none like unto thee, O Jehovah; thou art great, and thy name is great in might.
contents: There is none like unto thee, O Jehovah; thou art great, and thy name is great in might.

contents.verseText: Who should not fear thee, O King of the nations? for to thee doth it appertain; forasmuch as among all the wise men of the nations, and in all their royal estate, there is none like unto thee.
contents: Who should not fear thee, O King of the nations? for to thee doth it appertain; forasmuch as among all the wise men of the
nations, and in all their royal estate, there is none like unto thee.

contents.verseText: But they are together brutish and foolish: the instruction of idols! it is but a stock.
contents: But they are together brutish and foolish: the instruction of idols! it is but a stock.

contents.verseText: There is silver beaten into plates, which is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, the work of the artificer and of the hands of the goldsmith; blue and purple for their clothing; they are all the work of skilful men.
contents: There is silver beaten into plates, which is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, the work of the artificer and of
the hands of the goldsmith; blue and purple for their clothing; they are all the work of skilful men.

contents.verseText: But Jehovah is the true God; he is the living God, and an everlasting King: at his wrath the earth trembleth, and the nations are not able to abide his indignation.
contents: But Jehovah is the true God; he is the living God, and an everlasting King: at his wrath the earth trembleth, and the
nations are not able to abide his indignation.

contents.verseText: Thus shall ye say unto them, The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth, these shall perish from the earth, and from under the heavens.
contents: Thus shall ye say unto them, The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth, these shall perish from the earth,
and from under the heavens.

contents.verseText: He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and by his understanding hath he stretched out the heavens.
contents: He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and by his understanding hath he
stretched out the heavens.

contents.verseText: When he uttereth his voice, there is a tumult of waters in the heavens, and he causeth the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings for the rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasuries.
contents: When he uttereth his voice, there is a tumult of waters in the heavens, and he causeth the vapors to ascend from the ends
of the earth; he maketh lightnings for the rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasuries.

contents.verseText: Every man is become brutish and is without knowledge; every goldsmith is put to shame by his graven image; for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.
contents: Every man is become brutish
without knowledge; every goldsmith is put to shame by his graven image; for
his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.

contents.verseText: They are vanity, a work of delusion: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.
contents: They are vanity, a work of delusion: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.

contents.verseText: The portion of Jacob is not like these; for he is the former of all things; and Israel is the tribe of his inheritance: Jehovah of hosts is his name.
contents: The portion of Jacob is not like these; for he is the former of all things; and Israel is the tribe of his inheritance:
Jehovah of hosts is his name.

contents.verseText: Gather up thy wares out of the land, O thou that abidest in the siege.
contents: Gather up thy wares out of the land, O thou that abidest in the siege.

contents.verseText: For thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this time, and will distress them, that they may feel it.
contents: For thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this time, and will distress them, that
they may feel

contents.verseText: Woe is me because of my hurt! my wound is grievous: but I said, Truly this is my grief, and I must bear it.
contents: Woe is me because of my hurt! my wound is grievous: but I said, Truly this is
grief, and I must bear it.

contents.verseText: My tent is destroyed, and all my cords are broken: my children are gone forth from me, and they are not: there is none to spread my tent any more, and to set up my curtains.
contents: My tent is destroyed, and all my cords are broken: my children are gone forth from me, and they are not: there is none to
spread my tent any more, and to set up my curtains.

contents.verseText: For the shepherds are become brutish, and have not inquired of Jehovah: therefore they have not prospered, and all their flocks are scattered.
contents: For the shepherds are become brutish, and have not inquired of Jehovah: therefore they have not prospered, and all their
flocks are scattered.

contents.verseText: The voice of tidings, behold, it cometh, and a great commotion out of the north country, to make the cities of Judah a desolation, a dwelling-place of jackals.
contents: The voice of tidings, behold, it cometh, and a great commotion out of the north country, to make the cities of Judah a
desolation, a dwelling-place of jackals.

contents.verseText: O Jehovah, I know that the way of man is not in himself; it is not in man that walketh to direct his steps.
contents: O Jehovah, I know that the way of man is not in himself; it is not in man that walketh to direct his steps.

contents.verseText: O Jehovah, correct me, but in measure; not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.
contents: O Jehovah, correct me, but in measure; not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.

contents.verseText: Pour out thy wrath upon the nations that know thee not, and upon the families that call not on thy name; for they have devoured Jacob, yea, they have devoured him and consumed him, and have laid waste his habitation.
contents: Pour out thy wrath upon the nations that know thee not, and upon the families that call not on thy name; for they have
devoured Jacob, yea, they have devoured him and consumed him, and have laid waste his habitation.

contents.verseText: The word that came to Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying,
contents: The word that came to Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying,

contents.verseText: Hear ye the words of this covenant, and speak unto the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem;
contents: Hear ye the words of this covenant, and speak unto the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem;

contents.verseText: and say thou unto them, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel: Cursed be the man that heareth not the words of this covenant,
contents: and say thou unto them, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel: Cursed be the man that heareth not the words of this
covenant,

contents.verseText: which I commanded your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the iron furnace, saying, Obey my voice, and do them, according to all which I command you: so shall ye be my people, and I will be your God;
contents: which I commanded your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the iron furnace,
saying, Obey my voice, and do them, according to all which I command you: so shall ye be my people, and I will be your God;

contents.verseText: that I may establish the oath which I sware unto your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as at this day. Then answered I, and said, Amen, O Jehovah.
contents: that I may establish the oath which I sware unto your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as at this
day. Then answered I, and said, Amen, O Jehovah.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah said unto me, Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, Hear ye the words of this covenant, and do them.
contents: And Jehovah said unto me, Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, Hear
ye the words of this covenant, and do them.

contents.verseText: For I earnestly protested unto your fathers in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, even unto this day, rising early and protesting, saying, Obey my voice.
contents: For I earnestly protested unto your fathers in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, even unto this
day, rising early and protesting, saying, Obey my voice.

contents.verseText: Yet they obeyed not, nor inclined their ear, but walked every one in the stubbornness of their evil heart: therefore I brought upon them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do, but they did them not.
contents: Yet they obeyed not, nor inclined their ear, but walked every one in the stubbornness of their evil heart: therefore I
brought upon them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do, but they did them not.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah said unto me, A conspiracy is found among the men of Judah, and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
contents: And Jehovah said unto me, A conspiracy is found among the men of Judah, and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: They are turned back to the iniquities of their forefathers, who refused to hear my words; and they are gone after other gods to serve them: the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken my covenant which I made with their fathers.
contents: They are turned back to the iniquities of their forefathers, who refused to hear my words; and they are gone after other
gods to serve them: the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken my covenant which I made with their fathers.

contents.verseText: Therefore thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will bring evil upon them, which they shall not be able to escape; and they shall cry unto me, but I will not hearken unto them.
contents: Therefore thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will bring evil upon them, which they shall not be able to escape; and they shall
cry unto me, but I will not hearken unto them.

contents.verseText: Then shall the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem go and cry unto the gods unto which they offer incense: but they will not save them at all in the time of their trouble.
contents: Then shall the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem go and cry unto the gods unto which they offer incense:
but they will not save them at all in the time of their trouble.

contents.verseText: For according to the number of thy cities are thy gods, O Judah; and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem have ye set up altars to the shameful thing, even altars to burn incense unto Baal.
contents: For according to the number of thy cities are thy gods, O Judah; and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem
have ye set up altars to the shameful thing, even altars to burn incense unto Baal.

contents.verseText: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up cry nor prayer for them; for I will not hear them in the time that they cry unto me because of their trouble.
contents: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up cry nor prayer for them; for I will not hear them in the time
that they cry unto me because of their trouble.

contents.verseText: What hath my beloved to do in my house, seeing she hath wrought lewdness with many, and the holy flesh is passed from thee? when thou doest evil, then thou rejoicest.
contents: What hath my beloved to do in my house, seeing she hath wrought lewdness
many, and the holy flesh is passed from thee? when thou doest evil, then thou rejoicest.

contents.verseText: Jehovah called thy name, A green olive-tree, fair with goodly fruit: with the noise of a great tumult he hath kindled fire upon it, and the branches of it are broken.
contents: Jehovah called thy name, A green olive-tree, fair with goodly fruit: with the noise of a great tumult he hath kindled
fire upon it, and the branches of it are broken.

contents.verseText: For Jehovah of hosts, who planted thee, hath pronounced evil against thee, because of the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have wrought for themselves in provoking me to anger by offering incense unto Baal.
contents: For Jehovah of hosts, who planted thee, hath pronounced evil against thee, because of the evil of the house of Israel and
of the house of Judah, which they have wrought for themselves in provoking me to anger by offering incense unto Baal.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah gave me knowledge of it, and I knew it: then thou showedst me their doings.
contents: And Jehovah gave me knowledge of it, and I knew it: then thou showedst me their doings.

contents.verseText: But I was like a gentle lamb that is led to the slaughter; and I knew not that they had devised devices against me, saying, Let us destroy the tree with the fruit thereof, and let us cut him off from the land of the living, that his name may be no more remembered.
contents: But I was like a gentle lamb that is led to the slaughter; and I knew not that they had devised devices against me,
, Let us destroy the tree with the fruit thereof, and let us cut him off from the land of the living, that his
name may be no more remembered.

contents.verseText: But, O Jehovah of hosts, who judgest righteously, who triest the heart and the mind, I shall see thy vengeance on them; for unto thee have I revealed my cause.
contents: But, O Jehovah of hosts, who judgest righteously, who triest the heart and the mind, I shall see thy vengeance on them;
for unto thee have I revealed my cause.

contents.verseText: Therefore thus saith Jehovah concerning the men of Anathoth, that seek thy life, saying, Thou shalt not prophesy in the name of Jehovah, that thou die not by our hand;
contents: Therefore thus saith Jehovah concerning the men of Anathoth, that seek thy life, saying, Thou shalt not prophesy in the
name of Jehovah, that thou die not by our hand;

contents.verseText: therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, Behold, I will punish them: the young men shall die by the sword; their sons and their daughters shall die by famine;
contents: therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, Behold, I will punish them: the young men shall die by the sword; their sons and
their daughters shall die by famine;

contents.verseText: and there shall be no remnant unto them: for I will bring evil upon the men of Anathoth, even the year of their visitation.
contents: and there shall be no remnant unto them: for I will bring evil upon the men of Anathoth, even the year of their
visitation.

contents.verseText: Righteous art thou, O Jehovah, when I contend with thee; yet would I reason the cause with thee: wherefore doth the way of the wicked prosper? wherefore are all they at ease that deal very treacherously?
contents: Righteous art thou, O Jehovah, when I contend with thee; yet would I reason the cause with thee: wherefore doth the way of
the wicked prosper? wherefore are all they at ease that deal very treacherously?

contents.verseText: Thou hast planted them, yea, they have taken root; they grow, yea, they bring forth fruit: thou art near in their mouth, and far from their heart.
contents: Thou hast planted them, yea, they have taken root; they grow, yea, they bring forth fruit: thou art near in their mouth,
and far from their heart.

contents.verseText: But thou, O Jehovah, knowest me; thou seest me, and triest my heart toward thee: pull them out like sheep for the slaughter, and prepare them for the day of slaughter.
contents: But thou, O Jehovah, knowest me; thou seest me, and triest my heart toward thee: pull them out like sheep for the
slaughter, and prepare them for the day of slaughter.

contents.verseText: How long shall the land mourn, and the herbs of the whole country wither? for the wickedness of them that dwell therein, the beasts are consumed, and the birds; because they said, He shall not see our latter end.
contents: How long shall the land mourn, and the herbs of the whole country wither? for the wickedness of them that dwell therein,
the beasts are consumed, and the birds; because they said, He shall not see our latter end.

contents.verseText: If thou hast run with the footmen, and they have wearied thee, then how canst thou contend with horses? and though in a land of peace thou art secure, yet how wilt thou do in the pride of the Jordan?
contents: If thou hast run with the footmen, and they have wearied thee, then how canst thou contend with horses? and though in a
land of peace thou art secure, yet how wilt thou do in the pride of the Jordan?

contents.verseText: For even thy brethren, and the house of thy father, even they have dealt treacherously with thee; even they have cried aloud after thee: believe them not, though they speak fair words unto thee.
contents: For even thy brethren, and the house of thy father, even they have dealt treacherously with thee; even they have cried
aloud after thee: believe them not, though they speak fair words unto thee.

contents.verseText: I have forsaken my house, I have cast off my heritage; I have given the dearly beloved of my soul into the hand of her enemies.
contents: I have forsaken my house, I have cast off my heritage; I have given the dearly beloved of my soul into the hand of her
enemies.

contents.verseText: My heritage is become unto me as a lion in the forest: she hath uttered her voice against me; therefore I have hated her.
contents: My heritage is become unto me as a lion in the forest: she hath uttered her voice against me; therefore I have hated her.

contents.verseText: Is my heritage unto me as a speckled bird of prey? are the birds of prey against her round about? go ye, assemble all the beasts of the field, bring them to devour.
contents: Is my heritage unto me as a speckled bird of prey? are the birds of prey against her round about? go ye, assemble all the
beasts of the field, bring them to devour.

contents.verseText: Many shepherds have destroyed my vineyard, they have trodden my portion under foot, they have made my pleasant portion a desolate wilderness.
contents: Many shepherds have destroyed my vineyard, they have trodden my portion under foot, they have made my pleasant portion a
desolate wilderness.

contents.verseText: They have made it a desolation; it mourneth unto me, being desolate; the whole land is made desolate, because no man layeth it to heart.
contents: They have made it a desolation; it mourneth unto me, being desolate; the whole land is made desolate, because no man
layeth it to heart.

contents.verseText: Destroyers are come upon all the bare heights in the wilderness; for the sword of Jehovah devoureth from the one end of the land even to the other end of the land: no flesh hath peace.
contents: Destroyers are come upon all the bare heights in the wilderness; for the sword of Jehovah devoureth from the one end of
the land even to the other end of the land: no flesh hath peace.

contents.verseText: They have sown wheat, and have reaped thorns; they have put themselves to pain, and profit nothing: and ye shall be ashamed of your fruits, because of the fierce anger of Jehovah.
contents: They have sown wheat, and have reaped thorns; they have put themselves to pain, and profit nothing: and ye shall be
ashamed of your fruits, because of the fierce anger of Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah against all mine evil neighbors, that touch the inheritance which I have caused my people Israel to inherit: behold, I will pluck them up from off their land, and will pluck up the house of Judah from among them.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah against all mine evil neighbors, that touch the inheritance which I have caused my people Israel to
inherit: behold, I will pluck them up from off their land, and will pluck up the house of Judah from among them.

contents.verseText: And it shall come to pass, after that I have plucked them up, I will return and have compassion on them; and I will bring them again, every man to his heritage, and every man to his land.
contents: And it shall come to pass, after that I have plucked them up, I will return and have compassion on them; and I will bring
them again, every man to his heritage, and every man to his land.

contents.verseText: And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently learn the ways of my people, to swear by my name, As Jehovah liveth; even as they taught my people to swear by Baal; then shall they be built up in the midst of my people.
contents: And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently learn the ways of my people, to swear by my name, As Jehovah liveth;
even as they taught my people to swear by Baal; then shall they be built up in the midst of my people.

contents.verseText: But if they will not hear, then will I pluck up that nation, plucking up and destroying it, saith Jehovah.
contents: But if they will not hear, then will I pluck up that nation, plucking up and destroying it, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah unto me, Go, and buy thee a linen girdle, and put it upon thy loins, and put it not in water.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah unto me, Go, and buy thee a linen girdle, and put it upon thy loins, and put it not in water.

contents.verseText: So I bought a girdle according to the word of Jehovah, and put it upon my loins.
contents: So I bought a girdle according to the word of Jehovah, and put it upon my loins.

contents.verseText: And the word of Jehovah came unto me the second time, saying,
contents: And the word of Jehovah came unto me the second time, saying,

contents.verseText: Take the girdle that thou hast bought, which is upon thy loins, and arise, go to the Euphrates, and hide it there in a cleft of the rock.
contents: Take the girdle that thou hast bought, which is upon thy loins, and arise, go to the Euphrates, and hide it there in a
cleft of the rock.

contents.verseText: So I went, and hid it by the Euphrates, as Jehovah commanded me.
contents: So I went, and hid it by the Euphrates, as Jehovah commanded me.

contents.verseText: And it came to pass after many days, that Jehovah said unto me, Arise, go to the Euphrates, and take the girdle from thence, which I commanded thee to hide there.
contents: And it came to pass after many days, that Jehovah said unto me, Arise, go to the Euphrates, and take the girdle from
thence, which I commanded thee to hide there.

contents.verseText: Then I went to the Euphrates, and digged, and took the girdle from the place where I had hid it; and, behold, the girdle was marred, it was profitable for nothing.
contents: Then I went to the Euphrates, and digged, and took the girdle from the place where I had hid it; and, behold, the girdle
was marred, it was profitable for nothing.

contents.verseText: Then the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
contents: Then the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah, After this manner will I mar the pride of Judah, and the great pride of Jerusalem.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah, After this manner will I mar the pride of Judah, and the great pride of Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: This evil people, that refuse to hear my words, that walk in the stubbornness of their heart, and are gone after other gods to serve them, and to worship them, shall even be as this girdle, which is profitable for nothing.
contents: This evil people, that refuse to hear my words, that walk in the stubbornness of their heart, and are gone after other
gods to serve them, and to worship them, shall even be as this girdle, which is profitable for nothing.

contents.verseText: For as the girdle cleaveth to the loins of a man, so have I caused to cleave unto me the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah, saith Jehovah; that they may be unto me for a people, and for a name, and for a praise, and for a glory: but they would not hear.
contents: For as the girdle cleaveth to the loins of a man, so have I caused to cleave unto me the whole house of Israel and the
whole house of Judah, saith Jehovah; that they may be unto me for a people, and for a name, and for a praise, and for a glory:
but they would not hear.

contents.verseText: Therefore thou shalt speak unto them this word: Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, Every bottle shall be filled with wine: and they shall say unto thee, Do we not certainly know that every bottle shall be filled with wine?
contents: Therefore thou shalt speak unto them this word: Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, Every bottle shall be filled with
wine: and they shall say unto thee, Do we not certainly know that every bottle shall be filled with wine?

contents.verseText: Then shalt thou say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will fill all the inhabitants of this land, even the kings that sit upon David’s throne, and the priests, and the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, with drunkenness.
contents: Then shalt thou say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will fill all the inhabitants of this land, even the kings
that sit upon David’s throne, and the priests, and the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, with drunkenness.

contents.verseText: And I will dash them one against another, even the fathers and the sons together, saith Jehovah: I will not pity, nor spare, nor have compassion, that I should not destroy them.
contents: And I will dash them one against another, even the fathers and the sons together, saith Jehovah: I will not pity, nor
spare, nor have compassion, that I should not destroy them.

contents.verseText: Hear ye, and give ear; be not proud; for Jehovah hath spoken.
contents: Hear ye, and give ear; be not proud; for Jehovah hath spoken.

contents.verseText: Give glory to Jehovah your God, before he cause darkness, and before your feet stumble upon the dark mountains, and, while ye look for light, he turn it into the shadow of death, and make it gross darkness.
contents: Give glory to Jehovah your God, before he cause darkness, and before your feet stumble upon the dark mountains, and,
while ye look for light, he turn it into the shadow of death, and make it gross darkness.

contents.verseText: But if ye will not hear it, my soul shall weep in secret for your pride; and mine eye shall weep sore, and run down with tears, because Jehovah’s flock is taken captive.
contents: But if ye will not hear it, my soul shall weep in secret for
pride; and mine eye shall weep sore, and run down with tears, because Jehovah’s flock is taken captive.

contents.verseText: Say thou unto the king and to the queen-mother, Humble yourselves, sit down; for your headtires are come down, even the crown of your glory.
contents: Say thou unto the king and to the queen-mother, Humble yourselves, sit down; for your headtires are come down, even the
crown of your glory.

contents.verseText: The cities of the South are shut up, and there is none to open them: Judah is carried away captive, all of it; it is wholly carried away captive.
contents: The cities of the South are shut up, and there is none to open them: Judah is carried away captive, all of it; it is
wholly carried away captive.

contents.verseText: Lift up your eyes, and behold them that come from the north: where is the flock that was given thee, thy beautiful flock?
contents: Lift up your eyes, and behold them that come from the north: where is the flock that was given thee, thy beautiful flock?

contents.verseText: What wilt thou say, when he shall set over thee as head those whom thou hast thyself taught to be friends to thee? shall not sorrows take hold of thee, as of a woman in travail?
contents: What wilt thou say, when he shall set over thee as head those whom thou hast thyself taught to be friends to thee? shall
not sorrows take hold of thee, as of a woman in travail?

contents.verseText: And if thou say in thy heart, Wherefore are these things come upon me? for the greatness of thine iniquity are thy skirts uncovered, and thy heels suffer violence.
contents: And if thou say in thy heart, Wherefore are these things come upon me? for the greatness of thine iniquity are thy skirts
uncovered, and thy heels suffer violence.

contents.verseText: Can the Ethiopian change his skin, or the leopard his spots? then may ye also do good, that are accustomed to do evil.
contents: Can the Ethiopian change his skin, or the leopard his spots? then may ye also do good, that are accustomed to do evil.

contents.verseText: Therefore will I scatter them, as the stubble that passeth away, by the wind of the wilderness.
contents: Therefore will I scatter them, as the stubble that passeth away, by the wind of the wilderness.

contents.verseText: This is thy lot, the portion measured unto thee from me, saith Jehovah; because thou hast forgotten me, and trusted in falsehood.
contents: This is thy lot, the portion measured unto thee from me, saith Jehovah; because thou hast forgotten me, and trusted in
falsehood.

contents.verseText: Therefore will I also uncover thy skirts upon thy face, and thy shame shall appear.
contents: Therefore will I also uncover thy skirts upon thy face, and thy shame shall appear.

contents.verseText: I have seen thine abominations, even thine adulteries, and thy neighings, the lewdness of thy whoredom, on the hills in the field. Woe unto thee, O Jerusalem! thou wilt not be made clean; how long shall it yet be?
contents: I have seen thine abominations, even thine adulteries, and thy neighings, the lewdness of thy whoredom, on the hills in
the field. Woe unto thee, O Jerusalem! thou wilt not be made clean; how long shall it yet be?

contents.verseText: The word of Jehovah that came to Jeremiah concerning the drought.
contents: The word of Jehovah that came to Jeremiah concerning the drought.

contents.verseText: Judah mourneth, and the gates thereof languish, they sit in black upon the ground; and the cry of Jerusalem is gone up.
contents: Judah mourneth, and the gates thereof languish, they sit in black upon the ground; and the cry of Jerusalem is gone up.

contents.verseText: And their nobles send their little ones to the waters: they come to the cisterns, and find no water; they return with their vessels empty; they are put to shame and confounded, and cover their heads.
contents: And their nobles send their little ones to the waters: they come to the cisterns, and find no water; they return with
their vessels empty; they are put to shame and confounded, and cover their heads.

contents.verseText: Because of the ground which is cracked, for that no rain hath been in the land, the plowmen are put to shame, they cover their heads.
contents: Because of the ground which is cracked, for that no rain hath been in the land, the plowmen are put to shame, they cover
their heads.

contents.verseText: Yea, the hind also in the field calveth, and forsaketh her young, because there is no grass.
contents: Yea, the hind also in the field calveth, and forsaketh
, because there is no grass.

contents.verseText: And the wild asses stand on the bare heights, they pant for air like jackals; their eyes fail, because there is no herbage.
contents: And the wild asses stand on the bare heights, they pant for air like jackals; their eyes fail, because there is no
herbage.

contents.verseText: Though our iniquities testify against us, work thou for thy name’s sake, O Jehovah; for our backslidings are many; we have sinned against thee.
contents: Though our iniquities testify against us, work thou for thy name’s sake, O Jehovah; for our backslidings are many; we have
sinned against thee.

contents.verseText: O thou hope of Israel, the Saviour thereof in the time of trouble, why shouldest thou be as a sojourner in the land, and as a wayfaring man that turneth aside to tarry for a night?
contents: O thou hope of Israel, the Saviour thereof in the time of trouble, why shouldest thou be as a sojourner in the land, and
as a wayfaring man that turneth aside to tarry for a night?

contents.verseText: Why shouldest thou be as a man affrighted, as a mighty man that cannot save? yet thou, O Jehovah, art in the midst of us, and we are called by thy name; leave us not.
contents: Why shouldest thou be as a man affrighted, as a mighty man that cannot save? yet thou, O Jehovah, art in the midst of us,
and we are called by thy name; leave us not.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah unto this people, Even so have they loved to wander; they have not refrained their feet: therefore Jehovah doth not accept them; now will he remember their iniquity, and visit their sins.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah unto this people, Even so have they loved to wander; they have not refrained their feet: therefore
Jehovah doth not accept them; now will he remember their iniquity, and visit their sins.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah said unto me, Pray not for this people for their good.
contents: And Jehovah said unto me, Pray not for this people for
good.

contents.verseText: When they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer burnt-offering and meal-offering, I will not accept them; but I will consume them by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence.
contents: When they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer burnt-offering and meal-offering, I will not accept them;
but I will consume them by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence.

contents.verseText: Then said I, Ah, Lord Jehovah! behold, the prophets say unto them, Ye shall not see the sword, neither shall ye have famine; but I will give you assured peace in this place.
contents: Then said I, Ah, Lord Jehovah! behold, the prophets say unto them, Ye shall not see the sword, neither shall ye have
famine; but I will give you assured peace in this place.

contents.verseText: Then Jehovah said unto me, The prophets prophesy lies in my name; I sent them not, neither have I commanded them, neither spake I unto them: they prophesy unto you a lying vision, and divination, and a thing of nought, and the deceit of their own heart.
contents: Then Jehovah said unto me, The prophets prophesy lies in my name; I sent them not, neither have I commanded them, neither
spake I unto them: they prophesy unto you a lying vision, and divination, and a thing of nought, and the deceit of their own
heart.

contents.verseText: Therefore thus saith Jehovah concerning the prophets that prophesy in my name, and I sent them not, yet they say, Sword and famine shall not be in this land: By sword and famine shall those prophets be consumed.
contents: Therefore thus saith Jehovah concerning the prophets that prophesy in my name, and I sent them not, yet they say, Sword
and famine shall not be in this land: By sword and famine shall those prophets be consumed.

contents.verseText: And the people to whom they prophesy shall be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword; and they shall have none to bury them—them, their wives, nor their sons, nor their daughters: for I will pour their wickedness upon them.
contents: And the people to whom they prophesy shall be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword;
and they shall have none to bury them—them, their wives, nor their sons, nor their daughters: for I will pour their wickedness
upon them.

contents.verseText: And thou shalt say this word unto them, Let mine eyes run down with tears night and day, and let them not cease; for the virgin daughter of my people is broken with a great breach, with a very grievous wound.
contents: And thou shalt say this word unto them, Let mine eyes run down with tears night and day, and let them not cease; for the
virgin daughter of my people is broken with a great breach, with a very grievous wound.

contents.verseText: If I go forth into the field, then, behold, the slain with the sword! and if I enter into the city, then, behold, they that are sick with famine! for both the prophet and the priest go about in the land, and have no knowledge.
contents: If I go forth into the field, then, behold, the slain with the sword! and if I enter into the city, then, behold, they
that are sick with famine! for both the prophet and the priest go about in the land, and have no knowledge.

contents.verseText: Hast thou utterly rejected Judah? hath thy soul loathed Zion? why hast thou smitten us, and there is no healing for us? We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of healing, and, behold, dismay!
contents: Hast thou utterly rejected Judah? hath thy soul loathed Zion? why hast thou smitten us, and there is no healing for us?
We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of healing, and, behold, dismay!

contents.verseText: We acknowledge, O Jehovah, our wickedness, and the iniquity of our fathers; for we have sinned against thee.
contents: We acknowledge, O Jehovah, our wickedness, and the iniquity of our fathers; for we have sinned against thee.

contents.verseText: Do not abhor us, for thy name’s sake; do not disgrace the throne of thy glory: remember, break not thy covenant with us.
contents: Do not abhor
, for thy name’s sake; do not disgrace the throne of thy glory: remember, break not thy covenant
with us.

contents.verseText: Are there any among the vanities of the nations that can cause rain? or can the heavens give showers? art not thou he, O Jehovah our God? therefore we will wait for thee; for thou hast made all these things.
contents: Are there any among the vanities of the nations that can cause rain? or can the heavens give showers? art not thou he, O
Jehovah our God? therefore we will wait for thee; for thou hast made all these things.

contents.verseText: Then said Jehovah unto me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my mind would not be toward this people: cast them out of my sight, and let them go forth.
contents: Then said Jehovah unto me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my mind would not be toward this people: cast them
out of my sight, and let them go forth.

contents.verseText: And it shall come to pass, when they say unto thee, Whither shall we go forth? then thou shalt tell them, Thus saith Jehovah: Such as are for death, to death; and such as are for the sword, to the sword; and such as are for the famine, to the famine; and such as are for captivity, to captivity.
contents: And it shall come to pass, when they say unto thee, Whither shall we go forth? then thou shalt tell them, Thus saith
Jehovah: Such as are for death, to death; and such as are for the sword, to the sword; and such as are for the famine, to the
famine; and such as are for captivity, to captivity.

contents.verseText: And I will appoint over them four kinds, saith Jehovah: the sword to slay, and the dogs to tear, and the birds of the heavens, and the beasts of the earth, to devour and to destroy.
contents: And I will appoint over them four kinds, saith Jehovah: the sword to slay, and the dogs to tear, and the birds of the
heavens, and the beasts of the earth, to devour and to destroy.

contents.verseText: And I will cause them to be tossed to and fro among all the kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh, the son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, for that which he did in Jerusalem.
contents: And I will cause them to be tossed to and fro among all the kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh, the son of
Hezekiah, king of Judah, for that which he did in Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: For who will have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem? or who will bemoan thee? or who will turn aside to ask of thy welfare?
contents: For who will have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem? or who will bemoan thee? or who will turn aside to ask of thy welfare?

contents.verseText: Thou hast rejected me, saith Jehovah, thou art gone backward: therefore have I stretched out my hand against thee, and destroyed thee; I am weary with repenting.
contents: Thou hast rejected me, saith Jehovah, thou art gone backward: therefore have I stretched out my hand against thee, and
destroyed thee; I am weary with repenting.

contents.verseText: And I have winnowed them with a fan in the gates of the land; I have bereaved them of children, I have destroyed my people; they returned not from their ways.
contents: And I have winnowed them with a fan in the gates of the land; I have bereaved
of children, I have destroyed my people; they returned not from their ways.

contents.verseText: Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas; I have brought upon them against the mother of the young men a destroyer at noonday: I have caused anguish and terrors to fall upon her suddenly.
contents: Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas; I have brought upon them against the mother of the young men
a destroyer at noonday: I have caused anguish and terrors to fall upon her suddenly.

contents.verseText: She that hath borne seven languisheth; she hath given up the ghost; her sun is gone down while it was yet day; she hath been put to shame and confounded: and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies, saith Jehovah.
contents: She that hath borne seven languisheth; she hath given up the ghost; her sun is gone down while it was yet day; she hath
been put to shame and confounded: and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Woe is me, my mother, that thou hast borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have not lent, neither have men lent to me; yet every one of them doth curse me.
contents: Woe is me, my mother, that thou hast borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have not
lent, neither have men lent to me;
every one of them doth curse me.

contents.verseText: Jehovah said, Verily I will strengthen thee for good; verily I will cause the enemy to make supplication unto thee in the time of evil and in the time of affliction.
contents: Jehovah said, Verily I will strengthen thee for good; verily I will cause the enemy to make supplication unto thee in the
time of evil and in the time of affliction.

contents.verseText: Can one break iron, even iron from the north, and brass?
contents: Can one break iron, even iron from the north, and brass?

contents.verseText: Thy substance and thy treasures will I give for a spoil without price, and that for all thy sins, even in all thy borders.
contents: Thy substance and thy treasures will I give for a spoil without price, and that for all thy sins, even in all thy
borders.

contents.verseText: And I will make them to pass with thine enemies into a land which thou knowest not; for a fire is kindled in mine anger, which shall burn upon you.
contents: And I will make
to pass with thine enemies into a land which thou knowest not; for a fire is kindled in
mine anger, which shall burn upon you.

contents.verseText: O Jehovah, thou knowest; remember me, and visit me, and avenge me of my persecutors; take me not away in thy longsuffering: know that for thy sake I have suffered reproach.
contents: O Jehovah, thou knowest; remember me, and visit me, and avenge me of my persecutors; take me not away in thy
longsuffering: know that for thy sake I have suffered reproach.

contents.verseText: Thy words were found, and I did eat them; and thy words were unto me a joy and the rejoicing of my heart: for I am called by thy name, O Jehovah, God of hosts.
contents: Thy words were found, and I did eat them; and thy words were unto me a joy and the rejoicing of my heart: for I am called
by thy name, O Jehovah, God of hosts.

contents.verseText: I sat not in the assembly of them that make merry, nor rejoiced; I sat alone because of thy hand; for thou hast filled me with indignation.
contents: I sat not in the assembly of them that make merry, nor rejoiced; I sat alone because of thy hand; for thou hast filled me
with indignation.

contents.verseText: Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, which refuseth to be healed? wilt thou indeed be unto me as a deceitful brook, as waters that fail?
contents: Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, which refuseth to be healed? wilt thou indeed be unto me as a deceitful
, as waters that fail?

contents.verseText: Therefore thus saith Jehovah, If thou return, then will I bring thee again, that thou mayest stand before me; and if thou take forth the precious from the vile, thou shalt be as my mouth: they shall return unto thee, but thou shalt not return unto them.
contents: Therefore thus saith Jehovah, If thou return, then will I bring thee again, that thou mayest stand before me; and if thou
take forth the precious from the vile, thou shalt be as my mouth: they shall return unto thee, but thou shalt not return unto
them.

contents.verseText: And I will make thee unto this people a fortified brazen wall; and they shall fight against thee, but they shall not prevail against thee; for I am with thee to save thee and to deliver thee, saith Jehovah.
contents: And I will make thee unto this people a fortified brazen wall; and they shall fight against thee, but they shall not
prevail against thee; for I am with thee to save thee and to deliver thee, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked, and I will redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible.
contents: And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked, and I will redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible.

contents.verseText: The word of Jehovah came also unto me, saying,
contents: The word of Jehovah came also unto me, saying,

contents.verseText: Thou shalt not take thee a wife, neither shalt thou have sons or daughters, in this place.
contents: Thou shalt not take thee a wife, neither shalt thou have sons or daughters, in this place.

contents.verseText: For thus saith Jehovah concerning the sons and concerning the daughters that are born in this place, and concerning their mothers that bare them, and concerning their fathers that begat them in this land:
contents: For thus saith Jehovah concerning the sons and concerning the daughters that are born in this place, and concerning their
mothers that bare them, and concerning their fathers that begat them in this land:

contents.verseText: They shall die grievous deaths: they shall not be lamented, neither shall they be buried; they shall be as dung upon the face of the ground; and they shall be consumed by the sword, and by famine; and their dead bodies shall be food for the birds of the heavens, and for the beasts of the earth.
contents: They shall die grievous deaths: they shall not be lamented, neither shall they be buried; they shall be as dung upon the
face of the ground; and they shall be consumed by the sword, and by famine; and their dead bodies shall be food for the birds
of the heavens, and for the beasts of the earth.

contents.verseText: For thus saith Jehovah, Enter not into the house of mourning, neither go to lament, neither bemoan them; for I have taken away my peace from this people, saith Jehovah, even lovingkindness and tender mercies.
contents: For thus saith Jehovah, Enter not into the house of mourning, neither go to lament, neither bemoan them; for I have taken
away my peace from this people, saith Jehovah, even lovingkindness and tender mercies.

contents.verseText: Both great and small shall die in this land; they shall not be buried, neither shall men lament for them, nor cut themselves, nor make themselves bald for them;
contents: Both great and small shall die in this land; they shall not be buried, neither shall men lament for them, nor cut
themselves, nor make themselves bald for them;

contents.verseText: neither shall men break bread for them in mourning, to comfort them for the dead; neither shall men give them the cup of consolation to drink for their father or for their mother.
contents: neither shall men break
for them in mourning, to comfort them for the dead; neither shall men give them
the cup of consolation to drink for their father or for their mother.

contents.verseText: And thou shalt not go into the house of feasting to sit with them, to eat and to drink.
contents: And thou shalt not go into the house of feasting to sit with them, to eat and to drink.

contents.verseText: For thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will cause to cease out of this place, before your eyes and in your days, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride.
contents: For thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will cause to cease out of this place, before your eyes and
in your days, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride.

contents.verseText: And it shall come to pass, when thou shalt show this people all these words, and they shall say unto thee, Wherefore hath Jehovah pronounced all this great evil against us? or what is our iniquity? or what is our sin that we have committed against Jehovah our God?
contents: And it shall come to pass, when thou shalt show this people all these words, and they shall say unto thee, Wherefore hath
Jehovah pronounced all this great evil against us? or what is our iniquity? or what is our sin that we have committed against
Jehovah our God?

contents.verseText: then shalt thou say unto them, Because your fathers have forsaken me, saith Jehovah, and have walked after other gods, and have served them, and have worshipped them, and have forsaken me, and have not kept my law;
contents: then shalt thou say unto them, Because your fathers have forsaken me, saith Jehovah, and have walked after other gods,
and have served them, and have worshipped them, and have forsaken me, and have not kept my law;

contents.verseText: and ye have done evil more than your fathers; for, behold, ye walk every one after the stubbornness of his evil heart, so that ye hearken not unto me:
contents: and ye have done evil more than your fathers; for, behold, ye walk every one after the stubbornness of his evil heart, so
that ye hearken not unto me:

contents.verseText: therefore will I cast you forth out of this land into the land that ye have not known, neither ye nor your fathers; and there shall ye serve other gods day and night; for I will show you no favor.
contents: therefore will I cast you forth out of this land into the land that ye have not known, neither ye nor your fathers; and
there shall ye serve other gods day and night; for I will show you no favor.

contents.verseText: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that it shall no more be said, As Jehovah liveth, that brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;
contents: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that it shall no more be said, As Jehovah liveth, that brought up the
children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;

contents.verseText: but, As Jehovah liveth, that brought up the children of Israel from the land of the north, and from all the countries whither he had driven them. And I will bring them again into their land that I gave unto their fathers.
contents: but, As Jehovah liveth, that brought up the children of Israel from the land of the north, and from all the countries
whither he had driven them. And I will bring them again into their land that I gave unto their fathers.

contents.verseText: Behold, I will send for many fishers, saith Jehovah, and they shall fish them up; and afterward I will send for many hunters, and they shall hunt them from every mountain, and from every hill, and out of the clefts of the rocks.
contents: Behold, I will send for many fishers, saith Jehovah, and they shall fish them up; and afterward I will send for many
hunters, and they shall hunt them from every mountain, and from every hill, and out of the clefts of the rocks.

contents.verseText: For mine eyes are upon all their ways; they are not hid from my face, neither is their iniquity concealed from mine eyes.
contents: For mine eyes are upon all their ways; they are not hid from my face, neither is their iniquity concealed from mine eyes.

contents.verseText: And first I will recompense their iniquity and their sin double, because they have polluted my land with the carcasses of their detestable things, and have filled mine inheritance with their abominations.
contents: And first I will recompense their iniquity and their sin double, because they have polluted my land with the carcasses of
their detestable things, and have filled mine inheritance with their abominations.

contents.verseText: O Jehovah, my strength, and my stronghold, and my refuge in the day of affliction, unto thee shall the nations come from the ends of the earth, and shall say, Our fathers have inherited nought but lies, even vanity and things wherein there is no profit.
contents: O Jehovah, my strength, and my stronghold, and my refuge in the day of affliction, unto thee shall the nations come from
the ends of the earth, and shall say, Our fathers have inherited nought but lies,
vanity and things wherein there is no profit.

contents.verseText: Shall a man make unto himself gods, which yet are no gods?
contents: Shall a man make unto himself gods, which yet are no gods?

contents.verseText: Therefore, behold, I will cause them to know, this once will I cause them to know my hand and my might; and they shall know that my name is Jehovah.
contents: Therefore, behold, I will cause them to know, this once will I cause them to know my hand and my might; and they shall
know that my name is Jehovah.

contents.verseText: The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron, and with the point of a diamond: it is graven upon the tablet of their heart, and upon the horns of your altars;
contents: The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron,
with the point of a diamond: it is graven upon the tablet of
their heart, and upon the horns of your altars;

contents.verseText: whilst their children remember their altars and their Asherim by the green trees upon the high hills.
contents: whilst their children remember their altars and their Asherim by the green trees upon the high hills.

contents.verseText: O my mountain in the field, I will give thy substance and all thy treasures for a spoil, and thy high places, because of sin, throughout all thy borders.
contents: O my mountain in the field, I will give thy substance and all thy treasures for a spoil,
thy high places, because of sin, throughout all thy borders.

contents.verseText: And thou, even of thyself, shalt discontinue from thy heritage that I gave thee; and I will cause thee to serve thine enemies in the land which thou knowest not: for ye have kindled a fire in mine anger which shall burn for ever.
contents: And thou, even of thyself, shalt discontinue from thy heritage that I gave thee; and I will cause thee to serve thine
enemies in the land which thou knowest not: for ye have kindled a fire in mine anger which shall burn for ever.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah: Cursed is the man that trusteth in man, and maketh flesh his arm, and whose heart departeth from Jehovah.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah: Cursed is the man that trusteth in man, and maketh flesh his arm, and whose heart departeth from
Jehovah.

contents.verseText: For he shall be like the heath in the desert, and shall not see when good cometh, but shall inhabit the parched places in the wilderness, a salt land and not inhabited.
contents: For he shall be like the heath in the desert, and shall not see when good cometh, but shall inhabit the parched places in
the wilderness, a salt land and not inhabited.

contents.verseText: Blessed is the man that trusteth in Jehovah, and whose trust Jehovah is.
contents: Blessed is the man that trusteth in Jehovah, and whose trust Jehovah is.

contents.verseText: For he shall be as a tree planted by the waters, that spreadeth out its roots by the river, and shall not fear when heat cometh, but its leaf shall be green; and shall not be careful in the year of drought, neither shall cease from yielding fruit.
contents: For he shall be as a tree planted by the waters, that spreadeth out its roots by the river, and shall not fear when heat
cometh, but its leaf shall be green; and shall not be careful in the year of drought, neither shall cease from yielding fruit.

contents.verseText: The heart is deceitful above all things, and it is exceedingly corrupt: who can know it?
contents: The heart is deceitful above all things, and it is exceedingly corrupt: who can know it?

contents.verseText: I, Jehovah, search the mind, I try the heart, even to give every man according to his ways, according to the fruit of his doings.
contents: I, Jehovah, search the mind, I try the heart, even to give every man according to his ways, according to the fruit of his
doings.

contents.verseText: As the partridge that sitteth on eggs which she hath not laid, so is he that getteth riches, and not by right; in the midst of his days they shall leave him, and at his end he shall be a fool.
contents: As the partridge that sitteth on
which she hath not laid, so is he that getteth riches, and not by right;
in the midst of his days they shall leave him, and at his end he shall be a fool.

contents.verseText: A glorious throne, set on high from the beginning, is the place of our sanctuary.
contents: A glorious throne,
on high from the beginning, is the place of our sanctuary.

contents.verseText: O Jehovah, the hope of Israel, all that forsake thee shall be put to shame. They that depart from me shall be written in the earth, because they have forsaken Jehovah, the fountain of living waters.
contents: O Jehovah, the hope of Israel, all that forsake thee shall be put to shame. They that depart from me shall be written in
the earth, because they have forsaken Jehovah, the fountain of living waters.

contents.verseText: Heal me, O Jehovah, and I shall be healed; save me, and I shall be saved: for thou art my praise.
contents: Heal me, O Jehovah, and I shall be healed; save me, and I shall be saved: for thou art my praise.

contents.verseText: Behold, they say unto me, Where is the word of Jehovah? let it come now.
contents: Behold, they say unto me, Where is the word of Jehovah? let it come now.

contents.verseText: As for me, I have not hastened from being a shepherd after thee; neither have I desired the woeful day; thou knowest: that which came out of my lips was before thy face.
contents: As for me, I have not hastened from being a shepherd after thee; neither have I desired the woeful day; thou knowest:
that which came out of my lips was before thy face.

contents.verseText: Be not a terror unto me: thou art my refuge in the day of evil.
contents: Be not a terror unto me: thou art my refuge in the day of evil.

contents.verseText: Let them be put to shame that persecute me, but let not me be put to shame; let them be dismayed, but let not me be dismayed; bring upon them the day of evil, and destroy them with double destruction.
contents: Let them be put to shame that persecute me, but let not me be put to shame; let them be dismayed, but let not me be
dismayed; bring upon them the day of evil, and destroy them with double destruction.

contents.verseText: Thus said Jehovah unto me: Go, and stand in the gate of the children of the people, whereby the kings of Judah come in, and by which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem;
contents: Thus said Jehovah unto me: Go, and stand in the gate of the children of the people, whereby the kings of Judah come in,
and by which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem;

contents.verseText: and say unto them, Hear ye the word of Jehovah, ye kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, that enter in by these gates:
contents: and say unto them, Hear ye the word of Jehovah, ye kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem,
that enter in by these gates:

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah, Take heed to yourselves, and bear no burden on the sabbath day, nor bring it in by the gates of Jerusalem;
contents: Thus saith Jehovah, Take heed to yourselves, and bear no burden on the sabbath day, nor bring it in by the gates of
Jerusalem;

contents.verseText: neither carry forth a burden out of your houses on the sabbath day, neither do ye any work: but hallow ye the sabbath day, as I commanded your fathers.
contents: neither carry forth a burden out of your houses on the sabbath day, neither do ye any work: but hallow ye the sabbath
day, as I commanded your fathers.

contents.verseText: But they hearkened not, neither inclined their ear, but made their neck stiff, that they might not hear, and might not receive instruction.
contents: But they hearkened not, neither inclined their ear, but made their neck stiff, that they might not hear, and might not
receive instruction.

contents.verseText: And it shall come to pass, if ye diligently hearken unto me, saith Jehovah, to bring in no burden through the gates of this city on the sabbath day, but to hallow the sabbath day, to do no work therein;
contents: And it shall come to pass, if ye diligently hearken unto me, saith Jehovah, to bring in no burden through the gates of
this city on the sabbath day, but to hallow the sabbath day, to do no work therein;

contents.verseText: then shall there enter in by the gates of this city kings and princes sitting upon the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, they, and their princes, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and this city shall remain for ever.
contents: then shall there enter in by the gates of this city kings and princes sitting upon the throne of David, riding in
chariots and on horses, they, and their princes, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and this city shall remain
for ever.

contents.verseText: And they shall come from the cities of Judah, and from the places round about Jerusalem, and from the land of Benjamin, and from the lowland, and from the hill-country, and from the South, bringing burnt-offerings, and sacrifices, and meal-offerings, and frankincense, and bringing sacrifices of thanksgiving, unto the house of Jehovah.
contents: And they shall come from the cities of Judah, and from the places round about Jerusalem, and from the land of Benjamin,
and from the lowland, and from the hill-country, and from the South, bringing burnt-offerings, and sacrifices, and
meal-offerings, and frankincense, and bringing
thanksgiving, unto the house of Jehovah.

contents.verseText: But if ye will not hearken unto me to hallow the sabbath day, and not to bear a burden and enter in at the gates of Jerusalem on the sabbath day; then will I kindle a fire in the gates thereof, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem, and it shall not be quenched.
contents: But if ye will not hearken unto me to hallow the sabbath day, and not to bear a burden and enter in at the gates of
Jerusalem on the sabbath day; then will I kindle a fire in the gates thereof, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem, and
it shall not be quenched.

contents.verseText: The word which came to Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying,
contents: The word which came to Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying,

contents.verseText: Arise, and go down to the potter’s house, and there I will cause thee to hear my words.
contents: Arise, and go down to the potter’s house, and there I will cause thee to hear my words.

contents.verseText: Then I went down to the potter’s house, and, behold, he was making a work on the wheels.
contents: Then I went down to the potter’s house, and, behold, he was making a work on the wheels.

contents.verseText: And when the vessel that he made of the clay was marred in the hand of the potter, he made it again another vessel, as seemed good to the potter to make it.
contents: And when the vessel that he made of the clay was marred in the hand of the potter, he made it again another vessel, as
seemed good to the potter to make it.

contents.verseText: Then the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
contents: Then the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,

contents.verseText: O house of Israel, cannot I do with you as this potter? saith Jehovah. Behold, as the clay in the potter’s hand, so are ye in my hand, O house of Israel.
contents: O house of Israel, cannot I do with you as this potter? saith Jehovah. Behold, as the clay in the potter’s hand, so are ye
in my hand, O house of Israel.

contents.verseText: At what instant I shall speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom, to pluck up and to break down and to destroy it;
contents: At what instant I shall speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom, to pluck up and to break down and to destroy
it;

contents.verseText: if that nation, concerning which I have spoken, turn from their evil, I will repent of the evil that I thought to do unto them.
contents: if that nation, concerning which I have spoken, turn from their evil, I will repent of the evil that I thought to do unto
them.

contents.verseText: And at what instant I shall speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom, to build and to plant it;
contents: And at what instant I shall speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom, to build and to plant it;

contents.verseText: if they do that which is evil in my sight, that they obey not my voice, then I will repent of the good, wherewith I said I would benefit them.
contents: if they do that which is evil in my sight, that they obey not my voice, then I will repent of the good, wherewith I said
I would benefit them.

contents.verseText: Now therefore, speak to the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying, Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, I frame evil against you, and devise a device against you: return ye now every one from his evil way, and amend your ways and your doings.
contents: Now therefore, speak to the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying, Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, I
frame evil against you, and devise a device against you: return ye now every one from his evil way, and amend your ways and
your doings.

contents.verseText: But they say, It is in vain; for we will walk after our own devices, and we will do every one after the stubbornness of his evil heart.
contents: But they say, It is in vain; for we will walk after our own devices, and we will do every one after the stubbornness of
his evil heart.

contents.verseText: Therefore thus saith Jehovah: Ask ye now among the nations, who hath heard such things; the virgin of Israel hath done a very horrible thing.
contents: Therefore thus saith Jehovah: Ask ye now among the nations, who hath heard such things; the virgin of Israel hath done a
very horrible thing.

contents.verseText: Shall the snow of Lebanon fail from the rock of the field? or shall the cold waters that flow down from afar be dried up?
contents: Shall the snow of Lebanon fail from the rock of the field?
shall the cold waters that flow down from afar be dried up?

contents.verseText: For my people have forgotten me, they have burned incense to false gods; and they have been made to stumble in their ways, in the ancient paths, to walk in bypaths, in a way not cast up;
contents: For my people have forgotten me, they have burned incense to false
; and they have been made to stumble in their ways, in the ancient paths, to walk in bypaths, in a way not cast
up;

contents.verseText: to make their land an astonishment, and a perpetual hissing; every one that passeth thereby shall be astonished, and shake his head.
contents: to make their land an astonishment, and a perpetual hissing; every one that passeth thereby shall be astonished, and
shake his head.

contents.verseText: I will scatter them as with an east wind before the enemy; I will show them the back, and not the face, in the day of their calamity.
contents: I will scatter them as with an east wind before the enemy; I will show them the back, and not the face, in the day of
their calamity.

contents.verseText: Then said they, Come, and let us devise devices against Jeremiah; for the law shall not perish from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come, and let us smite him with the tongue, and let us not give heed to any of his words.
contents: Then said they, Come, and let us devise devices against Jeremiah; for the law shall not perish from the priest, nor
counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come, and let us smite him with the tongue, and let us not give heed to
any of his words.

contents.verseText: Give heed to me, O Jehovah, and hearken to the voice of them that contend with me.
contents: Give heed to me, O Jehovah, and hearken to the voice of them that contend with me.

contents.verseText: Shall evil be recompensed for good? for they have digged a pit for my soul. Remember how I stood before thee to speak good for them, to turn away thy wrath from them.
contents: Shall evil be recompensed for good? for they have digged a pit for my soul. Remember how I stood before thee to speak
good for them, to turn away thy wrath from them.

contents.verseText: Therefore deliver up their children to the famine, and give them over to the power of the sword; and let their wives become childless, and widows; and let their men be slain of death, and their young men smitten of the sword in battle.
contents: Therefore deliver up their children to the famine, and give them over to the power of the sword; and let their wives
become childless, and widows; and let their men be slain of death,
their young men smitten of the sword in battle.

contents.verseText: Let a cry be heard from their houses, when thou shalt bring a troop suddenly upon them; for they have digged a pit to take me, and hid snares for my feet.
contents: Let a cry be heard from their houses, when thou shalt bring a troop suddenly upon them; for they have digged a pit to
take me, and hid snares for my feet.

contents.verseText: Yet, Jehovah, thou knowest all their counsel against me to slay me; forgive not their iniquity, neither blot out their sin from thy sight; but let them be overthrown before thee; deal thou with them in the time of thine anger.
contents: Yet, Jehovah, thou knowest all their counsel against me to slay me; forgive not their iniquity, neither blot out their
sin from thy sight; but let them be overthrown before thee; deal thou with them in the time of thine anger.

contents.verseText: Thus said Jehovah, Go, and buy a potter’s earthen bottle, and take of the elders of the people, and of the elders of the priests;
contents: Thus said Jehovah, Go, and buy a potter’s earthen bottle, and
of the elders of the people, and of the elders of the priests;

contents.verseText: and go forth unto the valley of the son of Hinnom, which is by the entry of the gate Harsith, and proclaim there the words that I shall tell thee;
contents: and go forth unto the valley of the son of Hinnom, which is by the entry of the gate Harsith, and proclaim there the words
that I shall tell thee;

contents.verseText: and say, Hear ye the word of Jehovah, O kings of Judah, and inhabitants of Jerusalem: thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, which whosoever heareth, his ears shall tingle.
contents: and say, Hear ye the word of Jehovah, O kings of Judah, and inhabitants of Jerusalem: thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God
of Israel, Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, which whosoever heareth, his ears shall tingle.

contents.verseText: Because they have forsaken me, and have estranged this place, and have burned incense in it unto other gods, that they knew not, they and their fathers and the kings of Judah, and have filled this place with the blood of innocents,
contents: Because they have forsaken me, and have estranged this place, and have burned incense in it unto other gods, that they
knew not, they and their fathers and the kings of Judah, and have filled this place with the blood of innocents,
