contents.verseText: and have built the high places of Baal, to burn their sons in the fire for burnt-offerings unto Baal; which I commanded not, nor spake it, neither came it into my mind:
contents: and have built the high places of Baal, to burn their sons in the fire for burnt-offerings unto Baal; which I commanded
not, nor spake it, neither came it into my mind:

contents.verseText: therefore, behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that this place shall no more be called Topheth, nor The valley of the son of Hinnom, but The valley of Slaughter.
contents: therefore, behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that this place shall no more be called Topheth, nor The valley of the
son of Hinnom, but The valley of Slaughter.

contents.verseText: And I will make void the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem in this place; and I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies, and by the hand of them that seek their life: and their dead bodies will I give to be food for the birds of the heavens, and for the beasts of the earth.
contents: And I will make void the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem in this place; and I will cause them to fall by the sword before
their enemies, and by the hand of them that seek their life: and their dead bodies will I give to be food for the birds of the
heavens, and for the beasts of the earth.

contents.verseText: And I will make this city an astonishment, and a hissing; every one that passeth thereby shall be astonished and hiss because of all the plagues thereof.
contents: And I will make this city an astonishment, and a hissing; every one that passeth thereby shall be astonished and hiss
because of all the plagues thereof.

contents.verseText: And I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters; and they shall eat every one the flesh of his friend, in the siege and in the distress, wherewith their enemies, and they that seek their life, shall distress them.
contents: And I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters; and they shall eat every one the
flesh of his friend, in the siege and in the distress, wherewith their enemies, and they that seek their life, shall distress
them.

contents.verseText: Then shalt thou break the bottle in the sight of the men that go with thee,
contents: Then shalt thou break the bottle in the sight of the men that go with thee,

contents.verseText: and shalt say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Even so will I break this people and this city, as one breaketh a potter’s vessel, that cannot be made whole again; and they shall bury in Topheth, till there be no place to bury.
contents: and shalt say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Even so will I break this people and this city, as one breaketh a
potter’s vessel, that cannot be made whole again; and they shall bury in Topheth, till there be no place to bury.

contents.verseText: Thus will I do unto this place, saith Jehovah, and to the inhabitants thereof, even making this city as Topheth:
contents: Thus will I do unto this place, saith Jehovah, and to the inhabitants thereof, even making this city as Topheth:

contents.verseText: and the houses of Jerusalem, and the houses of the kings of Judah, which are defiled, shall be as the place of Topheth, even all the houses upon whose roofs they have burned incense unto all the host of heaven, and have poured out drink-offerings unto other gods.
contents: and the houses of Jerusalem, and the houses of the kings of Judah, which are defiled, shall be as the place of Topheth,
even all the houses upon whose roofs they have burned incense unto all the host of heaven, and have poured out drink-offerings
unto other gods.

contents.verseText: Then came Jeremiah from Topheth, whither Jehovah had sent him to prophesy; and he stood in the court of Jehovah’s house, and said to all the people:
contents: Then came Jeremiah from Topheth, whither Jehovah had sent him to prophesy; and he stood in the court of Jehovah’s house,
and said to all the people:

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, Behold, I will bring upon this city and upon all its towns all the evil that I have pronounced against it; because they have made their neck stiff, that they may not hear my words.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, Behold, I will bring upon this city and upon all its towns all the evil
that I have pronounced against it; because they have made their neck stiff, that they may not hear my words.

contents.verseText: Now Pashhur, the son of Immer the priest, who was chief officer in the house of Jehovah, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things.
contents: Now Pashhur, the son of Immer the priest, who was chief officer in the house of Jehovah, heard Jeremiah prophesying these
things.

contents.verseText: Then Pashhur smote Jeremiah the prophet, and put him in the stocks that were in the upper gate of Benjamin, which was in the house of Jehovah.
contents: Then Pashhur smote Jeremiah the prophet, and put him in the stocks that were in the upper gate of Benjamin, which was in
the house of Jehovah.

contents.verseText: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Pashhur brought forth Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then said Jeremiah unto him, Jehovah hath not called thy name Pashhur, but Magor-missabib.
contents: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Pashhur brought forth Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then said Jeremiah unto him,
Jehovah hath not called thy name Pashhur, but Magor-missabib.

contents.verseText: For thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will make thee a terror to thyself, and to all thy friends; and they shall fall by the sword of their enemies, and thine eyes shall behold it; and I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall carry them captive to Babylon, and shall slay them with the sword.
contents: For thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will make thee a terror to thyself, and to all thy friends; and they shall fall by the
sword of their enemies, and thine eyes shall behold it; and I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he
shall carry them captive to Babylon, and shall slay them with the sword.

contents.verseText: Moreover I will give all the riches of this city, and all the gains thereof, and all the precious things thereof, yea, all the treasures of the kings of Judah will I give into the hand of their enemies; and they shall make them a prey, and take them, and carry them to Babylon.
contents: Moreover I will give all the riches of this city, and all the gains thereof, and all the precious things thereof, yea, all
the treasures of the kings of Judah will I give into the hand of their enemies; and they shall make them a prey, and take them,
and carry them to Babylon.

contents.verseText: And thou, Pashhur, and all that dwell in thy house shall go into captivity; and thou shalt come to Babylon, and there thou shalt die, and there shalt thou be buried, thou, and all thy friends, to whom thou hast prophesied falsely.
contents: And thou, Pashhur, and all that dwell in thy house shall go into captivity; and thou shalt come to Babylon, and there thou
shalt die, and there shalt thou be buried, thou, and all thy friends, to whom thou hast prophesied falsely.

contents.verseText: O Jehovah, thou hast persuaded me, and I was persuaded; thou art stronger than I, and hast prevailed: I am become a laughing-stock all the day, every one mocketh me.
contents: O Jehovah, thou hast persuaded me, and I was persuaded; thou art stronger than I, and hast prevailed: I am become a
laughing-stock all the day, every one mocketh me.

contents.verseText: For as often as I speak, I cry out; I cry, Violence and destruction! because the word of Jehovah is made a reproach unto me, and a derision, all the day.
contents: For as often as I speak, I cry out; I cry, Violence and destruction! because the word of Jehovah is made a reproach unto
me, and a derision, all the day.

contents.verseText: And if I say, I will not make mention of him, nor speak any more in his name, then there is in my heart as it were a burning fire shut up in my bones, and I am weary with forbearing, and I cannot contain.
contents: And if I say, I will not make mention of him, nor speak any more in his name, then there is in my heart as it were a
burning fire shut up in my bones, and I am weary with forbearing, and I cannot

contents.verseText: For I have heard the defaming of many, terror on every side. Denounce, and we will denounce him, say all my familiar friends, they that watch for my fall; peradventure he will be persuaded, and we shall prevail against him, and we shall take our revenge on him.
contents: For I have heard the defaming of many, terror on every side. Denounce, and we will denounce him,
all my familiar friends, they that watch for my fall; peradventure he will be persuaded, and we shall prevail
against him, and we shall take our revenge on him.

contents.verseText: But Jehovah is with me as a mighty one and a terrible: therefore my persecutors shall stumble, and they shall not prevail; they shall be utterly put to shame, because they have not dealt wisely, even with an everlasting dishonor which shall never be forgotten.
contents: But Jehovah is with me as a mighty one
a terrible: therefore my persecutors shall stumble, and they shall
not prevail; they shall be utterly put to shame, because they have not dealt wisely, even with an everlasting dishonor which
shall never be forgotten.

contents.verseText: But, O Jehovah of hosts, that triest the righteous, that seest the heart and the mind, let me see thy vengeance on them; for unto thee have I revealed my cause.
contents: But, O Jehovah of hosts, that triest the righteous, that seest the heart and the mind, let me see thy vengeance on them;
for unto thee have I revealed my cause.

contents.verseText: Sing unto Jehovah, praise ye Jehovah; for he hath delivered the soul of the needy from the hand of evil-doers.
contents: Sing unto Jehovah, praise ye Jehovah; for he hath delivered the soul of the needy from the hand of evil-doers.

contents.verseText: Cursed be the day wherein I was born: let not the day wherein my mother bare me be blessed.
contents: Cursed be the day wherein I was born: let not the day wherein my mother bare me be blessed.

contents.verseText: Cursed be the man who brought tidings to my father, saying, A man-child is born unto thee; making him very glad.
contents: Cursed be the man who brought tidings to my father, saying, A man-child is born unto thee; making him very glad.

contents.verseText: And let that man be as the cities which Jehovah overthrew, and repented not: and let him hear a cry in the morning, and shouting at noontime;
contents: And let that man be as the cities which Jehovah overthrew, and repented not: and let him hear a cry in the morning, and
shouting at noontime;

contents.verseText: because he slew me not from the womb; and so my mother would have been my grave, and her womb always great.
contents: because he slew me not from the womb; and so my mother would have been my grave, and her womb always great.

contents.verseText: Wherefore came I forth out of the womb to see labor and sorrow, that my days should be consumed with shame?
contents: Wherefore came I forth out of the womb to see labor and sorrow, that my days should be consumed with shame?

contents.verseText: The word which came unto Jeremiah from Jehovah, when king Zedekiah sent unto him Pashhur the son of Malchijah, and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, saying,
contents: The word which came unto Jeremiah from Jehovah, when king Zedekiah sent unto him Pashhur the son of Malchijah, and
Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, saying,

contents.verseText: Inquire, I pray thee, of Jehovah for us; for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon maketh war against us: peradventure Jehovah will deal with us according to all his wondrous works, that he may go up from us.
contents: Inquire, I pray thee, of Jehovah for us; for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon maketh war against us: peradventure Jehovah
will deal with us according to all his wondrous works, that he may go up from us.

contents.verseText: Then said Jeremiah unto them, Thus shall ye say to Zedekiah:
contents: Then said Jeremiah unto them, Thus shall ye say to Zedekiah:

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, Behold, I will turn back the weapons of war that are in your hands, wherewith ye fight against the king of Babylon, and against the Chaldeans that besiege you, without the walls; and I will gather them into the midst of this city.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, Behold, I will turn back the weapons of war that are in your hands, wherewith ye
fight against the king of Babylon, and against the Chaldeans that besiege you, without the walls; and I will gather them into
the midst of this city.

contents.verseText: And I myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and with a strong arm, even in anger, and in wrath, and in great indignation.
contents: And I myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and with a strong arm, even in anger, and in wrath, and in
great indignation.

contents.verseText: And I will smite the inhabitants of this city, both man and beast: they shall die of a great pestilence.
contents: And I will smite the inhabitants of this city, both man and beast: they shall die of a great pestilence.

contents.verseText: And afterward, saith Jehovah, I will deliver Zedekiah king of Judah, and his servants, and the people, even such as are left in this city from the pestilence, from the sword, and from the famine, into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those that seek their life: and he shall smite them with the edge of the sword; he shall not spare them, neither have pity, nor have mercy.
contents: And afterward, saith Jehovah, I will deliver Zedekiah king of Judah, and his servants, and the people, even such as are
left in this city from the pestilence, from the sword, and from the famine, into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon,
and into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those that seek their life: and he shall smite them with the edge of
the sword; he shall not spare them, neither have pity, nor have mercy.

contents.verseText: And unto this people thou shalt say, Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, I set before you the way of life and the way of death.
contents: And unto this people thou shalt say, Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, I set before you the way of life and the way of death.

contents.verseText: He that abideth in this city shall die by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence; but he that goeth out, and passeth over to the Chaldeans that besiege you, he shall live, and his life shall be unto him for a prey.
contents: He that abideth in this city shall die by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence; but he that goeth out, and
passeth over to the Chaldeans that besiege you, he shall live, and his life shall be unto him for a prey.

contents.verseText: For I have set my face upon this city for evil, and not for good, saith Jehovah: it shall be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.
contents: For I have set my face upon this city for evil, and not for good, saith Jehovah: it shall be given into the hand of the
king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.

contents.verseText: And touching the house of the king of Judah, hear ye the word of Jehovah:
contents: And touching the house of the king of Judah, hear ye the word of Jehovah:

contents.verseText: O house of David, thus saith Jehovah, Execute justice in the morning, and deliver him that is robbed out of the hand of the oppressor, lest my wrath go forth like fire, and burn so that none can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.
contents: O house of David, thus saith Jehovah, Execute justice in the morning, and deliver him that is robbed out of the hand of
the oppressor, lest my wrath go forth like fire, and burn so that none can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.

contents.verseText: Behold, I am against thee, O inhabitant of the valley, and of the rock of the plain, saith Jehovah; you that say, Who shall come down against us? or who shall enter into our habitations?
contents: Behold, I am against thee, O inhabitant of the valley,
of the rock of the plain, saith Jehovah; you that say, Who shall come down against us? or who shall enter into our habitations?

contents.verseText: And I will punish you according to the fruit of your doings, saith Jehovah; and I will kindle a fire in her forest, and it shall devour all that is round about her.
contents: And I will punish you according to the fruit of your doings, saith Jehovah; and I will kindle a fire in her forest, and
it shall devour all that is round about her.

contents.verseText: Thus said Jehovah: Go down to the house of the king of Judah, and speak there this word,
contents: Thus said Jehovah: Go down to the house of the king of Judah, and speak there this word,

contents.verseText: and say, Hear the word of Jehovah, O king of Judah, that sittest upon the throne of David, thou, and thy servants, and thy people that enter in by these gates.
contents: and say, Hear the word of Jehovah, O king of Judah, that sittest upon the throne of David, thou, and thy servants, and thy
people that enter in by these gates.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah: Execute ye justice and righteousness, and deliver him that is robbed out of the hand of the oppressor: and do no wrong, do no violence, to the sojourner, the fatherless, nor the widow; neither shed innocent blood in this place.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah: Execute ye justice and righteousness, and deliver him that is robbed out of the hand of the oppressor:
and do no wrong, do no violence, to the sojourner, the fatherless, nor the widow; neither shed innocent blood in this place.

contents.verseText: For if ye do this thing indeed, then shall there enter in by the gates of this house kings sitting upon the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, he, and his servants, and his people.
contents: For if ye do this thing indeed, then shall there enter in by the gates of this house kings sitting upon the throne of
David, riding in chariots and on horses, he, and his servants, and his people.

contents.verseText: But if ye will not hear these words, I swear by myself, saith Jehovah, that this house shall become a desolation.
contents: But if ye will not hear these words, I swear by myself, saith Jehovah, that this house shall become a desolation.

contents.verseText: For thus saith Jehovah concerning the house of the king of Judah: Thou art Gilead unto me, and the head of Lebanon; yet surely I will make thee a wilderness, and cities which are not inhabited.
contents: For thus saith Jehovah concerning the house of the king of Judah: Thou art Gilead unto me,
the head of Lebanon;
surely I will make thee a wilderness,
cities which are not inhabited.

contents.verseText: And I will prepare destroyers against thee, every one with his weapons; and they shall cut down thy choice cedars, and cast them into the fire.
contents: And I will prepare destroyers against thee, every one with his weapons; and they shall cut down thy choice cedars, and
cast them into the fire.

contents.verseText: And many nations shall pass by this city, and they shall say every man to his neighbor, Wherefore hath Jehovah done thus unto this great city?
contents: And many nations shall pass by this city, and they shall say every man to his neighbor, Wherefore hath Jehovah done thus
unto this great city?

contents.verseText: Then they shall answer, Because they forsook the covenant of Jehovah their God, and worshipped other gods, and served them.
contents: Then they shall answer, Because they forsook the covenant of Jehovah their God, and worshipped other gods, and served
them.

contents.verseText: Weep ye not for the dead, neither bemoan him; but weep sore for him that goeth away; for he shall return no more, nor see his native country.
contents: Weep ye not for the dead, neither bemoan him; but weep sore for him that goeth away; for he shall return no more, nor see
his native country.

contents.verseText: For thus saith Jehovah touching Shallum the son of Josiah, king of Judah, who reigned instead of Josiah his father, and who went forth out of this place: He shall not return thither any more;
contents: For thus saith Jehovah touching Shallum the son of Josiah, king of Judah, who reigned instead of Josiah his father,
who went forth out of this place: He shall not return thither any more;

contents.verseText: but in the place whither they have led him captive, there shall he die, and he shall see this land no more.
contents: but in the place whither they have led him captive, there shall he die, and he shall see this land no more.

contents.verseText: Woe unto him that buildeth his house by unrighteousness, and his chambers by injustice; that useth his neighbor’s service without wages, and giveth him not his hire;
contents: Woe unto him that buildeth his house by unrighteousness, and his chambers by injustice; that useth his neighbor’s service
without wages, and giveth him not his hire;

contents.verseText: that saith, I will build me a wide house and spacious chambers, and cutteth him out windows; and it is ceiled with cedar, and painted with vermilion.
contents: that saith, I will build me a wide house and spacious chambers, and cutteth him out windows; and it is ceiled with cedar,
and painted with vermilion.

contents.verseText: Shalt thou reign, because thou strivest to excel in cedar? Did not thy father eat and drink, and do justice and righteousness? then it was well with him.
contents: Shalt thou reign, because thou strivest to excel in cedar? Did not thy father eat and drink, and do justice and
righteousness? then it was well with him.

contents.verseText: He judged the cause of the poor and needy; then it was well. Was not this to know me? saith Jehovah.
contents: He judged the cause of the poor and needy; then it was well. Was not this to know me? saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: But thine eyes and thy heart are not but for thy covetousness, and for shedding innocent blood, and for oppression, and for violence, to do it.
contents: But thine eyes and thy heart are not but for thy covetousness, and for shedding innocent blood, and for oppression, and
for violence, to do it.

contents.verseText: Therefore thus saith Jehovah concerning Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah: they shall not lament for him, saying, Ah my brother! or, Ah sister! They shall not lament for him, saying Ah lord! or, Ah his glory!
contents: Therefore thus saith Jehovah concerning Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah: they shall not lament for him,
, Ah my brother! or, Ah sister! They shall not lament for him,
Ah lord! or, Ah his glory!

contents.verseText: He shall be buried with the burial of an ass, drawn and cast forth beyond the gates of Jerusalem.
contents: He shall be buried with the burial of an ass, drawn and cast forth beyond the gates of Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: Go up to Lebanon, and cry; and lift up thy voice in Bashan, and cry from Abarim; for all thy lovers are destroyed.
contents: Go up to Lebanon, and cry; and lift up thy voice in Bashan, and cry from Abarim; for all thy lovers are destroyed.

contents.verseText: I spake unto thee in thy prosperity; but thou saidst, I will not hear. This hath been thy manner from thy youth, that thou obeyedst not my voice.
contents: I spake unto thee in thy prosperity; but thou saidst, I will not hear. This hath been thy manner from thy youth, that
thou obeyedst not my voice.

contents.verseText: The wind shall feed all thy shepherds, and thy lovers shall go into captivity: surely then shalt thou be ashamed and confounded for all thy wickedness.
contents: The wind shall feed all thy shepherds, and thy lovers shall go into captivity: surely then shalt thou be ashamed and
confounded for all thy wickedness.

contents.verseText: O inhabitant of Lebanon, that makest thy nest in the cedars, how greatly to be pitied shalt thou be when pangs come upon thee, the pain as of a woman in travail!
contents: O inhabitant of Lebanon, that makest thy nest in the cedars, how greatly to be pitied shalt thou be when pangs come upon
thee, the pain as of a woman in travail!

contents.verseText: As I live, saith Jehovah, though Coniah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah were the signet upon my right hand, yet would I pluck thee thence;
contents: As I live, saith Jehovah, though Coniah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah were the signet upon my right hand, yet would
I pluck thee thence;

contents.verseText: and I will give thee into the hand of them that seek thy life, and into the hand of them of whom thou art afraid, even into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of the Chaldeans.
contents: and I will give thee into the hand of them that seek thy life, and into the hand of them of whom thou art afraid, even
into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of the Chaldeans.

contents.verseText: And I will cast thee out, and thy mother that bare thee, into another country, where ye were not born; and there shall ye die.
contents: And I will cast thee out, and thy mother that bare thee, into another country, where ye were not born; and there shall ye
die.

contents.verseText: But to the land whereunto their soul longeth to return, thither shall they not return.
contents: But to the land whereunto their soul longeth to return, thither shall they not return.

contents.verseText: Is this man Coniah a despised broken vessel? is he a vessel wherein none delighteth? wherefore are they cast out, he and his seed, and are cast into the land which they know not?
contents: Is this man Coniah a despised broken vessel? is he a vessel wherein none delighteth? wherefore are they cast out, he and
his seed, and are cast into the land which they know not?

contents.verseText: O earth, earth, earth, hear the word of Jehovah.
contents: O earth, earth, earth, hear the word of Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah, Write ye this man childless, a man that shall not prosper in his days; for no more shall a man of his seed prosper, sitting upon the throne of David, and ruling in Judah.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah, Write ye this man childless, a man that shall not prosper in his days; for no more shall a man of his
seed prosper, sitting upon the throne of David, and ruling in Judah.

contents.verseText: Woe unto the shepherds that destroy and scatter the sheep of my pasture! saith Jehovah.
contents: Woe unto the shepherds that destroy and scatter the sheep of my pasture! saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Therefore thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, against the shepherds that feed my people: Ye have scattered my flock, and driven them away, and have not visited them; behold, I will visit upon you the evil of your doings, saith Jehovah.
contents: Therefore thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, against the shepherds that feed my people: Ye have scattered my flock,
and driven them away, and have not visited them; behold, I will visit upon you the evil of your doings, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: And I will gather the remnant of my flock out of all the countries whither I have driven them, and will bring them again to their folds; and they shall be fruitful and multiply.
contents: And I will gather the remnant of my flock out of all the countries whither I have driven them, and will bring them again
to their folds; and they shall be fruitful and multiply.

contents.verseText: And I will set up shepherds over them, who shall feed them; and they shall fear no more, nor be dismayed, neither shall any be lacking, saith Jehovah.
contents: And I will set up shepherds over them, who shall feed them; and they shall fear no more, nor be dismayed, neither shall
any be lacking, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will raise unto David a righteous Branch, and he shall reign as king and deal wisely, and shall execute justice and righteousness in the land.
contents: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will raise unto David a righteous Branch, and he shall reign as king and deal
wisely, and shall execute justice and righteousness in the land.

contents.verseText: In his days Judah shall be saved, and Israel shall dwell safely; and this is his name whereby he shall be called: Jehovah our righteousness.
contents: In his days Judah shall be saved, and Israel shall dwell safely; and this is his name whereby he shall be called: Jehovah
our righteousness.

contents.verseText: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that they shall no more say, As Jehovah liveth, who brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;
contents: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that they shall no more say, As Jehovah liveth, who brought up the
children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;

contents.verseText: but, As Jehovah liveth, who brought up and who led the seed of the house of Israel out of the north country, and from all the countries whither I had driven them. And they shall dwell in their own land.
contents: but, As Jehovah liveth, who brought up and who led the seed of the house of Israel out of the north country, and from all
the countries whither I had driven them. And they shall dwell in their own land.

contents.verseText: Concerning the prophets. My heart within me is broken, all my bones shake; I am like a drunken man, and like a man whom wine hath overcome, because of Jehovah, and because of his holy words.
contents: Concerning the prophets. My heart within me is broken, all my bones shake; I am like a drunken man, and like a man whom
wine hath overcome, because of Jehovah, and because of his holy words.

contents.verseText: For the land is full of adulterers; for because of swearing the land mourneth; the pastures of the wilderness are dried up. And their course is evil, and their might is not right;
contents: For the land is full of adulterers; for because of swearing the land mourneth; the pastures of the wilderness are dried
up. And their course is evil, and their might is not right;

contents.verseText: for both prophet and priest are profane; yea, in my house have I found their wickedness, saith Jehovah.
contents: for both prophet and priest are profane; yea, in my house have I found their wickedness, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Wherefore their way shall be unto them as slippery places in the darkness: they shall be driven on, and fall therein; for I will bring evil upon them, even the year of their visitation, saith Jehovah.
contents: Wherefore their way shall be unto them as slippery places in the darkness: they shall be driven on, and fall therein; for
I will bring evil upon them, even the year of their visitation, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: And I have seen folly in the prophets of Samaria; they prophesied by Baal, and caused my people Israel to err.
contents: And I have seen folly in the prophets of Samaria; they prophesied by Baal, and caused my people Israel to err.

contents.verseText: In the prophets of Jerusalem also I have seen a horrible thing: they commit adultery, and walk in lies; and they strengthen the hands of evil-doers, so that none doth return from his wickedness: they are all of them become unto me as Sodom, and the inhabitants thereof as Gomorrah.
contents: In the prophets of Jerusalem also I have seen a horrible thing: they commit adultery, and walk in lies; and they
strengthen the hands of evil-doers, so that none doth return from his wickedness: they are all of them become unto me as Sodom,
and the inhabitants thereof as Gomorrah.

contents.verseText: Therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts concerning the prophets: Behold, I will feed them with wormwood, and make them drink the water of gall; for from the prophets of Jerusalem is ungodliness gone forth into all the land.
contents: Therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts concerning the prophets: Behold, I will feed them with wormwood, and make them
drink the water of gall; for from the prophets of Jerusalem is ungodliness gone forth into all the land.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, Hearken not unto the words of the prophets that prophesy unto you: they teach you vanity; they speak a vision of their own heart, and not out of the mouth of Jehovah.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, Hearken not unto the words of the prophets that prophesy unto you: they teach you vanity;
they speak a vision of their own heart, and not out of the mouth of Jehovah.

contents.verseText: They say continually unto them that despise me, Jehovah hath said, Ye shall have peace; and unto every one that walketh in the stubbornness of his own heart they say, No evil shall come upon you.
contents: They say continually unto them that despise me, Jehovah hath said, Ye shall have peace; and unto every one that walketh
in the stubbornness of his own heart they say, No evil shall come upon you.

contents.verseText: For who hath stood in the council of Jehovah, that he should perceive and hear his word? who hath marked my word, and heard it?
contents: For who hath stood in the council of Jehovah, that he should perceive and hear his word? who hath marked my word, and
heard it?

contents.verseText: Behold, the tempest of Jehovah, even his wrath, is gone forth, yea, a whirling tempest: it shall burst upon the head of the wicked.
contents: Behold, the tempest of Jehovah,
wrath, is gone forth, yea, a whirling tempest: it shall burst upon the
head of the wicked.

contents.verseText: The anger of Jehovah shall not return, until he have executed, and till he have performed the intents of his heart: in the latter days ye shall understand it perfectly.
contents: The anger of Jehovah shall not return, until he have executed, and till he have performed the intents of his heart: in
the latter days ye shall understand it perfectly.

contents.verseText: I sent not these prophets, yet they ran: I spake not unto them, yet they prophesied.
contents: I sent not these prophets, yet they ran: I spake not unto them, yet they prophesied.

contents.verseText: But if they had stood in my council, then had they caused my people to hear my words, and had turned them from their evil way, and from the evil of their doings.
contents: But if they had stood in my council, then had they caused my people to hear my words, and had turned them from their evil
way, and from the evil of their doings.

contents.verseText: Am I a God at hand, saith Jehovah, and not a God afar off?
contents: Am I a God at hand, saith Jehovah, and not a God afar off?

contents.verseText: Can any hide himself in secret places so that I shall not see him? saith Jehovah. Do not I fill heaven and earth? saith Jehovah.
contents: Can any hide himself in secret places so that I shall not see him? saith Jehovah. Do not I fill heaven and earth? saith
Jehovah.

contents.verseText: I have heard what the prophets have said, that prophesy lies in my name, saying, I have dreamed, I have dreamed.
contents: I have heard what the prophets have said, that prophesy lies in my name, saying, I have dreamed, I have dreamed.

contents.verseText: How long shall this be in the heart of the prophets that prophesy lies, even the prophets of the deceit of their own heart?
contents: How long shall this be in the heart of the prophets that prophesy lies, even the prophets of the deceit of their own
heart?

contents.verseText: that think to cause my people to forget my name by their dreams which they tell every man to his neighbor, as their fathers forgat my name for Baal.
contents: that think to cause my people to forget my name by their dreams which they tell every man to his neighbor, as their
fathers forgat my name for Baal.

contents.verseText: The prophet that hath a dream, let him tell a dream; and he that hath my word, let him speak my word faithfully. What is the straw to the wheat? saith Jehovah.
contents: The prophet that hath a dream, let him tell a dream; and he that hath my word, let him speak my word faithfully. What is
the straw to the wheat? saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Is not my word like fire? saith Jehovah; and like a hammer that breaketh the rock in pieces?
contents: Is not my word like fire? saith Jehovah; and like a hammer that breaketh the rock in pieces?

contents.verseText: Therefore, behold, I am against the prophets, saith Jehovah, that steal my words every one from his neighbor.
contents: Therefore, behold, I am against the prophets, saith Jehovah, that steal my words every one from his neighbor.

contents.verseText: Behold, I am against the prophets, saith Jehovah, that use their tongues, and say, He saith.
contents: Behold, I am against the prophets, saith Jehovah, that use their tongues, and say, He saith.

contents.verseText: Behold, I am against them that prophesy lying dreams, saith Jehovah, and do tell them, and cause my people to err by their lies, and by their vain boasting: yet I sent them not, nor commanded them; neither do they profit this people at all, saith Jehovah.
contents: Behold, I am against them that prophesy lying dreams, saith Jehovah, and do tell them, and cause my people to err by
their lies, and by their vain boasting: yet I sent them not, nor commanded them; neither do they profit this people at all,
saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: And when this people, or the prophet, or a priest, shall ask thee, saying, What is the burden of Jehovah? then shalt thou say unto them, What burden! I will cast you off, saith Jehovah.
contents: And when this people, or the prophet, or a priest, shall ask thee, saying, What is the burden of Jehovah? then shalt thou
say unto them, What burden! I will cast you off, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: And as for the prophet, and the priest, and the people, that shall say, The burden of Jehovah, I will even punish that man and his house.
contents: And as for the prophet, and the priest, and the people, that shall say, The burden of Jehovah, I will even punish that
man and his house.

contents.verseText: Thus shall ye say every one to his neighbor, and every one to his brother, What hath Jehovah answered? and, What hath Jehovah spoken?
contents: Thus shall ye say every one to his neighbor, and every one to his brother, What hath Jehovah answered? and, What hath
Jehovah spoken?

contents.verseText: And the burden of Jehovah shall ye mention no more: for every man’s own word shall be his burden; for ye have perverted the words of the living God, of Jehovah of hosts our God.
contents: And the burden of Jehovah shall ye mention no more: for every man’s own word shall be his burden; for ye have perverted
the words of the living God, of Jehovah of hosts our God.

contents.verseText: Thus shalt thou say to the prophet, What hath Jehovah answered thee? and, What hath Jehovah spoken?
contents: Thus shalt thou say to the prophet, What hath Jehovah answered thee? and, What hath Jehovah spoken?

contents.verseText: But if ye say, The burden of Jehovah; therefore thus saith Jehovah: Because ye say this word, The burden of Jehovah, and I have sent unto you, saying, Ye shall not say, The burden of Jehovah;
contents: But if ye say, The burden of Jehovah; therefore thus saith Jehovah: Because ye say this word, The burden of Jehovah, and
I have sent unto you, saying, Ye shall not say, The burden of Jehovah;

contents.verseText: therefore, behold, I will utterly forget you, and I will cast you off, and the city that I gave unto you and to your fathers, away from my presence:
contents: therefore, behold, I will utterly forget you, and I will cast you off, and the city that I gave unto you and to your
fathers, away from my presence:

contents.verseText: and I will bring an everlasting reproach upon you, and a perpetual shame, which shall not be forgotten.
contents: and I will bring an everlasting reproach upon you, and a perpetual shame, which shall not be forgotten.

contents.verseText: Jehovah showed me, and, behold, two baskets of figs set before the temple of Jehovah, after that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon had carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and the princes of Judah, with the craftsmen and smiths, from Jerusalem, and had brought them to Babylon.
contents: Jehovah showed me, and, behold, two baskets of figs set before the temple of Jehovah, after that Nebuchadrezzar king of
Babylon had carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and the princes of Judah, with the craftsmen and
smiths, from Jerusalem, and had brought them to Babylon.

contents.verseText: One basket had very good figs, like the figs that are first-ripe; and the other basket had very bad figs, which could not be eaten, they were so bad.
contents: One basket had very good figs, like the figs that are first-ripe; and the other basket had very bad figs, which could not
be eaten, they were so bad.

contents.verseText: Then said Jehovah unto me, What seest thou, Jeremiah? And I said, Figs; the good figs, very good; and the bad, very bad, that cannot be eaten, they are so bad.
contents: Then said Jehovah unto me, What seest thou, Jeremiah? And I said, Figs; the good figs, very good; and the bad, very bad,
that cannot be eaten, they are so bad.

contents.verseText: And the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
contents: And the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel: Like these good figs, so will I regard the captives of Judah, whom I have sent out of this place into the land of the Chaldeans, for good.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel: Like these good figs, so will I regard the captives of Judah, whom I have sent out
of this place into the land of the Chaldeans, for good.

contents.verseText: For I will set mine eyes upon them for good, and I will bring them again to this land: and I will build them, and not pull them down; and I will plant them, and not pluck them up.
contents: For I will set mine eyes upon them for good, and I will bring them again to this land: and I will build them, and not pull
them down; and I will plant them, and not pluck them up.

contents.verseText: And I will give them a heart to know me, that I am Jehovah: and they shall be my people, and I will be their God; for they shall return unto me with their whole heart.
contents: And I will give them a heart to know me, that I am Jehovah: and they shall be my people, and I will be their God; for they
shall return unto me with their whole heart.

contents.verseText: And as the bad figs, which cannot be eaten, they are so bad, surely thus saith Jehovah, So will I give up Zedekiah the king of Judah, and his princes, and the residue of Jerusalem, that remain in this land, and them that dwell in the land of Egypt,
contents: And as the bad figs, which cannot be eaten, they are so bad, surely thus saith Jehovah, So will I give up Zedekiah the
king of Judah, and his princes, and the residue of Jerusalem, that remain in this land, and them that dwell in the land of
Egypt,

contents.verseText: I will even give them up to be tossed to and fro among all the kingdoms of the earth for evil; to be a reproach and a proverb, a taunt and a curse, in all places whither I shall drive them.
contents: I will even give them up to be tossed to and fro among all the kingdoms of the earth for evil; to be a reproach and a
proverb, a taunt and a curse, in all places whither I shall drive them.

contents.verseText: And I will send the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, among them, till they be consumed from off the land that I gave unto them and to their fathers.
contents: And I will send the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, among them, till they be consumed from off the land that I
gave unto them and to their fathers.

contents.verseText: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah (the same was the first year of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon),
contents: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king
of Judah (the same was the first year of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon),

contents.verseText: which Jeremiah the prophet spake unto all the people of Judah, and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying:
contents: which Jeremiah the prophet spake unto all the people of Judah, and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying:

contents.verseText: From the thirteenth year of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, even unto this day, these three and twenty years, the word of Jehovah hath come unto me, and I have spoken unto you, rising up early and speaking; but ye have not hearkened.
contents: From the thirteenth year of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, even unto this day, these three and twenty years, the
word of Jehovah hath come unto me, and I have spoken unto you, rising up early and speaking; but ye have not hearkened.

contents.verseText: And Jehovah hath sent unto you all his servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them, (but ye have not hearkened, nor inclined your ear to hear),
contents: And Jehovah hath sent unto you all his servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them, (but ye have not
hearkened, nor inclined your ear to hear),

contents.verseText: saying, Return ye now every one from his evil way, and from the evil of your doings, and dwell in the land that Jehovah hath given unto you and to your fathers, from of old and even for evermore;
contents: saying, Return ye now every one from his evil way, and from the evil of your doings, and dwell in the land that Jehovah
hath given unto you and to your fathers, from of old and even for evermore;

contents.verseText: and go not after other gods to serve them, and to worship them, and provoke me not to anger with the work of your hands; and I will do you no hurt.
contents: and go not after other gods to serve them, and to worship them, and provoke me not to anger with the work of your hands;
and I will do you no hurt.

contents.verseText: Yet ye have not hearkened unto me, saith Jehovah; that ye may provoke me to anger with the work of your hands to your own hurt.
contents: Yet ye have not hearkened unto me, saith Jehovah; that ye may provoke me to anger with the work of your hands to your own
hurt.

contents.verseText: Therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Because ye have not heard my words,
contents: Therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Because ye have not heard my words,

contents.verseText: behold, I will send and take all the families of the north, saith Jehovah, and I will send unto Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will bring them against this land, and against the inhabitants thereof, and against all these nations round about; and I will utterly destroy them, and make them an astonishment, and a hissing, and perpetual desolations.
contents: behold, I will send and take all the families of the north, saith Jehovah, and
unto Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will bring them against this land, and against
the inhabitants thereof, and against all these nations round about; and I will utterly destroy them, and make them an
astonishment, and a hissing, and perpetual desolations.

contents.verseText: Moreover I will take from them the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the sound of the millstones, and the light of the lamp.
contents: Moreover I will take from them the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of
the bride, the sound of the millstones, and the light of the lamp.

contents.verseText: And this whole land shall be a desolation, and an astonishment; and these nations shall serve the king of Babylon seventy years.
contents: And this whole land shall be a desolation, and an astonishment; and these nations shall serve the king of Babylon seventy
years.

contents.verseText: And it shall come to pass, when seventy years are accomplished, that I will punish the king of Babylon, and that nation, saith Jehovah, for their iniquity, and the land of the Chaldeans; and I will make it desolate for ever.
contents: And it shall come to pass, when seventy years are accomplished, that I will punish the king of Babylon, and that nation,
saith Jehovah, for their iniquity, and the land of the Chaldeans; and I will make it desolate for ever.

contents.verseText: And I will bring upon that land all my words which I have pronounced against it, even all that is written in this book, which Jeremiah hath prophesied against all the nations.
contents: And I will bring upon that land all my words which I have pronounced against it, even all that is written in this book,
which Jeremiah hath prophesied against all the nations.

contents.verseText: For many nations and great kings shall make bondmen of them, even of them; and I will recompense them according to their deeds, and according to the work of their hands.
contents: For many nations and great kings shall make bondmen of them, even of them; and I will recompense them according to their
deeds, and according to the work of their hands.

contents.verseText: For thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, unto me: Take this cup of the wine of wrath at my hand, and cause all the nations, to whom I send thee, to drink it.
contents: For thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, unto me: Take this cup of the wine of wrath at my hand, and cause all the
nations, to whom I send thee, to drink it.

contents.verseText: And they shall drink, and reel to and fro, and be mad, because of the sword that I will send among them.
contents: And they shall drink, and reel to and fro, and be mad, because of the sword that I will send among them.

contents.verseText: Then took I the cup at Jehovah’s hand, and made all the nations to drink, unto whom Jehovah had sent me:
contents: Then took I the cup at Jehovah’s hand, and made all the nations to drink, unto whom Jehovah had sent me:

contents.verseText: to wit, Jerusalem, and the cities of Judah, and the kings thereof, and the princes thereof, to make them a desolation, an astonishment, a hissing, and a curse, as it is this day;
contents: , Jerusalem, and the cities of Judah, and the kings thereof, and the princes thereof, to make them a
desolation, an astonishment, a hissing, and a curse, as it is this day;

contents.verseText: Pharaoh king of Egypt, and his servants, and his princes, and all his people;
contents: Pharaoh king of Egypt, and his servants, and his princes, and all his people;

contents.verseText: and all the mingled people, and all the kings of the land of Uz, and all the kings of the Philistines, and Ashkelon, and Gaza, and Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod;
contents: and all the mingled people, and all the kings of the land of Uz, and all the kings of the Philistines, and Ashkelon, and
Gaza, and Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod;

contents.verseText: Edom, and Moab, and the children of Ammon;
contents: Edom, and Moab, and the children of Ammon;

contents.verseText: and all the kings of Tyre, and all the kings of Sidon, and the kings of the isle which is beyond the sea;
contents: and all the kings of Tyre, and all the kings of Sidon, and the kings of the isle which is beyond the sea;

contents.verseText: Dedan, and Tema, and Buz, and all that have the corners of their hair cut off;
contents: Dedan, and Tema, and Buz, and all that have the corners
cut off;

contents.verseText: and all the kings of Arabia, and all the kings of the mingled people that dwell in the wilderness;
contents: and all the kings of Arabia, and all the kings of the mingled people that dwell in the wilderness;

contents.verseText: and all the kings of Zimri, and all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of the Medes;
contents: and all the kings of Zimri, and all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of the Medes;

contents.verseText: and all the kings of the north, far and near, one with another; and all the kingdoms of the world, which are upon the face of the earth: and the king of Sheshach shall drink after them.
contents: and all the kings of the north, far and near, one with another; and all the kingdoms of the world, which are upon the
face of the earth: and the king of Sheshach shall drink after them.

contents.verseText: And thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Drink ye, and be drunken, and spew, and fall, and rise no more, because of the sword which I will send among you.
contents: And thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Drink ye, and be drunken, and spew, and
fall, and rise no more, because of the sword which I will send among you.

contents.verseText: And it shall be, if they refuse to take the cup at thy hand to drink, then shalt thou say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah of hosts: Ye shall surely drink.
contents: And it shall be, if they refuse to take the cup at thy hand to drink, then shalt thou say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah
of hosts: Ye shall surely drink.

contents.verseText: For, lo, I begin to work evil at the city which is called by my name; and should ye be utterly unpunished? Ye shall not be unpunished; for I will call for a sword upon all the inhabitants of the earth, saith Jehovah of hosts.
contents: For, lo, I begin to work evil at the city which is called by my name; and should ye be utterly unpunished? Ye shall not
be unpunished; for I will call for a sword upon all the inhabitants of the earth, saith Jehovah of hosts.

contents.verseText: Therefore prophesy thou against them all these words, and say unto them, Jehovah will roar from on high, and utter his voice from his holy habitation; he will mightily roar against his fold; he will give a shout, as they that tread the grapes, against all the inhabitants of the earth.
contents: Therefore prophesy thou against them all these words, and say unto them, Jehovah will roar from on high, and utter his
voice from his holy habitation; he will mightily roar against his fold; he will give a shout, as they that tread
, against all the inhabitants of the earth.

contents.verseText: A noise shall come even to the end of the earth; for Jehovah hath a controversy with the nations; he will enter into judgment with all flesh: as for the wicked, he will give them to the sword, saith Jehovah.
contents: A noise shall come even to the end of the earth; for Jehovah hath a controversy with the nations; he will enter into
judgment with all flesh: as for the wicked, he will give them to the sword, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, Behold, evil shall go forth from nation to nation, and a great tempest shall be raised up from the uttermost parts of the earth.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, Behold, evil shall go forth from nation to nation, and a great tempest shall be raised up
from the uttermost parts of the earth.

contents.verseText: And the slain of Jehovah shall be at that day from one end of the earth even unto the other end of the earth: they shall not be lamented, neither gathered, nor buried; they shall be dung upon the face of the ground.
contents: And the slain of Jehovah shall be at that day from one end of the earth even unto the other end of the earth: they shall
not be lamented, neither gathered, nor buried; they shall be dung upon the face of the ground.

contents.verseText: Wail, ye shepherds, and cry; and wallow in ashes, ye principal of the flock; for the days of your slaughter and of your dispersions are fully come, and ye shall fall like a goodly vessel.
contents: Wail, ye shepherds, and cry; and wallow
, ye principal of the flock; for the days of your slaughter and
of your dispersions are fully come, and ye shall fall like a goodly vessel.

contents.verseText: And the shepherds shall have no way to flee, nor the principal of the flock to escape.
contents: And the shepherds shall have no way to flee, nor the principal of the flock to escape.

contents.verseText: A voice of the cry of the shepherds, and the wailing of the principal of the flock! for Jehovah layeth waste their pasture.
contents: A voice of the cry of the shepherds, and the wailing of the principal of the flock! for Jehovah layeth waste their
pasture.

contents.verseText: And the peaceable folds are brought to silence because of the fierce anger of Jehovah.
contents: And the peaceable folds are brought to silence because of the fierce anger of Jehovah.

contents.verseText: He hath left his covert, as the lion; for their land is become an astonishment because of the fierceness of the oppressing sword, and because of his fierce anger.
contents: He hath left his covert, as the lion; for their land is become an astonishment because of the fierceness of the
