up early and sending them; but ye would not hear, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Hear ye therefore the word of Jehovah, all ye of the captivity, whom I have sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon.
contents: Hear ye therefore the word of Jehovah, all ye of the captivity, whom I have sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning Ahab the son of Kolaiah, and concerning Zedekiah the son of Maaseiah, who prophesy a lie unto you in my name: Behold, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon; and he shall slay them before your eyes;
contents: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning Ahab the son of Kolaiah, and concerning Zedekiah the son of
Maaseiah, who prophesy a lie unto you in my name: Behold, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon;
and he shall slay them before your eyes;

contents.verseText: and of them shall be taken up a curse by all the captives of Judah that are in Babylon, saying, Jehovah make thee like Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire;
contents: and of them shall be taken up a curse by all the captives of Judah that are in Babylon, saying, Jehovah make thee like
Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire;

contents.verseText: because they have wrought folly in Israel, and have committed adultery with their neighbors’ wives, and have spoken words in my name falsely, which I commanded them not; and I am he that knoweth, and am witness, saith Jehovah.
contents: because they have wrought folly in Israel, and have committed adultery with their neighbors’ wives, and have spoken words
in my name falsely, which I commanded them not; and I am he that knoweth, and am witness, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: And concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite thou shalt speak, saying,
contents: And concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite thou shalt speak, saying,

contents.verseText: Thus speaketh Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, saying, Because thou hast sent letters in thine own name unto all the people that are at Jerusalem, and to Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, and to all the priests, saying,
contents: Thus speaketh Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, saying, Because thou hast sent letters in thine own name unto all the
people that are at Jerusalem, and to Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, and to all the priests, saying,

contents.verseText: Jehovah hath made thee priest in the stead of Jehoiada the priest, that there may be officers in the house of Jehovah, for every man that is mad, and maketh himself a prophet, that thou shouldest put him in the stocks and in shackles.
contents: Jehovah hath made thee priest in the stead of Jehoiada the priest, that there may be officers in the house of Jehovah,
for every man that is mad, and maketh himself a prophet, that thou shouldest put him in the stocks and in shackles.

contents.verseText: Now therefore, why hast thou not rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth, who maketh himself a prophet to you,
contents: Now therefore, why hast thou not rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth, who maketh himself a prophet to you,

contents.verseText: forasmuch as he hath sent unto us in Babylon, saying, The captivity is long: build ye houses, and dwell in them; and plant gardens, and eat the fruit of them?
contents: forasmuch as he hath sent unto us in Babylon, saying,
is long: build ye houses, and dwell in them; and plant gardens, and eat the fruit of them?

contents.verseText: And Zephaniah the priest read this letter in the ears of Jeremiah the prophet.
contents: And Zephaniah the priest read this letter in the ears of Jeremiah the prophet.

contents.verseText: Then came the word of Jehovah unto Jeremiah, saying,
contents: Then came the word of Jehovah unto Jeremiah, saying,

contents.verseText: Send to all them of the captivity, saying, Thus saith Jehovah concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite: Because that Shemaiah hath prophesied unto you, and I sent him not, and he hath caused you to trust in a lie;
contents: Send to all them of the captivity, saying, Thus saith Jehovah concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite: Because that Shemaiah
hath prophesied unto you, and I sent him not, and he hath caused you to trust in a lie;

contents.verseText: therefore thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite, and his seed; he shall not have a man to dwell among this people, neither shall he behold the good that I will do unto my people, saith Jehovah, because he hath spoken rebellion against Jehovah.
contents: therefore thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite, and his seed; he shall not have a man to
dwell among this people, neither shall he behold the good that I will do unto my people, saith Jehovah, because he hath spoken
rebellion against Jehovah.

contents.verseText: The word that came to Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying,
contents: The word that came to Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying,

contents.verseText: Thus speaketh Jehovah, the God of Israel, saying, Write thee all the words that I have spoken unto thee in a book.
contents: Thus speaketh Jehovah, the God of Israel, saying, Write thee all the words that I have spoken unto thee in a book.

contents.verseText: For, lo, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will turn again the captivity of my people Israel and Judah, saith Jehovah; and I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.
contents: For, lo, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will turn again the captivity of my people Israel and Judah, saith Jehovah;
and I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.

contents.verseText: And these are the words that Jehovah spake concerning Israel and concerning Judah.
contents: And these are the words that Jehovah spake concerning Israel and concerning Judah.

contents.verseText: For thus saith Jehovah: We have heard a voice of trembling, of fear, and not of peace.
contents: For thus saith Jehovah: We have heard a voice of trembling, of fear, and not of peace.

contents.verseText: Ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child: wherefore do I see every man with his hands on his loins, as a woman in travail, and all faces are turned into paleness?
contents: Ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child: wherefore do I see every man with his hands on his loins, as a
woman in travail, and all faces are turned into paleness?

contents.verseText: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob’s trouble; but he shall be saved out of it.
contents: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob’s trouble; but he shall be saved out of
it.

contents.verseText: And it shall come to pass in that day, saith Jehovah of hosts, that I will break his yoke from off thy neck, and will burst thy bonds; and strangers shall no more make him their bondman;
contents: And it shall come to pass in that day, saith Jehovah of hosts, that I will break his yoke from off thy neck, and will
burst thy bonds; and strangers shall no more make him their bondman;

contents.verseText: but they shall serve Jehovah their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up unto them.
contents: but they shall serve Jehovah their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up unto them.

contents.verseText: Therefore fear thou not, O Jacob my servant, saith Jehovah; neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be quiet and at ease, and none shall make him afraid.
contents: Therefore fear thou not, O Jacob my servant, saith Jehovah; neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from
afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be quiet and at ease, and none shall
make him afraid.

contents.verseText: For I am with thee, saith Jehovah, to save thee: for I will make a full end of all the nations whither I have scattered thee, but I will not make a full end of thee; but I will correct thee in measure, and will in no wise leave thee unpunished.
contents: For I am with thee, saith Jehovah, to save thee: for I will make a full end of all the nations whither I have scattered
thee, but I will not make a full end of thee; but I will correct thee in measure, and will in no wise leave thee unpunished.

contents.verseText: For thus saith Jehovah, Thy hurt is incurable, and thy wound grievous.
contents: For thus saith Jehovah, Thy hurt is incurable, and thy wound grievous.

contents.verseText: There is none to plead thy cause, that thou mayest be bound up: thou hast no healing medicines.
contents: There is none to plead thy cause, that thou mayest be bound up: thou hast no healing medicines.

contents.verseText: All thy lovers have forgotten thee; they seek thee not: for I have wounded thee with the wound of an enemy, with the chastisement of a cruel one, for the greatness of thine iniquity, because thy sins were increased.
contents: All thy lovers have forgotten thee; they seek thee not: for I have wounded thee with the wound of an enemy, with the
chastisement of a cruel one, for the greatness of thine iniquity, because thy sins were increased.

contents.verseText: Why criest thou for thy hurt? thy pain is incurable: for the greatness of thine iniquity, because thy sins were increased, I have done these things unto thee.
contents: Why criest thou for thy hurt? thy pain is incurable: for the greatness of thine iniquity, because thy sins were
increased, I have done these things unto thee.

contents.verseText: Therefore all they that devour thee shall be devoured; and all thine adversaries, every one of them, shall go into captivity; and they that despoil thee shall be a spoil, and all that prey upon thee will I give for a prey.
contents: Therefore all they that devour thee shall be devoured; and all thine adversaries, every one of them, shall go into
captivity; and they that despoil thee shall be a spoil, and all that prey upon thee will I give for a prey.

contents.verseText: For I will restore health unto thee, and I will heal thee of thy wounds, saith Jehovah; because they have called thee an outcast, saying, It is Zion, whom no man seeketh after.
contents: For I will restore health unto thee, and I will heal thee of thy wounds, saith Jehovah; because they have called thee an
outcast,
, It is Zion, whom no man seeketh after.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, I will turn again the captivity of Jacob’s tents, and have compassion on his dwelling-places; and the city shall be builded upon its own hill, and the palace shall be inhabited after its own manner.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, I will turn again the captivity of Jacob’s tents, and have compassion on his dwelling-places;
and the city shall be builded upon its own hill, and the palace shall be inhabited after its own manner.

contents.verseText: And out of them shall proceed thanksgiving and the voice of them that make merry: and I will multiply them, and they shall not be few; I will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.
contents: And out of them shall proceed thanksgiving and the voice of them that make merry: and I will multiply them, and they
shall not be few; I will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.

contents.verseText: Their children also shall be as aforetime, and their congregation shall be established before me; and I will punish all that oppress them.
contents: Their children also shall be as aforetime, and their congregation shall be established before me; and I will punish all
that oppress them.

contents.verseText: And their prince shall be of themselves, and their ruler shall proceed from the midst of them; and I will cause him to draw near, and he shall approach unto me: for who is he that hath had boldness to approach unto me? saith Jehovah.
contents: And their prince shall be of themselves, and their ruler shall proceed from the midst of them; and I will cause him to
draw near, and he shall approach unto me: for who is he that hath had boldness to approach unto me? saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: And ye shall be my people, and I will be your God.
contents: And ye shall be my people, and I will be your God.

contents.verseText: Behold, the tempest of Jehovah, even his wrath, is gone forth, a sweeping tempest: it shall burst upon the head of the wicked.
contents: Behold, the tempest of Jehovah,
wrath, is gone forth, a sweeping tempest: it shall burst upon the head
of the wicked.

contents.verseText: The fierce anger of Jehovah shall not return, until he have executed, and till he have performed the intents of his heart: in the latter days ye shall understand it.
contents: The fierce anger of Jehovah shall not return, until he have executed, and till he have performed the intents of his
heart: in the latter days ye shall understand it.

contents.verseText: At that time, saith Jehovah, will I be the God of all the families of Israel, and they shall be my people.
contents: At that time, saith Jehovah, will I be the God of all the families of Israel, and they shall be my people.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah, The people that were left of the sword found favor in the wilderness; even Israel, when I went to cause him to rest.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah, The people that were left of the sword found favor in the wilderness; even Israel, when I went to
cause him to rest.

contents.verseText: Jehovah appeared of old unto me, saying, Yea, I have loved thee with an everlasting love: therefore with lovingkindness have I drawn thee.
contents: Jehovah appeared of old unto me,
, Yea, I have loved thee with an everlasting love: therefore with
lovingkindness have I drawn thee.

contents.verseText: Again will I build thee, and thou shalt be built, O virgin of Israel: again shalt thou be adorned with thy tabrets, and shalt go forth in the dances of them that make merry.
contents: Again will I build thee, and thou shalt be built, O virgin of Israel: again shalt thou be adorned with thy tabrets, and
shalt go forth in the dances of them that make merry.

contents.verseText: Again shalt thou plant vineyards upon the mountains of Samaria; the planters shall plant, and shall enjoy the fruit thereof.
contents: Again shalt thou plant vineyards upon the mountains of Samaria; the planters shall plant, and shall enjoy

contents.verseText: For there shall be a day, that the watchmen upon the hills of Ephraim shall cry, Arise ye, and let us go up to Zion unto Jehovah our God.
contents: For there shall be a day, that the watchmen upon the hills of Ephraim shall cry, Arise ye, and let us go up to Zion unto
Jehovah our God.

contents.verseText: For thus saith Jehovah, Sing with gladness for Jacob, and shout for the chief of the nations: publish ye, praise ye, and say, O Jehovah, save thy people, the remnant of Israel.
contents: For thus saith Jehovah, Sing with gladness for Jacob, and shout for the chief of the nations: publish ye, praise ye, and
say, O Jehovah, save thy people, the remnant of Israel.

contents.verseText: Behold, I will bring them from the north country, and gather them from the uttermost parts of the earth, and with them the blind and the lame, the woman with child and her that travaileth with child together: a great company shall they return hither.
contents: Behold, I will bring them from the north country, and gather them from the uttermost parts of the earth,
with them the blind and the lame, the woman with child and her that travaileth with child together: a great
company shall they return hither.

contents.verseText: They shall come with weeping; and with supplications will I lead them: I will cause them to walk by rivers of waters, in a straight way wherein they shall not stumble; for I am a father to Israel, and Ephraim is my first-born.
contents: They shall come with weeping; and with supplications will I lead them: I will cause them to walk by rivers of waters, in a
straight way wherein they shall not stumble; for I am a father to Israel, and Ephraim is my first-born.

contents.verseText: Hear the word of Jehovah, O ye nations, and declare it in the isles afar off; and say, He that scattered Israel will gather him, and keep him, as a shepherd doth his flock.
contents: Hear the word of Jehovah, O ye nations, and declare it in the isles afar off; and say, He that scattered Israel will
gather him, and keep him, as a shepherd doth his flock.

contents.verseText: For Jehovah hath ransomed Jacob, and redeemed him from the hand of him that was stronger than he.
contents: For Jehovah hath ransomed Jacob, and redeemed him from the hand of him that was stronger than he.

contents.verseText: And they shall come and sing in the height of Zion, and shall flow unto the goodness of Jehovah, to the grain, and to the new wine, and to the oil, and to the young of the flock and of the herd: and their soul shall be as a watered garden; and they shall not sorrow any more at all.
contents: And they shall come and sing in the height of Zion, and shall flow unto the goodness of Jehovah, to the grain, and to the
new wine, and to the oil, and to the young of the flock and of the herd: and their soul shall be as a watered garden; and they
shall not sorrow any more at all.

contents.verseText: Then shall the virgin rejoice in the dance, and the young men and the old together; for I will turn their mourning into joy, and will comfort them, and make them rejoice from their sorrow.
contents: Then shall the virgin rejoice in the dance, and the young men and the old together; for I will turn their mourning into
joy, and will comfort them, and make them rejoice from their sorrow.

contents.verseText: And I will satiate the soul of the priests with fatness, and my people shall be satisfied with my goodness, saith Jehovah.
contents: And I will satiate the soul of the priests with fatness, and my people shall be satisfied with my goodness, saith
Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah: A voice is heard in Ramah, lamentation, and bitter weeping, Rachel weeping for her children; she refuseth to be comforted for her children, because they are not.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah: A voice is heard in Ramah, lamentation, and bitter weeping, Rachel weeping for her children; she
refuseth to be comforted for her children, because they are not.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah: Refrain thy voice from weeping, and thine eyes from tears; for thy work shall be rewarded, saith Jehovah; and they shall come again from the land of the enemy.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah: Refrain thy voice from weeping, and thine eyes from tears; for thy work shall be rewarded, saith
Jehovah; and they shall come again from the land of the enemy.

contents.verseText: And there is hope for thy latter end, saith Jehovah; and thy children shall come again to their own border.
contents: And there is hope for thy latter end, saith Jehovah; and
children shall come again to their own border.

contents.verseText: I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning himself thus, Thou hast chastised me, and I was chastised, as a calf unaccustomed to the yoke: turn thou me, and I shall be turned; for thou art Jehovah my God.
contents: I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning himself
, Thou hast chastised me, and I was chastised, as a calf
unaccustomed
: turn thou me, and I shall be turned; for thou art Jehovah my God.

contents.verseText: Surely after that I was turned, I repented; and after that I was instructed, I smote upon my thigh: I was ashamed, yea, even confounded, because I did bear the reproach of my youth.
contents: Surely after that I was turned, I repented; and after that I was instructed, I smote upon my thigh: I was ashamed, yea,
even confounded, because I did bear the reproach of my youth.

contents.verseText: Is Ephraim my dear son? is he a darling child? for as often as I speak against him, I do earnestly remember him still: therefore my heart yearneth for him; I will surely have mercy upon him, saith Jehovah.
contents: Is Ephraim my dear son? is he a darling child? for as often as I speak against him, I do earnestly remember him still:
therefore my heart yearneth for him; I will surely have mercy upon him, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Set thee up waymarks, make thee guide-posts; set thy heart toward the highway, even the way by which thou wentest: turn again, O virgin of Israel, turn again to these thy cities.
contents: Set thee up waymarks, make thee guide-posts; set thy heart toward the highway, even the way by which thou wentest: turn
again, O virgin of Israel, turn again to these thy cities.

contents.verseText: How long wilt thou go hither and thither, O thou backsliding daughter? for Jehovah hath created a new thing in the earth: a woman shall encompass a man.
contents: How long wilt thou go hither and thither, O thou backsliding daughter? for Jehovah hath created a new thing in the earth:
a woman shall encompass a man.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, Yet again shall they use this speech in the land of Judah and in the cities thereof, when I shall bring again their captivity: Jehovah bless thee, O habitation of righteousness, O mountain of holiness.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, Yet again shall they use this speech in the land of Judah and in the
cities thereof, when I shall bring again their captivity: Jehovah bless thee, O habitation of righteousness, O mountain of
holiness.

contents.verseText: And Judah and all the cities thereof shall dwell therein together, the husbandmen, and they that go about with flocks.
contents: And Judah and all the cities thereof shall dwell therein together, the husbandmen, and they that go about with flocks.

contents.verseText: For I have satiated the weary soul, and every sorrowful soul have I replenished.
contents: For I have satiated the weary soul, and every sorrowful soul have I replenished.

contents.verseText: Upon this I awaked, and beheld; and my sleep was sweet unto me.
contents: Upon this I awaked, and beheld; and my sleep was sweet unto me.

contents.verseText: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man, and with the seed of beast.
contents: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man,
and with the seed of beast.

contents.verseText: And it shall come to pass that, like as I have watched over them to pluck up and to break down and to overthrow and to destroy and to afflict, so will I watch over them to build and to plant, saith Jehovah.
contents: And it shall come to pass that, like as I have watched over them to pluck up and to break down and to overthrow and to
destroy and to afflict, so will I watch over them to build and to plant, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: In those days they shall say no more, The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the children’s teeth are set on edge.
contents: In those days they shall say no more, The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the children’s teeth are set on edge.

contents.verseText: But every one shall die for his own iniquity: every man that eateth the sour grapes, his teeth shall be set on edge.
contents: But every one shall die for his own iniquity: every man that eateth the sour grapes, his teeth shall be set on edge.

contents.verseText: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel, and with the house of Judah:
contents: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel, and with the house of
Judah:

contents.verseText: not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day that I took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of Egypt; which my covenant they brake, although I was a husband unto them, saith Jehovah.
contents: not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day that I took them by the hand to bring them out of
the land of Egypt; which my covenant they brake, although I was a husband unto them, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: But this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, saith Jehovah: I will put my law in their inward parts, and in their heart will I write it; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.
contents: But this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, saith Jehovah: I will put my law in
their inward parts, and in their heart will I write it; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.

contents.verseText: And they shall teach no more every man his neighbor, and every man his brother, saying, Know Jehovah; for they shall all know me, from the least of them unto the greatest of them, saith Jehovah: for I will forgive their iniquity, and their sin will I remember no more.
contents: And they shall teach no more every man his neighbor, and every man his brother, saying, Know Jehovah; for they shall all
know me, from the least of them unto the greatest of them, saith Jehovah: for I will forgive their iniquity, and their sin will
I remember no more.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah, who giveth the sun for a light by day, and the ordinances of the moon and of the stars for a light by night, who stirreth up the sea, so that the waves thereof roar; Jehovah of hosts is his name:
contents: Thus saith Jehovah, who giveth the sun for a light by day, and the ordinances of the moon and of the stars for a light by
night, who stirreth up the sea, so that the waves thereof roar; Jehovah of hosts is his name:

contents.verseText: If these ordinances depart from before me, saith Jehovah, then the seed of Israel also shall cease from being a nation before me for ever.
contents: If these ordinances depart from before me, saith Jehovah, then the seed of Israel also shall cease from being a nation
before me for ever.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah: If heaven above can be measured, and the foundations of the earth searched out beneath, then will I also cast off all the seed of Israel for all that they have done, saith Jehovah.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah: If heaven above can be measured, and the foundations of the earth searched out beneath, then will I
also cast off all the seed of Israel for all that they have done, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that the city shall be built to Jehovah from the tower of Hananel unto the gate of the corner.
contents: Behold, the days come, saith Jehovah, that the city shall be built to Jehovah from the tower of Hananel unto the gate of
the corner.

contents.verseText: And the measuring line shall go out further straight onward unto the hill Gareb, and shall turn about unto Goah.
contents: And the measuring line shall go out further straight onward unto the hill Gareb, and shall turn about unto Goah.

contents.verseText: And the whole valley of the dead bodies and of the ashes, and all the fields unto the brook Kidron, unto the corner of the horse gate toward the east, shall be holy unto Jehovah; it shall not be plucked up, nor thrown down any more for ever.
contents: And the whole valley of the dead bodies and of the ashes, and all the fields unto the brook Kidron, unto the corner of
the horse gate toward the east, shall be holy unto Jehovah; it shall not be plucked up, nor thrown down any more for ever.

contents.verseText: The word that came to Jeremiah from Jehovah in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar.
contents: The word that came to Jeremiah from Jehovah in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of
Nebuchadrezzar.

contents.verseText: Now at that time the king of Babylon’s army was besieging Jerusalem; and Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of the guard, which was in the king of Judah’s house.
contents: Now at that time the king of Babylon’s army was besieging Jerusalem; and Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of
the guard, which was in the king of Judah’s house.

contents.verseText: For Zedekiah king of Judah had shut him up, saying, Wherefore dost thou prophesy, and say, Thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall take it;
contents: For Zedekiah king of Judah had shut him up, saying, Wherefore dost thou prophesy, and say, Thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I
will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall take it;

contents.verseText: and Zedekiah king of Judah shall not escape out of the hand of the Chaldeans, but shall surely be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, and shall speak with him mouth to mouth, and his eyes shall behold his eyes;
contents: and Zedekiah king of Judah shall not escape out of the hand of the Chaldeans, but shall surely be delivered into the hand
of the king of Babylon, and shall speak with him mouth to mouth, and his eyes shall behold his eyes;

contents.verseText: and he shall bring Zedekiah to Babylon, and there shall he be until I visit him, saith Jehovah: though ye fight with the Chaldeans, ye shall not prosper?
contents: and he shall bring Zedekiah to Babylon, and there shall he be until I visit him, saith Jehovah: though ye fight with the
Chaldeans, ye shall not prosper?

contents.verseText: And Jeremiah said, The word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
contents: And Jeremiah said, The word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,

contents.verseText: Behold, Hanamel the son of Shallum thine uncle shall come unto thee, saying, Buy thee my field that is in Anathoth; for the right of redemption is thine to buy it.
contents: Behold, Hanamel the son of Shallum thine uncle shall come unto thee, saying, Buy thee my field that is in Anathoth; for
the right of redemption is thine to buy it.

contents.verseText: So Hanamel mine uncle’s son came to me in the court of the guard according to the word of Jehovah, and said unto me, Buy my field, I pray thee, that is in Anathoth, which is in the land of Benjamin; for the right of inheritance is thine, and the redemption is thine; buy it for thyself. Then I knew that this was the word of Jehovah.
contents: So Hanamel mine uncle’s son came to me in the court of the guard according to the word of Jehovah, and said unto me, Buy
my field, I pray thee, that is in Anathoth, which is in the land of Benjamin; for the right of inheritance is thine, and the
redemption is thine; buy it for thyself. Then I knew that this was the word of Jehovah.

contents.verseText: My lord the king, these men have done evil in all that they have done to Jeremiah the prophet, whom they have cast into the dungeon; and he is like to die in the place where he is, because of the famine; for there is no more bread in the city.

contents.verseText: Then the king commanded Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, saying, Take from hence thirty men with thee, and take up Jeremiah the prophet out of the dungeon, before he die.
contents: Then the king commanded Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, saying, Take from hence thirty men with thee, and take up Jeremiah the
prophet out of the dungeon, before he die.

contents.verseText: So Ebed-melech took the men with him, and went into the house of the king under the treasury, and took thence rags and worn-out garments, and let them down by cords into the dungeon to Jeremiah.

contents.verseText: Then Zedekiah the king sent, and took Jeremiah the prophet unto him into the third entry that is in the house of Jehovah: and the king said unto Jeremiah, I will ask thee a thing; hide nothing from me.
contents: Then Zedekiah the king sent, and took Jeremiah the prophet unto him into the third entry that is in the house of Jehovah:

contents.verseText: Then Jeremiah said unto Zedekiah, If I declare it unto thee, wilt thou not surely put me to death? and if I give thee counsel, thou wilt not hearken unto me.
contents: Then Jeremiah said unto Zedekiah, If I declare it unto thee, wilt thou not surely put me to death? and if I give thee
counsel, thou wilt not hearken unto me.

contents.verseText: So Zedekiah the king sware secretly unto Jeremiah, saying, As Jehovah liveth, that made us this soul, I will not put thee to death, neither will I give thee into the hand of these men that seek thy life.
contents: So Zedekiah the king sware secretly unto Jeremiah, saying, As Jehovah liveth, that made us this soul, I will not put thee

contents.verseText: Then said Jeremiah unto Zedekiah, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of hosts, the God of Israel: If thou wilt go forth unto the king of Babylon’s princes, then thy soul shall live, and this city shall not be burned with fire; and thou shalt live, and thy house.

king of Babylon’s princes, then thy soul shall live, and this city shall not be burned with fire; and thou shalt live, and thy
house.

contents.verseText: But if thou wilt not go forth to the king of Babylon’s princes, then shall this city be given into the hand of the Chaldeans, and they shall burn it with fire, and thou shalt not escape out of their hand.
contents: But if thou wilt not go forth to the king of Babylon’s princes, then shall this city be given into the hand of the
Chaldeans, and they shall burn it with fire, and thou shalt not escape out of their hand.

contents.verseText: And Zedekiah the king said unto Jeremiah, I am afraid of the Jews that are fallen away to the Chaldeans, lest they deliver me into their hand, and they mock me.
contents: And Zedekiah the king said unto Jeremiah, I am afraid of the Jews that are fallen away to the Chaldeans, lest they

contents.verseText: But Jeremiah said, They shall not deliver thee. Obey, I beseech thee, the voice of Jehovah, in that which I speak unto thee: so it shall be well with thee, and thy soul shall live.

contents.verseText: But if thou refuse to go forth, this is the word that Jehovah hath showed me:

contents.verseText: behold, all the women that are left in the king of Judah’s house shall be brought forth to the king of Babylon’s princes, and those women shall say, Thy familiar friends have set thee on, and have prevailed over thee: now that thy feet are sunk in the mire, they are turned away back.

contents.verseText: And they shall bring out all thy wives and thy children to the Chaldeans; and thou shalt not escape out of their hand, but shalt be taken by the hand of the king of Babylon: and thou shalt cause this city to be burned with fire.

contents.verseText: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued after them, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho: and when they had taken him, they brought him up to Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath; and he gave judgment upon him.

contents.verseText: But I will deliver thee in that day, saith Jehovah; and thou shalt not be given into the hand of the men of whom thou art afraid.

contents.verseText: For I will surely save thee, and thou shalt not fall by the sword, but thy life shall be for a prey unto thee; because thou hast put thy trust in me, saith Jehovah.

, the men of war, and the women, and the children, and the eunuchs, whom he had brought back from Gibeon.

contents.verseText: And they departed, and dwelt in Geruth Chimham, which is by Beth-lehem, to go to enter into Egypt,
contents: And they departed, and dwelt in Geruth Chimham, which is by Beth-lehem, to go to enter into Egypt,

contents.verseText: because of the Chaldeans; for they were afraid of them, because Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had slain Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon made governor over the land.
contents: because of the Chaldeans; for they were afraid of them, because Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had slain Gedaliah the son
of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon made governor over the land.

contents.verseText: Then all the captains of the forces, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least even unto the greatest, came near,
contents: Then all the captains of the forces, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people
from the least even unto the greatest, came near,

contents.verseText: and said unto Jeremiah the prophet, Let, we pray thee, our supplication be presented before thee, and pray for us unto Jehovah thy God, even for all this remnant (for we are left but a few of many, as thine eyes do behold us),
contents: and said unto Jeremiah the prophet, Let, we pray thee, our supplication be presented before thee, and pray for us unto
Jehovah thy God, even for all this remnant (for we are left but a few of many, as thine eyes do behold us),

contents.verseText: that Jehovah thy God may show us the way wherein we should walk, and the thing that we should do.
contents: that Jehovah thy God may show us the way wherein we should walk, and the thing that we should do.

contents.verseText: Then Jeremiah the prophet said unto them, I have heard you; behold, I will pray unto Jehovah your God according to your words; and it shall come to pass that whatsoever thing Jehovah shall answer you, I will declare it unto you; I will keep nothing back from you.
contents: Then Jeremiah the prophet said unto them, I have heard you; behold, I will pray unto Jehovah your God according to your
words; and it shall come to pass that whatsoever thing Jehovah shall answer you, I will declare it unto you; I will keep
nothing back from you.

contents.verseText: Then they said to Jeremiah, Jehovah be a true and faithful witness amongst us, if we do not according to all the word wherewith Jehovah thy God shall send thee to us.
contents: Then they said to Jeremiah, Jehovah be a true and faithful witness amongst us, if we do not according to all the word
wherewith Jehovah thy God shall send thee to us.

contents.verseText: Whether it be good, or whether it be evil, we will obey the voice of Jehovah our God, to whom we send thee; that it may be well with us, when we obey the voice of Jehovah our God.
contents: Whether it be good, or whether it be evil, we will obey the voice of Jehovah our God, to whom we send thee; that it may be
well with us, when we obey the voice of Jehovah our God.

contents.verseText: And it came to pass after ten days, that the word of Jehovah came unto Jeremiah.
contents: And it came to pass after ten days, that the word of Jehovah came unto Jeremiah.

contents.verseText: Then called he Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with him, and all the people from the least even to the greatest,
contents: Then called he Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with him, and all the people from
the least even to the greatest,

contents.verseText: and said unto them, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, unto whom ye sent me to present your supplication before him:
contents: and said unto them, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, unto whom ye sent me to present your supplication before him:

contents.verseText: If ye will still abide in this land, then will I build you, and not pull you down, and I will plant you, and not pluck you up; for I repent me of the evil that I have done unto you.
contents: If ye will still abide in this land, then will I build you, and not pull you down, and I will plant you, and not pluck
you up; for I repent me of the evil that I have done unto you.

contents.verseText: Be not afraid of the king of Babylon, of whom ye are afraid; be not afraid of him, saith Jehovah: for I am with you to save you, and to deliver you from his hand.
contents: Be not afraid of the king of Babylon, of whom ye are afraid; be not afraid of him, saith Jehovah: for I am with you to
save you, and to deliver you from his hand.

contents.verseText: And I will grant you mercy, that he may have mercy upon you, and cause you to return to your own land.
contents: And I will grant you mercy, that he may have mercy upon you, and cause you to return to your own land.

contents.verseText: But if ye say, We will not dwell in this land; so that ye obey not the voice of Jehovah your God,
contents: But if ye say, We will not dwell in this land; so that ye obey not the voice of Jehovah your God,

contents.verseText: saying, No; but we will go into the land of Egypt, where we shall see no war, nor hear the sound of the trumpet, nor have hunger of bread; and there will we dwell:
contents: saying, No; but we will go into the land of Egypt, where we shall see no war, nor hear the sound of the trumpet, nor have
hunger of bread; and there will we dwell:

contents.verseText: now therefore hear ye the word of Jehovah, O remnant of Judah: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, If ye indeed set your faces to enter into Egypt, and go to sojourn there;
contents: now therefore hear ye the word of Jehovah, O remnant of Judah: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, If ye
indeed set your faces to enter into Egypt, and go to sojourn there;

contents.verseText: then it shall come to pass, that the sword, which ye fear, shall overtake you there in the land of Egypt; and the famine, whereof ye are afraid, shall follow hard after you there in Egypt; and there ye shall die.
contents: then it shall come to pass, that the sword, which ye fear, shall overtake you there in the land of Egypt; and the famine,
whereof ye are afraid, shall follow hard after you there in Egypt; and there ye shall die.

contents.verseText: So shall it be with all the men that set their faces to go into Egypt to sojourn there: they shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence; and none of them shall remain or escape from the evil that I will bring upon them.
contents: So shall it be with all the men that set their faces to go into Egypt to sojourn there: they shall die by the sword, by
the famine, and by the pestilence; and none of them shall remain or escape from the evil that I will bring upon them.

contents.verseText: For thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: As mine anger and my wrath hath been poured forth upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so shall my wrath be poured forth upon you, when ye shall enter into Egypt; and ye shall be an execration, and an astonishment, and a curse, and a reproach; and ye shall see this place no more.
contents: For thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: As mine anger and my wrath hath been poured forth upon the
inhabitants of Jerusalem, so shall my wrath be poured forth upon you, when ye shall enter into Egypt; and ye shall be an
execration, and an astonishment, and a curse, and a reproach; and ye shall see this place no more.

contents.verseText: Jehovah hath spoken concerning you, O remnant of Judah, Go ye not into Egypt: know certainly that I have testified unto you this day.
contents: Jehovah hath spoken concerning you, O remnant of Judah, Go ye not into Egypt: know certainly that I have testified unto
you this day.

contents.verseText: For ye have dealt deceitfully against your own souls; for ye sent me unto Jehovah your God, saying, Pray for us unto Jehovah our God; and according unto all that Jehovah our God shall say, so declare unto us, and we will do it.
contents: For ye have dealt deceitfully against your own souls; for ye sent me unto Jehovah your God, saying, Pray for us unto
Jehovah our God; and according unto all that Jehovah our God shall say, so declare unto us, and we will do it.

contents.verseText: And I have this day declared it to you; but ye have not obeyed the voice of Jehovah your God in anything for which he hath sent me unto you.
contents: And I have this day declared it to you; but ye have not obeyed the voice of Jehovah your God in anything for which he
hath sent me unto you.

contents.verseText: Now therefore know certainly that ye shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, in the place whither ye desire to go to sojourn there.
contents: Now therefore know certainly that ye shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, in the place whither
ye desire to go to sojourn there.

contents.verseText: And it came to pass that, when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking unto all the people all the words of Jehovah their God, wherewith Jehovah their God had sent him to them, even all these words,
contents: And it came to pass that, when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking unto all the people all the words of Jehovah their
God, wherewith Jehovah their God had sent him to them, even all these words,

contents.verseText: then spake Azariah the son of Hoshaiah, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the proud men, saying unto Jeremiah, Thou speakest falsely: Jehovah our God hath not sent thee to say, Ye shall not go into Egypt to sojourn there;
contents: then spake Azariah the son of Hoshaiah, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the proud men, saying unto Jeremiah, Thou
speakest falsely: Jehovah our God hath not sent thee to say, Ye shall not go into Egypt to sojourn there;

contents.verseText: but Baruch the son of Neriah setteth thee on against us, to deliver us into the hand of the Chaldeans, that they may put us to death, and carry us away captive to Babylon.
contents: but Baruch the son of Neriah setteth thee on against us, to deliver us into the hand of the Chaldeans, that they may put
us to death, and carry us away captive to Babylon.

contents.verseText: So Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, and all the people, obeyed not the voice of Jehovah, to dwell in the land of Judah.
contents: So Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, and all the people, obeyed not the voice of Jehovah, to
dwell in the land of Judah.

contents.verseText: But Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, took all the remnant of Judah, that were returned from all the nations whither they had been driven, to sojourn in the land of Judah;
contents: But Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, took all the remnant of Judah, that were returned from
all the nations whither they had been driven, to sojourn in the land of Judah;

contents.verseText: the men, and the women, and the children, and the king’s daughters, and every person that Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had left with Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan; and Jeremiah the prophet, and Baruch the son of Neriah;
contents: the men, and the women, and the children, and the king’s daughters, and every person that Nebuzaradan the captain of the
guard had left with Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan; and Jeremiah the prophet, and Baruch the son of Neriah;

contents.verseText: and they came into the land of Egypt; for they obeyed not the voice of Jehovah: and they came unto Tahpanhes.
contents: and they came into the land of Egypt; for they obeyed not the voice of Jehovah: and they came unto Tahpanhes.

contents.verseText: Then came the word of Jehovah unto Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,
contents: Then came the word of Jehovah unto Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,

contents.verseText: Take great stones in thy hand, and hide them in mortar in the brickwork, which is at the entry of Pharaoh’s house in Tahpanhes, in the sight of the men of Judah;
contents: Take great stones in thy hand, and hide them in mortar in the brickwork, which is at the entry of Pharaoh’s house in
Tahpanhes, in the sight of the men of Judah;

contents.verseText: and say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will send and take Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will set his throne upon these stones that I have hid; and he shall spread his royal pavilion over them.
contents: and say unto them, Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will send and take Nebuchadrezzar the king
of Babylon, my servant, and will set his throne upon these stones that I have hid; and he shall spread his royal pavilion over
them.

contents.verseText: And he shall come, and shall smite the land of Egypt; such as are for death shall be given to death, and such as are for captivity to captivity, and such as are for the sword to the sword.
contents: And he shall come, and shall smite the land of Egypt; such as are for death
to death, and such as are for captivity to captivity, and such as are for the sword to the sword.

contents.verseText: And I will kindle a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt; and he shall burn them, and carry them away captive: and he shall array himself with the land of Egypt, as a shepherd putteth on his garment; and he shall go forth from thence in peace.
contents: And I will kindle a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt; and he shall burn them, and carry them away captive: and he
shall array himself with the land of Egypt, as a shepherd putteth on his garment; and he shall go forth from thence in peace.

contents.verseText: He shall also break the pillars of Beth-shemesh, that is in the land of Egypt; and the houses of the gods of Egypt shall he burn with fire.
contents: He shall also break the pillars of Beth-shemesh, that is in the land of Egypt; and the houses of the gods of Egypt shall
he burn with fire.

contents.verseText: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews that dwelt in the land of Egypt, that dwelt at Migdol, and at Tahpanhes, and at Memphis, and in the country of Pathros, saying,
contents: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews that dwelt in the land of Egypt, that dwelt at Migdol, and at
Tahpanhes, and at Memphis, and in the country of Pathros, saying,

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Ye have seen all the evil that I have brought upon Jerusalem, and upon all the cities of Judah; and, behold, this day they are a desolation, and no man dwelleth therein,
contents: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Ye have seen all the evil that I have brought upon Jerusalem, and upon all
the cities of Judah; and, behold, this day they are a desolation, and no man dwelleth therein,

contents.verseText: because of their wickedness which they have committed to provoke me to anger, in that they went to burn incense, and to serve other gods, that they knew not, neither they, nor ye, nor your fathers.
contents: because of their wickedness which they have committed to provoke me to anger, in that they went to burn incense,
to serve other gods, that they knew not, neither they, nor ye, nor your fathers.

contents.verseText: Howbeit I sent unto you all my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them, saying, Oh, do not this abominable thing that I hate.
contents: Howbeit I sent unto you all my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them, saying, Oh, do not this abominable
thing that I hate.

contents.verseText: But they hearkened not, nor inclined their ear to turn from their wickedness, to burn no incense unto other gods.
contents: But they hearkened not, nor inclined their ear to turn from their wickedness, to burn no incense unto other gods.

contents.verseText: Wherefore my wrath and mine anger was poured forth, and was kindled in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem; and they are wasted and desolate, as it is this day.
contents: Wherefore my wrath and mine anger was poured forth, and was kindled in the cities of Judah and in the streets of
Jerusalem; and they are wasted and desolate, as it is this day.

contents.verseText: Therefore now thus saith Jehovah, the God of hosts, the God of Israel: Wherefore commit ye this great evil against your own souls, to cut off from you man and woman, infant and suckling, out of the midst of Judah, to leave you none remaining;
contents: Therefore now thus saith Jehovah, the God of hosts, the God of Israel: Wherefore commit ye
great evil against your own souls, to cut off from you man and woman, infant and suckling, out of the midst of
Judah, to leave you none remaining;

contents.verseText: in that ye provoke me unto anger with the works of your hands, burning incense unto other gods in the land of Egypt, whither ye are gone to sojourn; that ye may be cut off, and that ye may be a curse and a reproach among all the nations of the earth?
contents: in that ye provoke me unto anger with the works of your hands, burning incense unto other gods in the land of Egypt,
whither ye are gone to sojourn; that ye may be cut off, and that ye may be a curse and a reproach among all the nations of the
earth?

contents.verseText: Have ye forgotten the wickedness of your fathers, and the wickedness of the kings of Judah, and the wickedness of their wives, and your own wickedness, and the wickedness of your wives, which they committed in the land of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem?
contents: Have ye forgotten the wickedness of your fathers, and the wickedness of the kings of Judah, and the wickedness of their
wives, and your own wickedness, and the wickedness of your wives, which they committed in the land of Judah, and in the streets
of Jerusalem?

contents.verseText: They are not humbled even unto this day, neither have they feared, nor walked in my law, nor in my statutes, that I set before you and before your fathers.
contents: They are not humbled even unto this day, neither have they feared, nor walked in my law, nor in my statutes, that I set
before you and before your fathers.

contents.verseText: Therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will set my face against you for evil, even to cut off all Judah.
contents: Therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will set my face against you for evil, even to cut
off all Judah.

contents.verseText: And I will take the remnant of Judah, that have set their faces to go into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, and they shall all be consumed; in the land of Egypt shall they fall; they shall be consumed by the sword and by the famine; they shall die, from the least even unto the greatest, by the sword and by the famine; and they shall be an execration, and an astonishment, and a curse, and a reproach.
contents: And I will take the remnant of Judah, that have set their faces to go into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, and they
shall all be consumed; in the land of Egypt shall they fall; they shall be consumed by the sword and by the famine; they shall
die, from the least even unto the greatest, by the sword and by the famine; and they shall be an execration,
an astonishment, and a curse, and a reproach.

contents.verseText: For I will punish them that dwell in the land of Egypt, as I have punished Jerusalem, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence;
contents: For I will punish them that dwell in the land of Egypt, as I have punished Jerusalem, by the sword, by the famine, and by
the pestilence;

contents.verseText: so that none of the remnant of Judah, that are gone into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, shall escape or be left, to return into the land of Judah, to which they have a desire to return to dwell there: for none shall return save such as shall escape.
contents: so that none of the remnant of Judah, that are gone into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, shall escape or be left, to
return into the land of Judah, to which they have a desire to return to dwell there: for none shall return save such as shall
escape.

contents.verseText: Then all the men who knew that their wives burned incense unto other gods, and all the women that stood by, a great assembly, even all the people that dwelt in the land of Egypt, in Pathros, answered Jeremiah, saying,
contents: Then all the men who knew that their wives burned incense unto other gods, and all the women that stood by, a great
assembly, even all the people that dwelt in the land of Egypt, in Pathros, answered Jeremiah, saying,

contents.verseText: As for the word that thou hast spoken unto us in the name of Jehovah, we will not hearken unto thee.
contents: As for the word that thou hast spoken unto us in the name of Jehovah, we will not hearken unto thee.

contents.verseText: But we will certainly perform every word that is gone forth out of our mouth, to burn incense unto the queen of heaven, and to pour out drink-offerings unto her, as we have done, we and our fathers, our kings and our princes, in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem; for then had we plenty of victuals, and were well, and saw no evil.
contents: But we will certainly perform every word that is gone forth out of our mouth, to burn incense unto the queen of heaven,
and to pour out drink-offerings unto her, as we have done, we and our fathers, our kings and our princes, in the cities of
Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem; for then had we plenty of victuals, and were well, and saw no evil.

contents.verseText: But since we left off burning incense to the queen of heaven, and pouring out drink-offerings unto her, we have wanted all things, and have been consumed by the sword and by the famine.
contents: But since we left off burning incense to the queen of heaven, and pouring out drink-offerings unto her, we have wanted
all things, and have been consumed by the sword and by the famine.

contents.verseText: And when we burned incense to the queen of heaven, and poured out drink-offerings unto her, did we make her cakes to worship her, and pour out drink-offerings unto her, without our husbands?
contents: And when we burned incense to the queen of heaven, and poured out drink-offerings unto her, did we make her cakes to
worship her, and pour out drink-offerings unto her, without our husbands?

contents.verseText: Then Jeremiah said unto all the people, to the men, and to the women, even to all the people that had given him that answer, saying,
contents: Then Jeremiah said unto all the people, to the men, and to the women, even to all the people that had given him that
answer, saying,

contents.verseText: The incense that ye burned in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, ye and your fathers, your kings and your princes, and the people of the land, did not Jehovah remember them, and came it not into his mind?
contents: The incense that ye burned in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, ye and your fathers, your kings and
your princes, and the people of the land, did not Jehovah remember them, and came it not into his mind?

contents.verseText: so that Jehovah could not longer bear, because of the evil of your doings, and because of the abominations which ye have committed; therefore is your land become a desolation, and an astonishment, and a curse, without inhabitant, as it is this day.
contents: so that Jehovah could not longer bear, because of the evil of your doings, and because of the abominations which ye have
committed; therefore is your land become a desolation, and an astonishment, and a curse, without inhabitant, as it is this day.

contents.verseText: Because ye have burned incense, and because ye have sinned against Jehovah, and have not obeyed the voice of Jehovah, nor walked in his law, nor in his statutes, nor in his testimonies; therefore this evil is happened unto you, as it is this day.
contents: Because ye have burned incense, and because ye have sinned against Jehovah, and have not obeyed the voice of Jehovah, nor
walked in his law, nor in his statutes, nor in his testimonies; therefore this evil is happened unto you, as it is this day.

contents.verseText: Moreover Jeremiah said unto all the people, and to all the women, Hear the word of Jehovah, all Judah that are in the land of Egypt:
contents: Moreover Jeremiah said unto all the people, and to all the women, Hear the word of Jehovah, all Judah that are in the
land of Egypt:

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, saying, Ye and your wives have both spoken with your mouths, and with your hands have fulfilled it, saying, We will surely perform our vows that we have vowed, to burn incense to the queen of heaven, and to pour out drink-offerings unto her: establish then your vows, and perform your vows.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, saying, Ye and your wives have both spoken with your mouths, and with
your hands have fulfilled it, saying, We will surely perform our vows that we have vowed, to burn incense to the queen of
heaven, and to pour out drink-offerings unto her: establish then your vows, and perform your vows.

contents.verseText: Therefore hear ye the word of Jehovah, all Judah that dwell in the land of Egypt: Behold, I have sworn by my great name, saith Jehovah, that my name shall no more be named in the mouth of any man of Judah in all the land of Egypt, saying, As the Lord Jehovah liveth.
contents: Therefore hear ye the word of Jehovah, all Judah that dwell in the land of Egypt: Behold, I have sworn by my great name,
saith Jehovah, that my name shall no more be named in the mouth of any man of Judah in all the land of Egypt, saying, As the
Lord Jehovah liveth.

contents.verseText: Behold, I watch over them for evil, and not for good; and all the men of Judah that are in the land of Egypt shall be consumed by the sword and by the famine, until there be an end of them.
contents: Behold, I watch over them for evil, and not for good; and all the men of Judah that are in the land of Egypt shall be
consumed by the sword and by the famine, until there be an end of them.

contents.verseText: And they that escape the sword shall return out of the land of Egypt into the land of Judah, few in number; and all the remnant of Judah, that are gone into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, shall know whose word shall stand, mine, or theirs.
contents: And they that escape the sword shall return out of the land of Egypt into the land of Judah, few in number; and all the
remnant of Judah, that are gone into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, shall know whose word shall stand, mine, or theirs.

contents.verseText: And this shall be the sign unto you, saith Jehovah, that I will punish you in this place, that ye may know that my words shall surely stand against you for evil:
contents: And this shall be the sign unto you, saith Jehovah, that I will punish you in this place, that ye may know that my words
shall surely stand against you for evil:

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will give Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt into the hand of his enemies, and into the hand of them that seek his life; as I gave Zedekiah king of Judah into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, who was his enemy, and sought his life.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will give Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt into the hand of his enemies, and into the hand of
them that seek his life; as I gave Zedekiah king of Judah into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, who was his enemy,
and sought his life.

contents.verseText: The word that Jeremiah the prophet spake unto Baruch the son of Neriah, when he wrote these words in a book at the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying,
contents: The word that Jeremiah the prophet spake unto Baruch the son of Neriah, when he wrote these words in a book at the mouth
of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying,

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, unto thee, O Baruch:
contents: Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, unto thee, O Baruch:

contents.verseText: Thou didst say, Woe is me now! for Jehovah hath added sorrow to my pain; I am weary with my groaning, and I find no rest.
contents: Thou didst say, Woe is me now! for Jehovah hath added sorrow to my pain; I am weary with my groaning, and I find no rest.

contents.verseText: Thus shalt thou say unto him, Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, that which I have built will I break down, and that which I have planted I will pluck up; and this in the whole land.
contents: Thus shalt thou say unto him, Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, that which I have built will I break down, and that which I have
planted I will pluck up; and this in the whole land.

contents.verseText: And seekest thou great things for thyself? seek them not; for, behold, I will bring evil upon all flesh, saith Jehovah; but thy life will I give unto thee for a prey in all places whither thou goest.
contents: And seekest thou great things for thyself? seek them not; for, behold, I will bring evil upon all flesh, saith Jehovah;
but thy life will I give unto thee for a prey in all places whither thou goest.

contents.verseText: The word of Jehovah which came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.
contents: The word of Jehovah which came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.

contents.verseText: Of Egypt: concerning the army of Pharaoh-neco king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah.
contents: Of Egypt: concerning the army of Pharaoh-neco king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish, which
Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah.

contents.verseText: Prepare ye the buckler and shield, and draw near to battle.
contents: Prepare ye the buckler and shield, and draw near to battle.

contents.verseText: Harness the horses, and get up, ye horsemen, and stand forth with your helmets; furbish the spears, put on the coats of mail.
contents: Harness the horses, and get up, ye horsemen, and stand forth with your helmets; furbish the spears, put on the coats of
mail.

contents.verseText: Wherefore have I seen it? they are dismayed and are turned backward; and their mighty ones are beaten down, and are fled apace, and look not back: terror is on every side, saith Jehovah.
contents: Wherefore have I seen it? they are dismayed and are turned backward; and their mighty ones are beaten down, and are fled
apace, and look not back: terror is on every side, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: Let not the swift flee away, nor the mighty man escape; in the north by the river Euphrates have they stumbled and fallen.
contents: Let not the swift flee away, nor the mighty man escape; in the north by the river Euphrates have they stumbled and fallen.

contents.verseText: Who is this that riseth up like the Nile, whose waters toss themselves like the rivers?
contents: Who is this that riseth up like the Nile, whose waters toss themselves like the rivers?

contents.verseText: Egypt riseth up like the Nile, and his waters toss themselves like the rivers: and he saith, I will rise up, I will cover the earth; I will destroy cities and the inhabitants thereof.
contents: Egypt riseth up like the Nile, and his waters toss themselves like the rivers: and he saith, I will rise up, I will cover
the earth; I will destroy cities and the inhabitants thereof.

contents.verseText: Go up, ye horses; and rage, ye chariots; and let the mighty men go forth: Cush and Put, that handle the shield; and the Ludim, that handle and bend the bow.
contents: Go up, ye horses; and rage, ye chariots; and let the mighty men go forth: Cush and Put, that handle the shield; and the
Ludim, that handle and bend the bow.

contents.verseText: For that day is a day of the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, a day of vengeance, that he may avenge him of his adversaries: and the sword shall devour and be satiate, and shall drink its fill of their blood; for the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, hath a sacrifice in the north country by the river Euphrates.
contents: For that day is
of the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, a day of vengeance, that he may avenge him of his
adversaries: and the sword shall devour and be satiate, and shall drink its fill of their blood; for the Lord, Jehovah of
hosts, hath a sacrifice in the north country by the river Euphrates.

contents.verseText: Go up into Gilead, and take balm, O virgin daughter of Egypt: in vain dost thou use many medicines; there is no healing for thee.
contents: Go up into Gilead, and take balm, O virgin daughter of Egypt: in vain dost thou use many medicines; there is no healing
for thee.

contents.verseText: The nations have heard of thy shame, and the earth is full of thy cry; for the mighty man hath stumbled against the mighty, they are fallen both of them together.
contents: The nations have heard of thy shame, and the earth is full of thy cry; for the mighty man hath stumbled against the
mighty, they are fallen both of them together.

contents.verseText: The word that Jehovah spake to Jeremiah the prophet, how that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon should come and smite the land of Egypt.
contents: The word that Jehovah spake to Jeremiah the prophet, how that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon should come and smite the
land of Egypt.

contents.verseText: Declare ye in Egypt, and publish in Migdol, and publish in Memphis and in Tahpanhes: say ye, Stand forth, and prepare thee; for the sword hath devoured round about thee.
contents: Declare ye in Egypt, and publish in Migdol, and publish in Memphis and in Tahpanhes: say ye, Stand forth, and prepare
thee; for the sword hath devoured round about thee.

contents.verseText: Why are thy strong ones swept away? they stood not, because Jehovah did drive them.
contents: Why are thy strong ones swept away? they stood not, because Jehovah did drive them.

contents.verseText: He made many to stumble, yea, they fell one upon another: and they said, Arise, and let us go again to our own people, and to the land of our nativity, from the oppressing sword.
contents: He made many to stumble, yea, they fell one upon another: and they said, Arise, and let us go again to our own people,
and to the land of our nativity, from the oppressing sword.

contents.verseText: They cried there, Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a noise; he hath let the appointed time pass by.
contents: They cried there, Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a noise; he hath let the appointed time pass by.

contents.verseText: As I live, saith the King, whose name is Jehovah of hosts, surely like Tabor among the mountains, and like Carmel by the sea, so shall he come.
contents: As I live, saith the King, whose name is Jehovah of hosts, surely like Tabor among the mountains, and like Carmel by the
sea, so shall he come.

contents.verseText: O thou daughter that dwellest in Egypt, furnish thyself to go into captivity; for Memphis shall become a desolation, and shall be burnt up, without inhabitant.
contents: O thou daughter that dwellest in Egypt, furnish thyself to go into captivity; for Memphis shall become a desolation, and
shall be burnt up, without inhabitant.

contents.verseText: Egypt is a very fair heifer; but destruction out of the north is come, it is come.
contents: Egypt is a very fair heifer;
destruction out of the north is come, it is come.

contents.verseText: Also her hired men in the midst of her are like calves of the stall; for they also are turned back, they are fled away together, they did not stand: for the day of their calamity is come upon them, the time of their visitation.
contents: Also her hired men in the midst of her are like calves of the stall; for they also are turned back, they are fled away
together, they did not stand: for the day of their calamity is come upon them, the time of their visitation.

contents.verseText: The sound thereof shall go like the serpent; for they shall march with an army, and come against her with axes, as hewers of wood.
contents: The sound thereof shall go like the serpent; for they shall march with an army, and come against her with axes, as hewers
of wood.

contents.verseText: They shall cut down her forest, saith Jehovah, though it cannot be searched; because they are more than the locusts, and are innumerable.
contents: They shall cut down her forest, saith Jehovah, though it cannot be searched; because they are more than the locusts, and
are innumerable.

contents.verseText: The daughter of Egypt shall be put to shame; she shall be delivered into the hand of the people of the north.
contents: The daughter of Egypt shall be put to shame; she shall be delivered into the hand of the people of the north.

contents.verseText: Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, saith: Behold, I will punish Amon of No, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, with her gods, and her kings; even Pharaoh, and them that trust in him:
contents: Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, saith: Behold, I will punish Amon of No, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, with her gods, and
her kings; even Pharaoh, and them that trust in him:

contents.verseText: and I will deliver them into the hand of those that seek their lives, and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of his servants; and afterwards it shall be inhabited, as in the days of old, saith Jehovah.
contents: and I will deliver them into the hand of those that seek their lives, and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of
Babylon, and into the hand of his servants; and afterwards it shall be inhabited, as in the days of old, saith Jehovah.

contents.verseText: But fear not thou, O Jacob my servant, neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be quiet and at ease, and none shall make him afraid.
contents: But fear not thou, O Jacob my servant, neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed
from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be quiet and at ease, and none shall make him afraid.

contents.verseText: Fear not thou, O Jacob my servant, saith Jehovah; for I am with thee: for I will make a full end of all the nations whither I have driven thee; but I will not make a full end of thee, but I will correct thee in measure, and will in no wise leave thee unpunished.
contents: Fear not thou, O Jacob my servant, saith Jehovah; for I am with thee: for I will make a full end of all the nations
whither I have driven thee; but I will not make a full end of thee, but I will correct thee in measure, and will in no wise
leave thee unpunished.

contents.verseText: The word of Jehovah that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the Philistines, before that Pharaoh smote Gaza.
contents: The word of Jehovah that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the Philistines, before that Pharaoh smote Gaza.

contents.verseText: Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, waters rise up out of the north, and shall become an overflowing stream, and shall overflow the land and all that is therein, the city and them that dwell therein; and the men shall cry, and all the inhabitants of the land shall wail.
contents: Thus saith Jehovah: Behold, waters rise up out of the north, and shall become an overflowing stream, and shall overflow
the land and all that is therein, the city and them that dwell therein; and the men shall cry, and all the inhabitants of the
land shall wail.

contents.verseText: At the noise of the stamping of the hoofs of his strong ones, at the rushing of his chariots, at the rumbling of his wheels, the fathers look not back to their children for feebleness of hands;
contents: At the noise of the stamping of the hoofs of his strong ones, at the rushing of his chariots, at the rumbling of his
wheels, the fathers look not back to their children for feebleness of hands;

contents.verseText: because of the day that cometh to destroy all the Philistines, to cut off from Tyre and Sidon every helper that remaineth: for Jehovah will destroy the Philistines, the remnant of the isle of Caphtor.
contents: because of the day that cometh to destroy all the Philistines, to cut off from Tyre and Sidon every helper that remaineth:
for Jehovah will destroy the Philistines, the remnant of the isle of Caphtor.

contents.verseText: Baldness is come upon Gaza; Ashkelon is brought to nought, the remnant of their valley: how long wilt thou cut thyself?
contents: Baldness is come upon Gaza; Ashkelon is brought to nought, the remnant of their valley: how long wilt thou cut thyself?

contents.verseText: O thou sword of Jehovah, how long will it be ere thou be quiet? put up thyself into thy scabbard; rest, and be still.
contents: O thou sword of Jehovah, how long will it be ere thou be quiet? put up thyself into thy scabbard; rest, and be still.

contents.verseText: How canst thou be quiet, seeing Jehovah hath given thee a charge? Against Ashkelon, and against the sea-shore, there hath he appointed it.
contents: How canst thou be quiet, seeing Jehovah hath given thee a charge? Against Ashkelon, and against the sea-shore, there hath
he appointed it.

contents.verseText: Of Moab. Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Woe unto Nebo! for it is laid waste; Kiriathaim is put to shame, it is taken; Misgab is put to shame and broken down.
contents: Of Moab. Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Woe unto Nebo! for it is laid waste; Kiriathaim is put to shame,
it is taken; Misgab is put to shame and broken down.

contents.verseText: The praise of Moab is no more; in Heshbon they have devised evil against her: Come, and let us cut her off from being a nation. Thou also, O Madmen, shalt be brought to silence; the sword shall pursue thee.
contents: The praise of Moab is no more; in Heshbon they have devised evil against her: Come, and let us cut her off from being a
nation. Thou also, O Madmen, shalt be brought to silence; the sword shall pursue thee.

contents.verseText: The sound of a cry from Horonaim, desolation and great destruction!
contents: The sound of a cry from Horonaim, desolation and great destruction!

contents.verseText: Moab is destroyed; her little ones have caused a cry to be heard.
contents: Moab is destroyed; her little ones have caused a cry to be heard.

contents.verseText: For by the ascent of Luhith with continual weeping shall they go up; for at the descent of Horonaim they have heard the distress of the cry of destruction.
contents: For by the ascent of Luhith with continual weeping shall they go up; for at the descent of Horonaim they have heard the
distress of the cry of destruction.

contents.verseText: Flee, save your lives, and be like the heath in the wilderness.
contents: Flee, save your lives, and be like the heath in the wilderness.

contents.verseText: For, because thou hast trusted in thy works and in thy treasures, thou also shalt be taken: and Chemosh shall go forth into captivity, his priests and his princes together.
contents: For, because thou hast trusted in thy works and in thy treasures, thou also shalt be taken: and Chemosh shall go forth
into captivity, his priests and his princes together.

contents.verseText: And the destroyer shall come upon every city, and no city shall escape; the valley also shall perish, and the plain shall be destroyed; as Jehovah hath spoken.
contents: And the destroyer shall come upon every city, and no city shall escape; the valley also shall perish, and the plain shall
be destroyed; as Jehovah hath spoken.

contents.verseText: Give wings unto Moab, that she may fly and get her away: and her cities shall become a desolation, without any to dwell therein.
contents: Give wings unto Moab, that she may fly and get her away: and her cities shall become a desolation, without any to dwell
therein.

contents.verseText: Cursed be he that doeth the work of Jehovah negligently; and cursed be he that keepeth back his sword from blood.
contents: Cursed be he that doeth the work of Jehovah negligently; and cursed be he that keepeth back his sword from blood.
